Agilent's Software & Informatics Division represents one of the fastest-growing businesses within the company. Our OpenLab Suite of products is an essential ingredient in Agilent's continued business success in the marketplace. Use your experience as a Software Developer to produce the world's leading software for electronic content management and system automation deployed On-Prem and in the Cloud/SaaS.

This is an exciting opportunity for someone who is a self-starter, innovative and passionate about delivering world-class software and likes to work in a fast-paced environment. As such, the successful candidate will be involved in a next-generation product development incorporating the latest technologies to provide value to the customer.

Responsibilities include:

Design and development of products, components, processes, and systems using a range of engineering concepts and research techniques.

Lead/contribute to engineering efforts from design to implementation, solving complex technical challenges around developer and engineering productivity and velocity.

Analyze and decompose complex software systems and collaborate with cross-functional teams to influence design for testability.

Use product and customer application knowledge to determine, define, develop, and validate design concepts and methods.

Facilitate the transition of product design and enhancements to full production/delivery using Agile/SCRUM development methodologies.

Note: This role is a hybrid schedule (Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday onsite; Monday and Friday remote).

Qualifications

We are looking for a motivated and driven team player with 5+ years of experience working in software development, with the following experience, skills, and qualifications:

Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science / Software Engineering or equivalent.

Experience in developing in programming language and frame works like: Java – JavaScript / CSS / Angular / Python / React or C# .NET Core ASP.

Demonstrated ability in working with SQL, NoSQL and Cloud computing technologies

Experience writing code to generate visualizations that enable deeper insight into data.

Ability to simplify and communicate complex information in an easily understandable manner.

Independent, positive, and proactive approach to problem-solving within a team.

Excellent problem-solving skills, a positive and a “can-do” attitude.

Excellent teamwork and collaboration skills.

Experience working with cross-organizational, cross-geographical teams.

Knowledge of high-performance and resilient microservices and use of relevant design patterns.

Knowledge REST APIs and basic networking concepts.

Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.
Job Summary This role is VIRTUAL, however, MUST BE local to the Denver area to attend key meetings at the Denver, CO office. Responsible for coordinating and directing the design, development, implementation, and maintenance of data solutions and analyses that deliver business insights and actionable recommendations. Develops and fully owns internal business-partner relationships, particularly in the areas of revenue forecasting, business case, and pricing analysis. Leads a team of analysts with clarity, creativity, organization, and commitment to the team and customers, while collaborating with peer managers under shared goals. Proactively learns about the business and builds internal networks to be effective in influencing business decisions and driving change.
Job Description
Core Responsibilities
Own relationships with internal business-partners/customers and manage team’s projects from start to finish. Key internal customers include teams that are responsible for subscriber forecasting, revenue forecasting, pricing analyses, and business case analyses.
Engage the customer throughout the process and build strong working relationships.
Understand the customer’s needs for data and their concerns around the decision-making context. Examples include but not limited to:
Pre-event impact analyses to assess impacts on customers and operations and help incorporate anticipated changes in forecasts.
Post-event impact analyses to quantify observed impacts, validate forecast assumptions, and identify unanticipated changes.
Frame a business problem, develop a roadmap with an analytical approach, and deliver an aligned solution that leads to business insights and actionable recommendations.
Scope projects correctly and manage team’s efforts judiciously to meet competing priorities and project deadlines.
To maximize business impact and relationship building, follow up with the customer to strengthen the relationship, look for ways to leverage past projects, and present outputs to wider audiences.
Advanced SQL, Advanced Tableau, Intermediate Python skills are required along with basic knowledge of databricks .
Model leadership behaviors.
Lead the team with clarity, creativity, organization, and exemplary commitment to the team and customers.
Grow team members for their career growths. Cascade COMCAST’s culture and core values. Support a wider analyst community.
Effectively communicate and collaborate with peer managers to share the team’s accountability under a greater team environment.
Proactively learn new business developments and connect with others within and outside the department to expand business knowledge. Adapt projects to upcoming changes and changing customer needs and inform other team members who are working on related projects.
Dive impactful change through the coordination of multiple team efforts, both internal and external to the department.
Improve existing workflows or business processes using best practices and knowledge of internal and or external business issues.
Take a responsibility in acquiring new skills toward career development.
Work during the core business hours in the Mountain Standard Time time zone.
Perform other duties and responsibilities as they arise.
Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.
Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Education Level - Master's Degree preferred.
Field of Study – Business, Finance, Economics, Statistics, Decision Science, or related field.
Certifications – N/A.
Years Experience - Generally requires 3 years of relevant work experience.
Required technical skills: Advanced SQL, Advanced Tableau, Intermediate Python. (Basic knowledge of Databricks is preferred but not required.)

Employees at all levels are expected to:
Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for how you do your job.
Own the customer experience - think and act in ways that put our customers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint, and make them promoters of our products and services.
Know your stuff - be enthusiastic learners, users and advocates of our game-changing technology, products and services, especially our digital tools and experiences.
Win as a team - make big things happen by working together and being open to new ideas.
Be an active part of the Net Promoter System - a way of working that brings more employee and customer feedback into the company - by joining huddles, making call backs and helping us elevate opportunities to do better for our customers.
Drive results and growth.
Respect and promote inclusion & diversity.
Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communities.

Job Description:
The Enterprise Data Architect – Analytics & Insights, drives collaboration on ideation, design, development, and execution of long-range data & analytic technology, architecture, and capability roadmaps across all business and enterprise technology disciplines which anticipate future business needs and maximize long-term investment. This role works closely with strategy and executive business leaders to create alignment between business and technology as well as best practices and solutions around (disciplines) and operations to align with strategic intentions, identifies expected business outcomes, and explores implications and risks associated analytic engineering investment decisions. The Enterprise Data Architect establishes standards and solutions which align to CoBank’s strategic goals, and which provide clear constraints and guidelines for other architects and product delivery teams. The architect translates business drivers into hands-on analysis, architecture development and tactics, and communicates strategic direction to business and technology partners in the areas of advanced analytics, business intelligence (BI) reporting, data mining, visualization, data science, and AI. This role consults with information technology, data governance, data engineering, platform architecture, data analytics, product creation and development staff to understand desired business outcomes, design and implement scripts, programs, databases, software components and analyses that will support product quality and an in depth understanding of potential uses of the data in service of short and long term business objectives as guided by CoBank’s Key Strategic Priorities and prioiritized use cases. Serves as a primary contributor in the determination of what information/data the enterprise captures, leverages and retains. Advises and mentors other direct and indirect team members.


Essential Duties

The essential functions include, but are not limited to:

Serves as a key enterprise resource and subject matter expert (SME) in the areas of advanced data technologies and techniques, including data visualization, data virtualization,text mining, data discovery, statistical methods, reporting and analytics, data modeling, data product, and consults on data access, data integration, database design and implementation.
Assists with the definition of the multi-year EIM strategy and Digital Transformation roadmap. Defines supporting data strategies to help achieve the Enterprise Information Management roadmap for the enterprise; informing implementation and data management for the enterprise data warehouse and advanced data analytics and reporting systems informed by new data sources, publicly available data, and business-to-business partnerships. Defines and develops a solution architecture approach to data and analytic consumption strategy.
The enterprise data architect establishes an analytic and insights strategy and roadmap that enables a business function to leverage and support current and future business capabilities. They drive design, analytic patterns, reusable semantic layer, and envision architectures which promotes centralization of core capabilities and federation through self-service. Relying on continuous business and technical feedback, the architect will foster adaptive design, engineering practices, and drive the teams to rally around a shared technical vision.
Influence future-state data science, modeling, experimentation, and in collaboration with engineering and platform facilitate scale through modern compute such Machine Learning (ML)
Leads Business Intelligence, Analytic, or Data Science projects and works with the Business SMEs and IT Business Analysts to understand business objectives and strategies and recommend innovative data solutions. Collect business requirements from business partners and transform the requirements into data processes and data schemas. Draws conclusions and effectively communicates findings with both technical and non-technical team members, providing active leadership skills across project team and business community and ensure a successful implementation.
Creates and maintains the enterprise data architecture, strategy, standards, policies, and best practices to support the business and technology initiatives in support of analytic and insight capability.
Establishes standards and guidelines for the design & development, tuning, deployment and maintenance of information, advanced data analytics, and data mining models and physical data persistence technologies. Evaluates and designs data collection, data staging, data movement, analytics delivery, data quality and archiving strategies.
Act as an Analytic and Insights Subject Matter Expert (SME) on strategic initiatives and ensure that all aspects of the solution are compliant with established Enterprise data architecture best practices and the Digital Transformation roadmap.
Develops and maintains enterprise data dictionary as part of the multi-year IT strategy and Enterprise Information Management roadmap. Resolve semantic discrepancies in data definitions that arise among multiple sources and projects.
Collaborates with the business and other IT areas to create and implement a long term data storage and business continuity strategy including backup & recovery and data storage and archiving.
Measures the effectiveness of various enterprise data standards and policies and proactively recommends and activates additional guidelines, standards and policies. Socializes, refines and implements reccomendations with Architecture Review Board.
Collaborate with leaders within the Enteprise Data Capabilities and Data Products team and Enterprise Architecture to develop and monitor Key Risk Indicators (KRI), enabling measurement of successful adoption and adherence of architecture standards, processes, and guidelines.
Represent Enterprise Information Management (EIM) at the Architecture Review Board (ARB), ensuring that Enterprise Data Standards are actively adopted across application, technology, and analytic initiatives.
Work closely with other Enterprise Information Management and Data Capabilities and Product leaders to establish an actionable Analytics and Insights Center of Enablement (COE), continuously mentoring and evolving a disciplined practice of refer enable and repeatable standards and guidelines, creating a framework where project teams can self-serve their specific project needs in a federated manner.

Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Information Technology, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, or a related field
Ten (10) or more years of progressively responsible experience in a directly-related field, including five (5) or more years of information technology experience in data architecture, design and system integration.

Preferred Qualifications

Expert level understanding of Reporting, Business Intelligence, Diagnostic, and Descriptive Analytic capabilities and supported tools.
Demonstrated experience with advanced analytic capabilities such as Predictive and Prescriptive approaches using Data Science, Machine Learning, AI is required.
Advanced level ability to work with Diverse tools such as Tableau, SSRS, Cognos, Alteryx, Denodo, RapidMiner, SAS, Alteryx etc.
Extensive knowledge of relational SQL databases and SQL in at least one of the following environments: Oracle. Microsoft SQL Server or MySQL, as well as data modeling, both logical and physical.
Good understanding of fit-for-purpose NoSQL data stores such as Graph, Document, Key-Value Stores etc.
Extensive experience in multidimensional data modeling, such as star schemas, snowflakes, normalized and de-normalized models, handling “slow-changing” dimensions/attributes, and presentation through data virtualization, semantic layers, Enterprise Service Bus (ESB), and Data Services (API)
Extensive experience providing practical direction on information and analytics platforms in conjunction with EDW tools and technologies.
Experience with project management methodologies (e.g. SCRUM), ITIL and SDLC methodologies (e.g. DevOps, Data Observability, CI/CD etc.). Posesses a demonstrated ability to lead, with knowledge of project management concepts and implementation techniques, process reengineering, and change management.
Strong knowledge of business process, data or information management, data flows, data relationships, data quality standards, processes and proficiency with data analytical and quality tools.
Knowledge of the Microsoft Azure and/or AWS infrastructure and solution stacks operating in on-premise, cloud, and hybrid hosting environments preferred.
Experience in the creation and maintainence of canonical data models
Proficient in all aspects of enterprise data and information lifecycle management, and with proven experience and an understanding of a wide variety of analytical processes (governance, measurement, information security, etc.).
Excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills, with demonstrated ability to translate technical information to a non-technical audience at all levels of the organization; strong reporting and analytical skills with a focus on detail, thoroughness, and quality. Able to build consensus and communicate effectively with customers, business partners, IT resources and vendors.
Experience in the Financial Services and/or agricultural industry preferred, with a basic knowledge of banking and lending terminology preferred.


Special Requirements

Availability for occasional work outside normal business hours.
Availability for occasional travel.


Compensation Information

Estimated Base Salary Range: $140,000-$190,000
Target short-term incentive opportunity: 20%
About CoBank:

CoBank stands strong as an enterprise dedicated to the financial needs of rural communities. That means we help fund new ways to grow food, generate energy, access technology, and otherwise improve life in America. When you choose a career with us, you make a difference by doing work that matters. A career at CoBank can offer you the opportunity to make a personal impact on the people and communities where we do business. We also provide competitive compensation, health and wellness benefits, company-funded retirement plan, matching 401(k), and professional development programs.


CoBank will not consider a work visa H1B, EAD (Employment Authorization Document or Permit) or OPT (Optional Practical Training) for this position.
CoBank is an Equal Opportunity Employer.


CoBank requires all newly hired associates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, and new hires will be asked to register their proof of vaccination. Any offer of employment will be conditioned upon an applicant supplying proof of vaccination against COVID-19; provided, however that CoBank may provide a reasonable accommodation for an applicant’s known disability or sincerely held religious belief.

JOB ID: J-00267807-651
Introduction to the job
As Data Management Expert, you will work in ASML Silicon Valley Configuration Management team within Development and Engineering organization. Configuration Management team drives the performance and execution of the product change process, directly impacting ASML’s customers, factories and suppliers.
The mission of this position is to understand, extend, and enable D&E organization to provide data required by business process in order to realize business benefits and improvement to support our business growth and new requirements.
This position may require access to controlled technology, as defined in the Export Administration Regulations (15 C.F.R. § 730, et seq.). Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such controlled technology prior to beginning work. Business demands may require the Company to proceed with candidates who are immediately eligible to access controlled technology.

Role and responsibilities

As Data Management Expert, you will work on different assignments that improve master data management processes with primary focus on the ASML data policy. You will define, document and deploy new processes and where needed make adjustments to existing data management process that are impacted by the ASML data policy. You need understand the business users’ way of working with data, the user interfaces they use for data collection and the data blending that takes place behind the scene and enables data availability and quality towards the business users. You will initiate improvements based on feedback from stakeholders and experts.
You will closely work with data owners, other data experts and stakeholders to ensure high quality data management processes are developed.The deliverable will typically include change management that requires clear communication, documentation and training in order to deliver full value.
Your main responsibilities are:
Interview business stakeholders, understand and translate business process requirements into clear direction
Synthesizes the data quality issues into clear process improvements, in particular as they relate to the management of data between PLM systems and ERP systems.
Confer with technical or functional experts at all levels, company-wide, to obtain requirements, develop solution proposals, and coordinate implementation.
Define and document data management processes, with primary focus on the ASML data policy, in collaboration with respective other groups/sectors
Actively deploy master data management processes within the organization.
Define data management process metrics/KPI’s for measuring and controlling the effectiveness of processes and monitoring adherence to the data policy
Proactively seek opportunities that will support business goals and provide business users with alternatives that enhance business performance and efficiency.
Create and maintain work instructions, procedures and product master data quality solutions.
Facilitate the alignment of IT projects with business goals and objectives in US site.
Other ad-hoc projects as assigned. Actively develop, promote and apply project management techniques to assigned work and activities.

Education and experience

Bachelors or master’s degree in Industrial engineering & management, Information Technology, Business management or equivalent.
Preferably 2-7 years relevant work experience in supply chain, high-tech, manufacturing, engineering or semiconductor sectors.
Knowledge & experience of business processes in which data and quality of it play a role.
Knowledge& experience of following applications: Teamcenter, Arena, Oracle, SAP, Office365 suite, Sharepoint is a plus
Understanding of data governance and data quality concepts, familiarity in designing or working with a data management framework and processes

Skills

Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.
To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:

Motivated and enthusiastic team player.
Proactive personality who can deal with resistance, ability to perform in high-pressure environments.
Good communication and presentation skills.
Technical affinity and ability to quickly learn.
A strong can-do mentality with a hands-on focus.
Strong customer focus and commitment to customer satisfaction through prioritization, quality, efficiency.

Diversity & Inclusion

ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.

Other information

This position is available within HMI Configuration Management department. You will work on different levels in the organization, with project leaders, cross sector stakeholders (Development & Engineering, Supply Chain Management, Manufacturing, Customer Services departments and Program) to perform configuration management to achieve the perfect configurations throughout the organization of HMI.
Role within Office Responsibilities
Routinely required to sit; walk; talk; hear; use hands to keyboard, finger, handle, and feel; stoop, kneel, crouch, twist, reach, and stretch. Occasionally required to move around the campus.
Occasionally lift and/or move up to 20 pounds.
May require travel (domestic and international) dependent on business needs – 10%.
Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.
Can observe and respond to people and situations and interact with others encountered during work.
Can learn and apply new information or skills.
Must be able to read and interpret data, information, and documents.
Strong customer focus and commitment to customer satisfaction through prioritization, quality, efficiency and professionalism.
Ability to complete assignments with attention to detail and high degree of accuracy.
Proven ability to perform effectively in a demanding environment with changing workloads and deadlines.
Result driven-demonstrate ownership and accountability.
Identifies bottlenecks and drives improvements.
Work independently or as part of a team and follow through on assignments with minimal supervision.
Demonstrate open, clear, concise and professional communication.
Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with manager, co-workers and customer.
Work according to a strict set of procedures within the provided timelines.

Excellent communication and presentation skills (speaking and active listening)

Customer service orientation and ability to genuinely adapt/ respond to different types of personalities making the customer feel cared for, cared about, and appreciated

Job_title: Systems and Process Analyst – Centralized Recruiting (Salesforce, Oracle, Databases)
Job_description:
Systems and Process Analyst – Centralized Recruiting (Salesforce, Oracle, Databases) (Job Number: 2304016 )

Position Summary:

The Systems, Process, and Reporting Analyst will have shared responsibility with the Driver Hiring Center leader to ensure all telecom, CRM(Salesforce), and Recruiting (Oracle/Taleo) systems are functioning and integrating properly. This position will also provide all necessary reporting and analysis by integrating data from multiple systems to support hiring center KPIs. Through data, observations, and feedback from leadership you will provide staffing process and system analysis and recommend changes to improve efficiency.

This position will report directly to a Staffing Director and regularly interact with the hiring center manager and other corporate recruiting leaders. This position will also frequently partner with our internal HRIS team, IT, Telecom, various software SMEs, and external vendors to assure all systems support our hiring process.

Qualified candidates for this role will have at least 3 years of prior experience in the implementation and ongoing support of functional systems and processes. Preferred candidates will have prior experience supporting other recruiting or sales functions. Project management and process analysis also preferred. Bachelor’s degree or equivalent years of similar systems analyst level experience are required.

This role is based at our corporate office location in Reading, PA. Upon successful integration and training into the role, this role will be remote 2 days a week.

Responsibilities:

Implement, deploy, and maintain all necessary systems to support the Driver Hiring Center. These include: Salesforce.com, Oracle/Taleo Enterprise, NICE phone systems, Marketo, and various internal databases. Maintain necessary documentation for system upkeep and training.
Provide training and support to all staff on the use of all systems to perform efficiently. This includes ongoing system and process training as well as issue resolution and troubleshooting.
Conduct Driver Hiring Specialist process reviews, documenting findings and distributing findings to recruiting supervisors.
Ensure all systems and processes are designed for an optimal white-glove candidate experience.
Frequently collaborate with Penske’s HRIS, IT, Telecom, Marketing, Recruiting, and specialty software teams. Providing updates on systems usage and support, participating in internal user groups/forums, and sharing of best practices.
Compile weekly reporting and analysis and distribute to stakeholders. Compile monthly reporting, analyzing for trends. Maintain annual reporting.
Provide timely and validated data to any necessary internal databases
Identify opportunities to improve system through upgrades and implementations of new features.
Other projects as assigned by supervisor

Job Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent relevant systems analyst work experience
3 years of prior systems analyst roles supporting implementations and ongoing support of functional systems are required.
Prior experience supporting recruiting, sales, or contact center environment highly preferred.
Project management and process management highly preferred.
Prior experience with reporting and analysis required, quality certifications preferred
Familiar with recruiting concepts, practices and procedures
Have a full understanding of common functionality of applicants, hiring managers, and recruiters
Must have demonstrated internal customer service skills, including troubleshooting and problem solving experiences.
Must have demonstrated strong organizational and documentation skills
Strong analytical skills, with the ability to review reports and make recommendations
Able to communicate effectively both in-person and through written correspondences and presentations with candidates, peers, managers, and leadership.
Ability to work in dynamic, fast paced environment, and keep up with a high volume of activity
Regular, predictable, full attendance is an essential function of the job
Willingness to work the required schedule, work at the specific location required, complete Penske employment application, submit to a background investigation (to include past employment, education, and criminal history) and drug screening are required

Physical Requirements:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an associate to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
The associate must regularly lift and /or move up to 25lbs/12kg and occasionally lift and/or move up to 50lbs/23kg.
Specific vision abilities required by this job include Close vision, Distance vision, Peripheral vision, Depth perception and Ability to adjust focus.
While performing the duties of this Job, the associate is regularly required to stand; walk; sit and talk or hear. The associate is frequently required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms.

Penske is an equal opportunity employer

COMPANY PROFILE:

Penske Truck Leasing Co., L.P., headquartered in Reading, Pennsylvania, is a partnership of Penske Corporation, Penske Automotive Group and Mitsui & Co., Ltd. A leading global transportation services provider, Penske operates a premier fleet of vehicles and serves its customers from locations in North America, South America, Europe, Australia, and Asia. Penske’s product lines include full-service truck leasing, contract maintenance, commercial and consumer truck rentals, used truck sales, transportation and warehousing management and supply chain management solutions. Visit www.GoPenske.com to learn more.

Purpose

The main function of the Historian and Analytics Lead Engineer is to provide Administration and support with the installation, configuration, and support of OSI PI software and tools within the technical infrastructure. Develop Time saving analytics, Develop Business cases with stake holders in the Electric and Gas operations center.

Ensures that the stakeholder data security requirements necessary to protect the organization’s mission and business processes are adequately addressed in all aspects of cyber architecture including reference models, segment and solution architectures, and the resulting networks and systems supporting those missions and business processes.

Responsibilities
Support Grid Digitization through modeling real time data streams and creating a common Platform for Historian and Analytics.
Develop time saving use cases for Real time Analytics using the AVEVA PI historian suite of software tools.
Sizing and designing system level hardware requirements for OSI PI Systems and related interfaces.
Evaluate Asset Framework and PI Architecture designs to determine the adequacy of security design and architecture proposed or provided in response to Business area requirements.
Ensure appropriate levels of availability based on critical system functions and ensure that data requirements identify appropriate disaster recovery and continuity of operations requirements to include any appropriate fail-over/alternate site requirements, backup requirements, and material supportability requirements for system recover/restoration.
Provide input on data security requirements to be included in statements of work and other appropriate procurement documents.
Provide input to the Risk Management Framework process activities and related documentation (e.g., system life-cycle support plans, concept of operations, operational procedures, and maintenance training materials).
Define and document how the implementation of a new data systems or new interfaces between systems impacts the security posture of the current environment.
Define and document how implementation of new use cases support business objectives includes Cost benefit analysis.
Write detailed functional specifications that document data architecture requirements.
Document and update as necessary all data definition and architecture activities.
Determine the protection needs (i.e., security controls) for the data system(s) and network(s) and document appropriately.
Implementing Industrial Analytics/Smart Analytics using data from operational technologies to modify and optimize processes
Performing scheduled Industrial Life Cycle Management and maintenance on the PI system and other operational technology systems
Industrial Real-time System Administration for AVEVA/OSIsoft PI System, SEL Disturbance Monitoring, SKF, and Stack Vision, PQ View
Developing, deploying, and maintaining Utility Compliance documents (Federal and State), Creating Historian and analytics Process documents.
Automating and monitoring PLC, Telemetry, Control System, and SCADA data streams
Performing software updates, server upgrades, OSI PI software Patching of OT and IT servers
Implementing, configuring, and troubleshooting AVEVA/OSIsoft industrial interfaces and software products
Managing time series and relational databases.
Competencies
Be a role model
Be agile
Collaborate and Share
Develop Self & Others
Empower to grow
Focus to achieve results
Technical Skills
Skills and Requirements

Skills and Requirements

Education Required:

BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Data Science
5 years working with PI Historian Systems in an Administrator capacity
Understanding of data sets for both Gas and Electric Power Protection and Operations
Proven OSI PI historian best practices training
7 years of and Historian and Analytics program implementation experience

Experience Required:
Deep Knowledge of OSI PI Historian System Administration, Analytics, and Reporting
Familiarity with industry data collection standards (OPC, SCADA, MODBUS, Relational DB, Web Services, ODBC, XML, etc.)
Deep knowledge of Data Acquisition and Distributed Control systems, SCADA, and PI Interfaces.
Data concepts and protocols (especially OT), and system and network data security methodologies.
Database systems Oracle, MS SQL, MySQL, NoSQL
GIS and CIS Systems: ESRI GIS Data Structures, SAP Data Structures
Knowledge of critical infrastructure (NERC CIP)

Job_title: Data Scientist I/II, Strategic Planning & Forecasting (Contact Center Operations)
Job_description:
YOUR LIFE'S MISSION: POSSIBLE

You have goals, dreams, hobbies and things you’re passionate about.


What’s Important to You Is Important to Us
We’re looking for people who not only want to do meaningful, challenging work, keep their skills sharp and move ahead, but who also take time for the things that matter to them—friends, family and passions. And we're looking for team members who are passionate about our mission—making a difference in military members' and their families' lives. Together, we can make it happen.


Don’t take our word for it.

Military Times 2021 Best for Vets Employers
WayUp Top 100 Internship Programs
Forbes® 2022 The Best Employers for New Grads
Forbes® America's Best Employers
Newsweek Top 100 Most Loved Workplaces
FortuneBest Workplaces for Women
Fortune100 Best Companies to Work For®
Computerworld® Best Places to Work in IT

Basic Purpose

Provide independent data science, machine learning, and analytical insights using member, financial, and organizational data to support mission critical decision making for various areas of the organization. Understand business needs and identify opportunities for new products, services, and process optimization to meet business objectives through the use of cutting-edge data science. Create descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive models and insights to drive impact across the organization. Conduct work assignments of increasing complexity, under moderate supervision with some latitude for independent judgment. Intermediate professional within field; requires moderate skill set and proficiency in discipline.

Responsibilities


Support the delivery of strategic advanced analytics solutions across the organization with solutions drawing on descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analytics and modeling
Leverage a broad set of modern technologies – including Python, R, Scala, and Spark – to analyze and gain insights within large data sets
Manage, architect, and analyze big data in order to build data driven insights and high impact data models
Evaluate model design and performance and perform champion/challenger development. Analyze model input data, assumptions, and overall methodology.
Using statistical practices, analyze current and historical data to make predictions, identify risks, and opportunities, enabling better decisions on planned/future events
Provide analytics insights and solutions to solve complex business problems
Apply business knowledge and advanced statistical modeling techniques when building data structures and tools
Collaborate with other team members, subject matter experts, pods, and delivery teams to deliver strategic advanced analytic based solutions from design to deployment
Examine data from multiple sources and share insights with leadership and stakeholders
Transform data presented in models, charts, and tables into a format that is useful to the business and aids in effective decision making
Point of contact between the data analyst/data engineer and the project/functional analytics leads
Develop and maintain an understanding of relevant industry standards, best practices, business processes and technology used in modeling and within the financial services industry
Identify improvements to the way in which analytics service the entire function
Recognize potential issues and risks during the analytics project implementation and suggest mitigation strategies
Prepare project deliverables that are valued by the business and present them in such a manner that they are easily understood by project stakeholders
Perform other duties as assigned

Qualifications


Master’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering or another quantitative field, or related field, or the equivalent combination of education, training and experience
Skill interpreting, extrapolating, and interpolating data for statistical research and modeling
Advanced skill in Data Interpretation, Qualitative and Quantitative Analysis
Advanced skill in Python, R, SQL and querying (able to pull/transform your own data)
Ability to understand complex business problems and determine what aspects require optimization and articulate those aspects in a clear and concise manner
Advanced skill in communicating actionable insights using data to technical and non-technical audiences
Proven experience working in a dynamic, research-oriented groups with several ongoing concurrent projects
Demonstrates functional knowledge of data visualization libraries such as matplotlib or ggplot2; knowledge of other visualization tools such as Microsoft Power BI and Tableau
Ability to manipulate raw data within visualization tools to create effective dashboards that communicate end-to-end data outcomes visually
Proficient in storytelling with data skills
Exceptional technical writing skills
Advanced skill communicating thoughts, concepts, practices effectively at all levels, adjusting as needed to a target audience
Advanced verbal, interpersonal and written communication skills
Advanced database, word processing, spreadsheet, and presentation software skills (e.g., Microsoft Access, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.)
Moderate skill in descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analytics and modeling; demonstrated success in building models that are deployed and have made measurable business impact
Experience in using two or more of the following modeling types to solve business problems: classification, regression, time series, clustering, text analytics, survival, association, optimization, reinforcement learning
Working knowledge of advanced techniques such as: SMOTE, dimension reduction techniques, natural language processing, sentiment analysis, anomaly detection, geospatial analytics, etc.
Demonstrates a deep understanding of the modeling lifecycle
Moderate skill data mining, data wrangling, and data transformation with both structured and unstructured data; deep understanding of data models
Understanding of data models, large datasets, business/technical requirements, BI tools, statistical programming languages and libraries
Familiar with Data Engineering concepts
Familiar with the use of standard ETL tools and techniques
Familiar with the concepts and application of data mapping and building requirements
Demonstrates a deep understanding of multiple data related concepts
Familiar with Data Integration, Data Governance and Data Warehousing
Moderate skill in Data Management, Data Validation & Cleansing and Information Analysis

Desired Qualifications and Education Requirements


Doctoral degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering or another quantitative field, or related field
Working knowledge of Navy Federal Credit Union instructions, standards, and procedures
Familiar with project management concepts and frameworks such as Agile Frameworks (SAFE), Communication Strategy and Management, Delivery Excellence and Requirements management

Hours: Monday - Friday, 8:00AM - 4:30PM CT

Location: 820 Follin Lane Vienna, VA 22180 | 5550 Heritage Oaks Dr. Pensacola, FL 32526 | 141 Security Dr. Winchester, VA 22602

Level I Salary Range: $85,500 - $146,300 annually

Level II Salary Range: $98,500 - $168,400 annually

Navy Federal Credit Union assesses market data to establish salary ranges that enable us to remain competitive. You are paid within the salary range, based on your experience, location and market position.

Posting End Date: 03/16/2023

Job postings are subject to close early or extend out longer than the anticipated closing date at the hiring team’s discretion based on qualified applicant volume.

Coordinator IV – Data Fellow

Position Purpose

Manages and maintains databases for student and District data to enable accurate reporting and analyses of the data and reporting trends and outcomes for stakeholder use. Supports ADQ and other District staff in the access, reporting, and analyses of student data.


ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS

Ensures the integrity of all data for reports, analyses of data, and other analyses and reporting to increase student performance, with a focus on mission critical metrics.
Creates and designs queries, codes, and programs in SQL, SPSS, Crystal Reports, Visual Basic, Excel, Access, and other data management and reporting programs to generate information and graphic/tabular displays of the data to be provided to District, campus, and partner staff.
Generates and effectively communicates data reports on trends and other evidence that helps educators and stakeholders to use the data to make better decisions for students, as well as to put into place strong policies and practices.
Creates and maintains data files from state and local assessments, along with other relevant data.
Maintains effective liaisons with other District administrative staff and program managers to coordinate data collection and review prior to publishing reports and analyses.
Creates and maintains effective procedures and processes for organizing data including the transfer of data from the District data warehouse, assessment data reporting platforms, and Accountability & Data Quality file server.
Collaborates in the development and maintenance of automated programs and processes to generate student achievement and progress reports in various aggregated and disaggregated versions.
Remains abreast of technical innovations related to the storage and delivery of data to and from campuses and other departments; works with district and department leaders to streamline processes.
Interfaces with staff in Technology to ensure proper hardware and software functionality and user access to student assessment data.
Reviews and recommends training related to the use of programs, assessment data, and other relevant information.
Responds to ad-hoc data requests.

Personal Work Relationships

All Fort Worth ISD employees must maintain a commitment to the District’s mission, vision, and strategic goals.
Exhibits high professionalism, standards of conduct and work ethic.
Demonstrates high quality customer service; builds rapport/relationship with the consumer.
Demonstrates cultural competence in interactions with others; is respectful of co-workers; communicates and performs as a team player; promotes teamwork; responds and acts appropriately in confrontational situations.

Other Duties as Assigned

Performs all job-related duties as assigned and in accordance with Board rules, policies and regulations. All employees are expected to comply with lawful directives in rare situations driven by need where a team effort is required.

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

Knowledge of MS SQL or other enterprise databases.
Knowledge of applicable data privacy.
Knowledge of the Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills (TEKS).
Skill in troubleshooting difficult issues that may require extensive research, as well as considering all aspects of an issue including hardware, software, network, security issues, and potential programming issues.
Skill at the advanced level, working with Microsoft Office 365, especially Outlook, Teams, Access, Excel, PowerPoint, and Word.
Skill at the advanced level, working with databases, internet, and computer-based test development, scoring, and reporting systems.
Skill in collecting, organizing, and analyzing complex and technical data, and communicate findings to diverse audiences.
Skill in critical thinking; using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems.
Skill in performing mathematical and statistical calculations with accuracy.
Skill in preparing and conducting workshops and making presentations.
Skill in using qualitative and quantitative data to make decisions about teaching and learning, including student and teacher assessments.
Skill in working with initiatives that require collaboration with District and outside agencies and organizations.
Ability to process and handle confidential information
Ability to organize and coordinate work under pressure, meet tight deadlines, and proactively resolve issues.
Ability to understand conceptual ideas and develop programming which addresses and expands on the concepts appropriately.
Ability to communicate effectively, both oral and written forms, and articulate technical and management issues in a concise manner.
Ability to engage in self-evaluation with regard to performance and professional growth.
Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with others contacted in the course of work.

Travel Requirements

Travels to school district buildings and professional meetings as required.




Physical & Mental Demands, Work Hazards

Tools/Equipment Used: Standard office equipment, including computer and peripherals.
Posture: Prolonged sitting; occasional stooping, squatting, kneeling, bending, pushing/pulling, and twisting.
Motion: Frequent repetitive hand motions, including keyboarding and use of mouse; occasional reaching.
Lifting: Occasional light lifting and carrying (less than 15 pounds).
Environment: Works in an office setting; may require occasional irregular and/or prolonged hours.
Attendance: Regular and punctual attendance at the worksite is required for this position.
Mental Demands: Maintains emotional control under stress; works with frequent interruptions.

Minimum Required Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree from accredited college or university in statistics, computer science, education, mathematics or related field required;
Master’s degree from accredited college or university in statistics, computer science, education, mathematics or related field preferred.

Required Experience:

PC or mainframe database applications such as, SQL, Oracle;
SQL Server and other data base engines;
ASP, JAVA, HTML, DHTML and other forms of internet programming languages;
SPSS, Microsoft Office including Excel and Access, MS Reporting Services, Crystal Reports, and other software as tools for data management, analysis, and reporting/presentation.
Preferred Experience:

Experience in applied quantitative analysis preferred.

About the job
We are seeking a self-directed, inquisitive, and enthusiastic Lead Data Analyst to join our dynamic, fast-growing team in Canada/ US. In this role, the candidate is expected to understand, manipulate, analyze, and infer insights and trends from larger healthcare data assets and to articulate the same to Clarivate's RWD customers.
About You – experience, education, skills, and accomplishments
Education: Background in quantitative sciences or studies with a healthcare focus or several years of work experience providing the same background.
Data management: Proficiency in general scripting languages including SQL
Prior experience in a client-facing role performing data analysis to solve client questions, synthesizing recommendations, and communicating results to clients and/or internal teams.
It would be great if you also had . . .
Post-undergraduate studies, graduate studies in a quantitative or medical discipline.
Strong proficiency in SQL or related languages, with minimum of 6+ years of experience
Healthcare data experience: Demonstrated background in using healthcare data in a project setting. Relevant data types include insurance claims data (diagnoses, procedures, physician/hospital data) or electronic health records (free-text analysis, lab results).
What will you be doing in this role?
Apply a mix of quantitative problem-solving skills and qualitative research to solve the questions of the pharmaceutical and medical device industries.
Collaborate with various teams (e.g., RWD domain experts, software developers, data analysts, and data scientists) on data initiatives and ensure optimal data delivery to clients.
Provide training to the clients purchasing Clarivate’s proprietary RWD products on the best practices and healthcare analysis with Clarivate’s RWD.
Provide training to the clients purchasing DRG’s proprietary RWD products on the best practices and healthcare analysis with DRG RWD.
Identify unexpected trends and patterns to identify possible anomalies and collaborate closely with different teams to do root cause analysis and solve data-related issues.
Work closely with the engineering team to provide analytical guidance and contribute to the codebase to build prototypes and models for new RWD driven product development.
Work closely with the domain experts to translate complex proprietary business rules and logic to scalable and optimal data process flows to enrich the RWD data product
About the Team
As part of a team of 9 – Combination of Analysts, Senior Analysts, Lead Analysts – you will be part of a highly collaborative group. This team is involved in high-visibility projects that feed directly into the development of strategy and revenue generation.

Do you want your voice heard and your actions to count?

Discover your opportunity with Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), the 6th largest financial group in the world. Across the globe, we’re 160,000 colleagues, striving to make a difference for every client, organization, and community we serve. We stand for our values, building long-term relationships, serving society, and fostering shared and sustainable growth for a better world.

With a vision to be the world’s most trusted financial group, it’s part of our culture to put people first, listen to new and diverse ideas and collaborate toward greater innovation, speed and agility. This means investing in talent, technologies, and tools that empower you to own your career.

Join MUFG, where being inspired is expected and making a meaningful impact is rewarded.

This is a remote position. A member of our recruitment team will discuss location preferences with you in more detail.

Summary:

In this role you will develop and deliver a comprehensive data & analytics strategy. You will implement long-term and short-term strategies for data aggregation and reporting solutions. You will utilize the Metrics Factory to drive analytical deliverables - ideation, data mining and complex data analysis, and present a business story with your recommended actions to leaders key stakeholders. You will also proactively build relationships and interact with peers and leaders to ensure business needs are heard and understood.

Job Description:

Streamline and automate processes to ensure data lineage, consistency, integrity, and transparency

Lead all aspects of requirements analysis, traceability, and testing for enhancements and projects that are small, medium, or large in size and/or complexity, while supporting those functions for large cross-functional or enterprise-wide initiatives

Perform day-to-day operational support; may mentor other analysts

Participate in the design and delivery of solutions that support the fundamental data and governance process

Handle multiple simultaneous data and reporting projects

Understand and translate business needs into data models supporting long-term solutions

Work with application developers to implement data strategies, build data flows, and develop conceptual data models

Create logical and physical data models using best practices to ensure high data quality and reduced redundancy

Optimize and update logical and physical data models to support new and existing projects

Maintain conceptual, logical, and physical data models along with corresponding metadata

Develop best practices for standard naming conventions and coding practices to ensure consistency of data models

Recommend opportunities for reuse of data models in new environments

Perform reverse engineering of physical data models from databases and SQL scripts

Evaluate data models and physical databases for variances and discrepancies

Validate business data objects for accuracy and completeness

Analyze data-related system integration challenges and propose appropriate solutions

Develop data models according to company standards

Advise colleagues and stakeholders on project limitations and capabilities, performance requirements, and interfaces

Review modifications to existing software to improve efficiency and performance

Examine new application design and recommend corrections if required

Undergraduate degree or equivalent experience

6-8 years' work experience doing quantitative analysis

8-10+ years’ experience in business intelligence, data modeling, data analytics or related discipline

Ability to champion process improvements

Expert knowledge in all business processes across an entire line of business, as well expertise in other lines of business and technology disciplines

Experience working with high-performing teams in complex program execution

Strong understanding of waterfall and agile methods, stakeholder management, budget management, risk management, and operations

Ability to create and maintain relationships with a wide range of stakeholders

Strong project management experience within technology organization

Hands on project and program management experience; track record of project go live implementations

Technology infrastructure or application development experience

Extensive knowledge of data model theory, database design, structured query language (SQL), and related data warehousing practices

Use of other data modeling tools will be considered with the core skill set: advanced SQL, Python (descriptive / predictive models), and Tableau Viz


Preferred:

Financial Institution and Technology industry experience

Experience with Cognos and Tableau and their respective consumption of data

Experience in Cyber Security analytics and reporting

Experience with Identity and Access Management

The typical base pay range for this role is between $125K – $150K depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience and location. This role may also be eligible for certain discretionary performance-based bonus and/or incentive compensation. Additionally, our Total Rewards program provides colleagues with a competitive benefits package (in accordance with the eligibility requirements and respective terms of each) that includes comprehensive health and wellness benefits, retirement plans, educational assistance and training programs, income replacement for qualified employees with disabilities, paid maternity and parental bonding leave, and paid vacation, sick days, and holidays.

Job_title: Program & Data Manager - DBH Prevention & Education
Job_description:
Davis Behavioral Health (DBH) is seeking a full-time Program & Data Manager to oversee program planning, implementation, evaluation, and reporting for Prevention & Education efforts in Davis County. The ideal candidate possesses excellent communication skills, is meticulous, creative, and is a strong team player.

Essential Functions

The essential functions assigned to the Program & Data Manager include, but are not limited to the following:

Gather, track, evaluate, and report on Prevention & Education efforts on the program, coalition, and county levels.
Create visual materials such as print and digital marketing, reporting charts, and infographics to market programs and highlight effectiveness.
Write and report on grants to support the Prevention & Education efforts in Davis County
Work with the Prevention Coordinator to illustrate the significance of prevention to key stakeholders, and strategize how to continue to grow support, funding, and community reach.
Oversee and manage all aspects of scheduling, set up, facilitation, and follow-up for DBH sponsored Prevention & Education programs, as well as community events, on occasion.
Supervise program instructors and childcare staff, and provide them support, training, and professional development.
Coordinate with the Prevention Team regarding Prevention & Education programming needs across the county, as well as in individual schools and coalition areas.
Work with Diversity Coordinator regarding potential program barriers and solutions for diverse populations within Davis County

Preference may be given for candidates who use his/her own recovery experience and training to assist consumers.

Schedule

This position works in an office setting 40 hours per week. May be required to work occasional evening hours and weekends, as needed. Limited remote work may be allowed. There will be periodic travel required.

The successful candidate will primarily work a Monday through Friday day schedule but will be required to be flexible to attend required meetings, trainings, and other events associated with the role of Program and Data Manager as well as to oversee and supervise the prevention and education efforts, which mostly take place in the evening hours.

Compensation

The starting annual wage for the successful candidates is outlined below:

$55,000.00 per annum for candidates with a Master's degree (exempt FLSA status)
$21.00 per hour for candidates with a Bachelor's degree (non-exempt FLSA status)
Spanish-language incentive stipend (paid bi-weekly) available. Must pass a verbal Spanish-language proficiency assessment to qualify.

Davis Behavioral Health, Inc.

Davis Behavioral Health's mission is to provide access to quality behavioral healthcare by:

Adhering to principles of choice, safety, transparency, and collaboration with our clients, staff, and partners;
Utilizing evidence-informed practices to best serve our clients; and
Being fiscally wise and responsible.

Davis Behavioral Health understands that excellent clinicians are vital to meeting the standards established by its mission and vision statements.

It is highly preferred that individuals who are interested in obtaining employment at DBH, their spouse, or one of their dependents not be actively receiving services at DBH except for medication management services to eliminate/avoid possible conflicts or uncomfortable boundaries.

DBH understands that excellent employees are vital to meeting the standards established by its mission and vision statements. DBH is committed to excellence in community-based behavioral health treatment, progressive, vital and continually responsive to the needs of the community, and advocates for the behavioral health needs of our clients.

Davis Behavioral Health is an equal opportunity employer.

Required Experience

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Public Health, Social Work, Communication, Business, or other related fields, required. Master’s Degree preferred.
Experience with program development and implementation.
Ability to collaborate well with people of all ages and backgrounds.
Must be willing to complete a criminal background check and pre-employment drug screen.
Valid Utah Driver’s License in good standing.
Must have own transportation.

Required Skills and Abilities

Strong, effective, clear, and concise communication skills, both oral and written
Organized and meticulous.
Dependable, with proven ability to work independently and follow-through with responsibilities.
Able to take initiative and solve problems effectively.
Gather, track, evaluate, and report program data.
Analyze and synthesize data into written and visual formats.
Computer skills, including familiarity with the Microsoft Office products, design software such as the Adobe Suite, and ability to learn new systems.
Perform effectively in stressful situations.

Preferred Skills and Abilities:

Knowledge of Prevention & Education programming and framework

The selected candidate must successfully pass a pre-employment criminal background check and drug screening. DBH will not hire individuals currently using illegal drugs or abusing alcohol; therefore, making employment at DBH conditional upon successfully passing pre-employment drug screening by providing a valid sample. Job_title: Managerial - Data and Systems Manager (Tier C) (SY22-23) (Anticipated Vacancy)
Job_description:
Boston Day and Evening Academy (BDEA) is seeking an extraordinary Data and Systems Manager to work in our school. BDEA is an innovative public high school that engages young adults to build a vision for their futures through supportive relationships and meaningful competency-based learning. BDEA students are 16 to 23 years old, having attended traditional schools where they may have felt lost, unsafe, or disengaged. Upon entering BDEA, students remain eager to succeed and flourish because they are listened to and respected for who they are and for the gifts they possess. Working with experienced faculty in an environment that blends strong academics and support, students are given the opportunity to earn a Boston Public Schools diploma and to reach their fullest potential through a competency-based curriculum that inspires critical and creative thinking, independent learning, and active citizenship. As a competency-based school, BDEA does not have grade levels. Our extended program, beginning at 8am and running until 4:30pm serves students with different academic needs up to age 23, including those who are being promoted from middle school without being academically prepared for high school; those who have dropped out of high school and have decided to return to earn a diploma, and those who are unable to attend regular school hours due to health issues, full time work and/or full time parenting obligations. The school employs 60 full and part-time staff to work with 405 students and is governed by an active Board of Trustees. All employees of the school are expected to uphold the mission of the school to build a consistent, unified, anti-racist, inclusive community that stimulates greater student agency, engagement, and academic achievement

The Data and Systems Manager will manage multiple tasks related to the school’s accountability requirements relative to assessments, and data collection, analysis, and reporting. This person will manage BDEA’s unique data infrastructure CONNECTs built on the SalesForce platform. Working collaboratively with the school staff and leadership team, the developer helps to streamline and improve whole school system efficiencies.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:

Systems Development

Develop and manage system infrastructure(s) across various platforms (PowerSchool, Salesforce, and Schoology) to make work more sustainable
Develop API crosswalks and connections from software to software to ensure streamlined computing of benchmarks, scheduling, and attendance
Continually identify new approaches to efficiency while integrating user feedback into improvement practices
Perform new user setup, user maintenance, workflow rules, permission allowances, customizations. reporting and dashboard configurations, data security, and training across various systems
Ensure system sustainability across various platforms, including on-going training, notification of system updates, and documentation of capabilities.

Student Assessments

Collaboratively provide oversight of BDEA’s Systems and Technology Associate to accurately monitor the school’s performance toward state accountability indicators
Ensure accurate rostering and data uploads for each assessment (MCAS, WIDA, and other state assessments)
Order, receive, safeguard, and ship materials
Ensure proper staffing and training of test proctors
Distribute results to staff, students, and families
Monitor and ensures accurate completion and informed use of school-wide data (e.g., student performance, attendance, graduation, and dropout), including required assessment tools for existing and new programs
Use data analysis as a foundation for developing, implementing, and monitoring student achievement and school wide initiatives/decision-making

Data Management

Lead processes for data retrieval and analysis used to inform key staff and programs at BDEA
Understand the priorities of the various school programs and departments and incorporate their needs into a data collection and analyses process
Develop, coordinate, and administer surveys (students, families) to solicit input regarding school climate, attendance, programming, scheduling, safety, health and wellness, etc. in order to identify and address barriers to improving student outcomes, highlight promising practices
Using data from surveys and other databases, identify challenges and successes. This will be an opportunity to help quantitatively define the systemic problems faced by the school and help monitor ongoing efforts to address them
Highlight policy changes or program intervention where necessary

Communications

Report data from surveys and mine data for additional analyses to inform the work of multiple departments and programs
Summarize findings and outcomes in clear and concise reports to be presented to appropriate administrators, board, and staff
Assist Head of School with all Board of Trustees communications and accountability requirements
Performs other related duties as requested by the Head of School

Terms: BPS Managerial Class, Tier C, step based on experience. As a Horace Mann Charter School, employees are paid a competitive salary in accordance with the BPS managerial scale. The position is 223 work days between July 1st and June 30th each year. The employee will be required to adhere to the work conditions, including calendar, schedule and flexibility established by the School. The work schedule will be set by the staff member and the HoS according to school needs. Other benefits include Medical and Dental benefits, eligibility for City of Boston retirement.

Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree or higher, and a minimum of 2 years experience working in data analysis, collection, & reporting.
Experience in program and/or project evaluation; analysis of large, relational databases; excellent written and oral presentation skills.
Familiarity with state and other assessments, quantitative data analyses, programming in SPSS or other statistical packages is an advantage.
Mastery of Excel is required.
Knowledge and comfort in the use of social media (Twitter, Facebook, text messaging)
Have excellent communication and organizational skills; Bilingual Spanish, Creole, other: a strong plus
Acute attention to detail and project completion
Strong and tested ability to participate effectively in teams; have collaborative management style
Passion for coordinating multiple “moving parts” (logistics, schedule, people, etc.)
Ability to work in a fast-paced, challenging environment
Be able to interact with young people and their families in a respectful and caring manner
Adhere to BDEA’s Non-Discrimination Policy (see below)
A sense of humor!

TERMS:

Managerial Tier C

Please refer to www.bostonpublicschools.org/ohc (under "Employee Benefits and Policies") for more information on salary and compensation. Salaries are listed by Unions and Grade/Step.

NOTE: School-based managerial employees will work 223 days between July 1st and June 30th each year. The 223 day work-year will include the 180 days in which school is in session, and the additional days will be determined by the employee and the principal or headmaster of the school. This position subject to the City of Boston residency requirement as well as U.S. citizenship.

School-based managerial employees are not eligible for vacation time or compensatory time. In the event of school cancellation due to snow or inclement weather, school-based managerial employees need not report to work.

The Boston Public Schools, in accordance with its nondiscrimination policies, does not discriminate in its programs, facilities, or employment or educational opportunities on the basis of race, color, age, criminal record (inquiries only), disability, homelessness, sex/gender, gender identity, religion, national origin, ancestry, sexual orientation, genetics or military status, and does not tolerate any form of retaliation, or bias-based intimidation, threat or harassment that demeans individuals’ dignity or interferes with their ability to learn or work.Show Less  Report

00029846


Occidental Petroleum Corporation (NYSE: OXY) is an international oil and gas exploration and production company, and its OxyChem subsidiary is a major North American chemical manufacturer. We are one of the largest U.S. oil and gas companies, based on equity market capitalization, with more than 40,000 employees and contractors worldwide.




Our greatest asset has been and will continue to be our people. We are looking for an experienced and motivated individual to fill the position of Sr. Advisor Ops Data Mgmt within our Data Management & Analytics function, based in (Houston, TX).

Lead Data Management initiatives and develop frameworks that drive operational efficiencies
Advanced knowledge of well data lifecycle from exploration through to development, drilling and completion, production, and eventual abandonment or relinquishment
In conjunction with IT, lead the design of the Data Management platform that supports heterogeneous data structures and cross-functional data integration to generate insights and support data driven analytical solutions
Collaborate with and lead multidisciplinary teams to design, evolve and drive compliance of approved data management standards, processes, and best practices, and where appropriate incorporated into solutions
Plan, design, develop. refine and maintain Data Architecture to meet critical business workflow requirement, develop standards and domain agnostic patterns for the Enterprise helping efficient storage and consumption of data assets.
Design, develop and own critical data management specific products, workflows, data mapping, data modeling, data pipelines and advice business units and data consumers on existing solution and workflows.
Continues to extend existing data architecture to support increasing user demands and application requirements.
Assesses and evaluates risk to understand the implications of design decisions and new technologies
Work closely with Data Scientists to ensure Data Framework provides required data and level of granularity for advanced Data Science projects to augment SaaS Cloud Data Framework data and provide Management Insights.
Cultivates relationships with peer data management groups and Enterprise Architects to ensure alignment, compliance, and long-term sustainability of our digital assets
Communicate and influence key stakeholders to support data focused programs and initiatives
Train and mentor team members on approaches and practices for root cause analysis, issue resolution, and customer communication
Proactively identify opportunities for automation and continuous improvements
Keep abreast of industry trends in project management and Geoscience



Bachelor’s degree in engineering, Geoscience or Computer Science, related field or equivalent experience
Master’s degree is a plus
A minimum of 8 years’ experience implementing and supporting complex data management initiatives including traditional Data Warehousing as well as modern data pipeline architecture and data flow optimization.
Documented experience managing real-time, high-frequency, streaming, structured, semi-structured complex datasets.
Engage directly with customers to participate in design and development of data integration and architecture solution according to functional and performance requirements
A minimum of 3 years’ experience in data engineering, data governance, and data architecture in an enterprise environment with focus on next generation initiatives
A minimum of two years hands-on experience with Big Data Platform and Data Lake implementation.
Deep subject matter expertise and hands-on experience in selecting, designing, optimizing, scaling, and implementing a Big Data Platform, tools and processes
Hands-on experience and proficiency in advanced data technologies – Oracle/MSSQL/, ArcSDE, JSON, XML, REST API,scripting languages (SQL, Python, R, Scala, shell) and DataOps/Big Data technology stack including NoSQL, Databricks, Snowflake, Spark, Kafka, StreamSets, NIFI, Solr etc.
Advanced knowledge of data management principles, data security, master data management, metadata management, real-time streaming data, and cloud technologies
Advanced knowledge and experience with O&G operational data flows from field through to technical applications and enterprise systems
Advanced knowledge of well data lifecycle from exploration through to development, drilling and completion, production, and eventual abandonment or relinquishment
Experience with data governance and data quality tools (i.e.: Informatica DQ, Informatica Axon, Collibra, etc.)
Develop complex data integrations and pipelines on high volume, high frequency datasets to enable AI & ML workflows (feature engineering, training, inference, alerting)
Experience designing and delivering hybrid-cloud data solutions, preferably with Azure and AWS.
Proficient at translating business problems into solutions including conceptual design, requirements definition, execution plan development leading to program delivery
Three years of experience managing technical data management projects leading to successful delivery having site or global level impact
Two years of experience presenting to senior and executive level leadership
Understanding of Data Science and related technologies

Behavioral

Ability to take ownership, engage, lead change, achieve results, adapt, problem solve, manage risk and drive tasks to completion
Ability to lead initiatives, multi-disciplinary project teams, and influence stakeholder buy-in
Participate in strategy and planning sessions and be recognized as a capable team member that delivers value
Demonstrated ability to deal with ambiguity and maintain effective performance under stressful and uncertain conditions
Excellent oral and written communication skills; proven ability to represent point of view and discuss technical information with the business users in business language
Willingness to both be a mentor, share knowledge while learning new technologies and recommending the best cloud data architecture/solution for the Enterprise.
Excellent team player, and self-driven individual who can multi-task, work independently under minimal supervision and deliver on commitments
Excellent analytical mind and proven problem-solving skills



Relocation: Will not be offered at this time
