Your Career Begins at Timken
If you're ready for a challenging career that provides you with the ability to advance personally and professionally, look to Timken. Our associates make the world more productive by improving the efficiency and reliability of the machinery that keeps industry in motion.

Purpose and Scope

Provide guidance and expertise to the global organization related to SAP Master Data Management for Order Management processes. This position is responsible for defining, documenting, assessing, and scrutinizing the business processes of Master Data within Order Management and identifying areas for potential improvement. Streamlines operations or develops solutions that allow for improved efficiency or increased productivity. Must also ensure processes are aligned with organization objectives and guidelines.




Responsibilities

Lead teams within the Master Data Management group and across the business, for the development and improvement of processes in the areas of Master Data used in Order Management.
Owner of complex end-to-end order customer master maintenance processes: application, documentation, testing, and training.
Responsible for the creation and adoption of standards for global compliance and master data integrity across the company including working with global business leaders to assure compliance and develop improvement projects.
Provides leadership for additional scope of global SAP implementations and efforts related to business process automation and SAP future design changes and functionality.
Effectively manage the day-to-day activities to ensure completion of key tasks and activities related to ensuring accuracy and that all master data is current and to correct any data anomalies.
Work with the team to evaluate business needs and priorities, liaise with key business partners and address team needs related to data management and order management processes.
Provide technical support for master data across all areas of the company and interface with process teams for SAP design, new functionality, and acquisitions.
Lead efforts in business automation of current processes related to Data within the Enterprise.
Develop automated scripts and solutions for automating business processes including the uploading of master data into SAP within a BPA environment.



TECHNICAL FUNCTIONS:




Experience with SAP ECC and related modules such as CRM, and MDM.
Experience with order management processes and customer master data.
Experience with Business Analysis and Process Mapping
Experience with MDM tools and processes including BPA development.
Advanced skills in Microsoft Office preferred, especially Teams, Project and Sharepoint.
Systems and technical aptitude to understand how data is structured.
Good organization and multi-tasking skills with ability to manage multiple activities.
Strong analytical skills, ability to process and structure qualitative and quantitative data in a way that can be shared with others to help facilitate informed business decision making.
Skilled at active listening, written and verbal communication.
Proven ability to work in a team environment, collaborating with peers and providing leadership or guidance as needed.
Must be proactive, self-starting and intrinsically motivated.



EDUCATION:




Required: Bachelor’s in Business, Supply Chain, Engineering , IT or related degree and 4+ years’ experience in Master Data Management.
Preferred: Master’s degree in Supply Chain, Engineering, IT or related degree and 2+ years’ experience in Master Data Management.
Candidate must be a U.S. Citizen or a U.S. Green Card holder due to accesses to munitions/ITAR restricted data.

Health Technology Data Analyst

Are you looking to make an immediate impact where you can help our clients solve their business challenges? Deloitte's Core Business Operations (CBO) portfolio operates at the center of our client's business. By joining our team, you could help C-suite and program leaders transform their organization and accelerate mission execution through emerging and disruptive technologies, innovative business models, retooled program operations, and industry-driven solutions.

Work you'll do

Provide expertise on Medicare, Medicaid, and Healthcare Analytics
Analyze, support, and develop data warehouse objects, data quality processes, design and develop fact and dimension tables, logical and physical database design, data modeling, reporting objects, and ETL processes
Perform data analysis and profiling
Interpret the rules for data integration and conversion
Drive client conversations around technical and functional design and specifications
Work in Cloud-based environment (AWS or Azure)
Implement technology-enabled business solutions for clients as part of a high-talent team

Required Qualifications:

Bachelors degree from an accredited college or university
5+ years of experience within a Consulting or Health Technology environment
3+ years of healthcare data analytics experience
Experience with one or more of the following: SQL/PLSQL, ETL, Cognos, R, Python, Tableau, QlikView, Power Bi, Business Objects
Ability to travel between 25%-50%
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future

Desired Qualifications:

Advanced experience with MMIS
Advanced experience with Health Data standards
Experience working in Cloud-based environment (AWS or Azure)
Oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills (MS Visio, MS PowerPoint)
The wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. At Deloitte, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is $80,000 to $99,000.
You may also be eligible to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program, subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors, including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance.

The team

Our Health Technology team implements repeatable solutions to solve our government clients' most critical health technology-related issues. We advise on, design, implement, and deploy solutions that are focused on government health agencies "heart of the business" issues including claims management, electronic health records, health information exchanges, health analytics, and health case management.

Our clients seek a fresh perspective on how to leverage reusable, interoperable, and flexible solutions that will enable them to reduce costs, improve health outcomes, ad respond to public health crises. Professionals will use their deep health, government, and technology consulting experience to strategically help solve our client's technology challenges.

How you'll grow

At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there's always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.

Privacy, Cybersecurity & Data Governance Counsel – 14814

Civil Service Title:

Agency Attorney OJ/MBF

Level:

Level 3

Division/Office:

Office of the General Counsel

Borough:

Manhattan

Posting End Date:

04/30/2023

Description:

Position Summary:Under the direction of the Deputy Counsel—Chief Privacy Officer (CPO), the Privacy, Cybersecurity & Data Governance Counsel (Privacy Counsel) will engage in difficult and complex legal and policy work that has significant legal, operational and policy impact for the New York City Department of Education (NYC DOE) and the students it serves. The Privacy Counsel will serve within the NYC DOE’s Office of the General Counsel (OGC), joining a team of high-performing, collaborative and dedicated legal and compliance professionals who serve as in-house counsel to the nation’s largest school district and New York’s largest employer and government agency. The Privacy Counsel will help develop and implement a data privacy program for the NYC DOE; will support and advise agency leadership on related privacy cybersecurity, data governance and records management issues; and will assist the CPO in addressing related matters.

Reports to:Deputy Counsel/CPO, Privacy

Direct Reports:None

Key Relationships: Chancellor’s Office; Office of the Chief Administrative Officer, including OGC, the Division of Information and Instructional Technology (DIIT), Contracts and Purchasing, and the Division of Human Capital; Office of the Chief School Operations Officer; Office of the First Deputy Chancellor; Office of the Chief Academic Officer, including the Research Policy and Support Group (RPSG); Division of School Climate and Wellness; Division of School Planning and Development; Division of Early Education and Student Enrollment; Division of Community Empowerment, Partnership and Communications; NYC Mayor’s Office for Information Privacy; NYC Law Department.

Responsibilities:

At the direction and under the supervision of the CPO, the attorney may perform any or all of the following functions and duties:

Privacy Program Development, Implementation and Administration

o Helps to develop, implement and administer a robust privacy, cybersecurity and data governance program.

o Drafts and advises on related regulations, policies, procedures, guidance and internal and external communications.

o Helps implement and administer the NYC DOE-wide data privacy training program

o Develops, conducts and/or reviews internal and external privacy impact assessments, data lifecycle management procedures, and appropriate internal data access controls.

o Promotes a culture of high data privacy ethics standards and responsibility.

Legal counsel

o Provides legal advice concerning privacy laws and regulations that impact the NYC DOE, including the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA) and NY Education Law §2-d.

o Provides legal advice to DOE senior leadership and other stakeholders on the DOE’s privacy, cybersecurity security, data management and data governance strategies and practices.

o Advises NYC DOE schools, programs and offices on privacy and cybersecurity perspectives in the development or use of new technology, products and applications. Supports building privacy and data security from the ground up and helps foster a “privacy by design” way of working.

o Conducts in-depth legal research as assigned; stays current on all applicable laws, regulations and industry best practices.

Transactional Work and Third Party Privacy Compliance and Data Management

o Drafts and reviews privacy-related provisions and agreements, including non-disclosure agreements, data use agreements, and memoranda of understanding

o Participates in negotiations with vendors, community based organizations and other entities regarding data privacy and cybersecurity compliance and contractual provisions

o Conducts and/or reviews data privacy and cybersecurity impact assessments or similar analyses of third party practices

o Reviews third party privacy policies, terms of use and other third party materials for compliance with applicable laws, regulations and DOE policies/best practices

Cybersecurity

o Works closely with DIIT and other stakeholders in the review and coordination of potential privacy or data security incidents, including incident investigations, identifying impacted data subjects, notification and other resolution efforts

o Drafts incident notification communications

o Advises the NYC DOE on risk mitigation initiatives and enhancing incident readiness and response

Regulator Inquiries, Litigation External Data Requests and Complaints

o Addresses privacy- and cyber-security related complaints received from third parties

o Provides legal support for external and internal investigations into alleged privacy violations

o Acts as liaison to other government agencies that have launched investigations or are handling complaints, including the US Department of Education, the NY State Education Department and the NYC Special Commissioner of Investigation for the NYC School District

o Advises DOE offices on requests for records by data subjects and third parties releases to ensure compliance with applicable privacy laws, including consent and identity verification procedures

o Represents the NYC DOE or acts as liaison in related litigation or administrative hearings

Data Governance and Data Lifecycle Management

o Advises the NYC DOE on information governance and data lifecycle management related matters, including data minimization, records management, record retention and data destruction

o Assists with e-discovery and litigation/responses to regulatory actions relating to cybersecurity and privacy, and supports e-discovery work within OGC as assigned

Inter-Agency Collaboration

Job_description:
Say Hello to Hubert!


We call Harrison, Ohio home. Our German roots run deep. We're owned by TAKKT AG based in Stuttgart, Germany, a Global group with business units in the US and Europe. We specialize in consulting with customers in the foodservice and food retail industries on issues and challenges they face and work hard to create fully vetted product solutions to address those needs.

Here's what we do at a very basic level: Walk into a grocery store. Take away all the products that you can actually buy. What's left? The signage, the shelving, the display vessels, the items used to prepare the food at the deli, right? That's what we sell! We're basically the behind-the-scenes product people for supermarkets, hotels, universities, and restaurants.

We're presenting an exciting opportunity for a Senior Divisional Director of Infrastructure and Data. This person will be responsible for the day-t-day and strategic plans of the TAKKT US based Foodservice Division’s infrastructure, network, security, technical support, and data needs.

What Makes This a Great Opportunity?

The Senior Divisional Director of Infrastructure and Data will manage the infrastructure teams, including system administrators, support technicians, and 3rd party vendors. In addition, you will be a part of the global infrastructure direction and decision team. This role will also manage data security, including but not exclusive t architecture, validation, hygiene, and availability.

General Overview of What You'll be Doing:

Responsible for day-to-day communication, trouble shootings, and leadership of the infrastructure and data teams
This includes the coordination, approval, and management of daily operations within (but not limited to) Network, Software, Hardware, Security and Data Analytics
Ensure all standards set for systems on the build and configuration of Windows servers/Linux Servers, backup and storage procedures, log reporting, and system performance monitoring
Ensure the configuration and operation of systems is appropriately documented, update as directed by management
Ensure maintenance activities to administer the systems, including but not limited to installation, configuration, and upgrades of servers, backup and restore procedures, anti-virus solutions, and analysis of performance
Ensure development, quality, efficiency, and maintenance of data, data strategy, and data sets
Provide recommendations for improving the efficiency of existing business processes based on finding from data analysis
Review data to identify patterns or trends that may indicate problems with business operations or customer satisfaction

What You Will Get:

Hybrid work environment with travel to Indianapolis, IN when necessary
Paid time off including vacation, holidays, and a volunteer day
Opportunity for career growth within this role
Competitive compensation commensurate with experience
Bonus program
Comprehensive benefit package including health and financial benefits
Paid Parental Leave
Tuition Reimbursement
401(k) with company match

What We're Looking For:

Must reside within the greater Cincinnati/Harrison, OH area
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Cybersecurity, Information Technology or a combination of Education and Experience
MCSE, CCNA and/or RHCSA certifications
5+ years of technical leadership experience
Experienced in a Matrixed work environment
Expertise in computer networks, network administration, and network installation
Expertise in system software strategy/maintenance across Microsoft and Linux.

Description:* Job Description*


Medical Specialists of the Palm Beaches, Inc.*

Position: Data Analyst
Reports To: Chief Analytics Officer
FLSA Status: Exempt
JOB SUMMARY
Provide analytical and consulting support to leadership making strategic data-related decisions by analyzing, manipulating, tracking, internally managing and reporting data. This entails working with our data systems to pull information using SQL, analyzing the information in Excel or other tools, and presenting the data to various leaders and/or staff within MSPB.
POSITION DESCRIPTION & DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:


Provide a high level of expertise in systems relating to assigned areas.
Respond to requests for detailed data to support report findings.
Act as an advisor or thought partner to the organization’s leadership by structuring undefined issues for resolution, researching issues, summarizing information.
Working with relevant stakeholders to provide the information needed to make sound and timely decisions.
Develop and maintain strong business relationships with internal business partners; including all levels of management, senior leaders, service chiefs, and other data users.
Perform analysis for problem solving and new methodologies by extracting data using tools such as SQL, SAS, MS Access and Crystal Reports; and compiling data from data systems.
Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.
Determines changes in physical database by studying project requirements; identifying database characteristics, such as location, amount of space, and access method.
Changes database system by coding database descriptions.
Protects database by developing access system; specifying user level of access.
Maintains user reference by writing and rewriting database descriptions.
Deliver high quality results on time.
Performs other duties as assigned.

Requirements:POSITION QUALIFICATIONS / EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:


Bachelor’s degree and experience with a healthcare organization strongly preferred.
Project management experience preferred.
Budgeting experience in healthcare preferred.

Working knowledge of the design, construction and use of complex relational databases required.


Highly proficient in MS Excel, Access and Visual Basic macros.
Highly proficient with SQL data tools, including SAS and SQL.
Strong analytical, organizational, and communication skills required.
Good written and verbal communication.

Strong experience in understanding business partner needs, documenting partner needs, documenting detailed report requirements, and the generation of reporting test cases.


Ability to express complex analytical and technical information to senior management or to audiences with clinical training.
Must demonstrate good judgment in regard to confidentiality policy and work independently.
Must adhere to confidentiality policy.

Physical Requirements: Must be able to walk, stand and sit intermittently. Upon occasions be able to assist in properly moving a patient. Be able to lift up to 30 pounds. May need to push or pull medical equipment. May have to stoop, bend knees and/or reach. Must be able to use the keyboard on a computer. Phone work required.
Additional Qualities: Develops and maintains good relationships with co-workers. Demonstrates good judgment when dealing with sensitive issues. Must have the ability to address sensitive issues in a confidential manner. Supports organizational and department goals. Commitment to the team approach and displays the ability to establish and maintain harmonious working relationships with other employees and the public. Contributes important information. Dresses appropriately for position. Maintains a high degree of dependability.

*
A Career at Rheem: Where Comfort Is Your Calling*
At Rheem, we’re dedicated to bringing comfort to people’s lives. And, as a leading global manufacturer of heating, cooling and water heating equipment, we’re innovating all-new ways to deliver just the right temperature while saving energy, water and supporting a more sustainable future. It’s an exciting challenge that requires a team of talented, passionate people with a diverse set of skills. From engineers to accountants, sales professionals to support experts, Rheem depends on people to power our innovations. Join Rheem, and help shape the future of products that impact people’s lives—every day.
The Sales Analyst I will be responsible optimizes the company's sales strategies by analyzing trends, preparing forecasts, and evaluating current performance to sales goals. Assists the Sales Managers in identifying sales opportunities and developing tactics to grow market share in assigned product category and channels.
This position will serve our Water Heater Division and is a field- based within an assigned territory. (Wisconsin)
WHAT YOU'LL DO:

Work closely with Demand Planning and Market Management on sales forecasts for assigned product categories and channels.
Work closely with Sales Managers, Product Managers and Market Managers to document market opportunities for new and existing products.
Conduct weekly, monthly, and yearly sales analysis for regions, territories, markets, customers, and category segments.
Monitor sales budgets and trends to ensure that key performance indicators are met.
Utilize DSS and MTMS to generate reports requested by Sales Managers.
Develop sales presentations for customer meetings and web content.
Provide market share analysis support for marketing management.
Develop and maintain customer profitability matrices.
Partner with Marketing and other functions to mine sales data for trends.
Analyze data and create reports, presentations, and data visualizations to communicate analysis and recommendations.
Manage customer’s inventory and ordering systems and recommend changes as needed to maintain customer KPI.
Track orders and shipments as needed.
Maintain and update customers product information pages.
Learn and utilize customer’s ordering and data management systems.
Provide analytical and reporting support to multiple internal departments.
Provide product and customer order support to dealer locations

Qualifications

Business Administration, Marketing or related degree from a college or university; or 2 to 4 years related experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Excellent communication skills, written and verbal, with attention to detail and accuracy.
Proficient computer skills and in-depth knowledge of relevant software such as MS Office Suite.
Demonstrated ability to work well with others in a matrix team environment.
Ability to work cross-functionally across organizations.
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills.
Experience in collecting and presenting statistical data and converting into reports.
Ability to analyze and interpret sales data and summary reports.
Ability to speak effectively before employees and groups of customers.
Advanced mathematical skills including the ability to calculate discounts, percentages, and commissions.
Strong analytical and reasoning skills.
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
Knowledge of Category Management principles and best practices

Job Description

Agilent's Software & Informatics Division represents one of the fastest-growing businesses within the company. Our OpenLab Suite of products is an essential ingredient in Agilent's continued business success in the marketplace. Use your experience as a Software Developer to produce the world's leading software for electronic content management and system automation deployed On-Prem and in the Cloud/SaaS.

This is an exciting opportunity for someone who is a self-starter, innovative and passionate about delivering world-class software and likes to work in a fast-paced environment. As such, the successful candidate will be involved in a next-generation product development incorporating the latest technologies to provide value to the customer.


Responsibilities include:

Designs, develops and performs manual and automated software tests, test plans and test cases on Agilent products to meet quality objectives in conformance with customer requirements and required standards and regulations.

Use programming languages (C#, Scripting Knowledge (Groovy, PowerShell) to write code for use in testing applications/software code as well as test tools and frameworks (Jenkins, Bitbucket) based upon functional and design specifications. Experience in performance testing (JMeter, Benchmark, Postman).

Performs analysis of test results and tracks/reports risk levels during test execution.

Responsible for diagnosing software/hardware/data interface problems and ensuring system integration.

Documents test results, including deviations and defects, for follow-up and modification of products.

Collaborates with peer engineers, architects and development engineers to address issues and resolve problems.

May review and approve peer test results.

May produce and implement the Software Quality Plan to ensure Agilent-s quality metrics are met.

May advise the work of third parties such as vendors, product partners, etc. to meet contract specified deliverables.

Note: This role is a hybrid schedule (Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday onsite; Monday and Friday remote).

Qualifications

We are looking for a motivated and driven team player with 5+ years of experience working in software development, with the following experience, skills, and qualifications:

Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science / Software Engineering or equivalent.

Experience in developing in programming language and frame works like: Java – JavaScript / CSS / Angular / Python / React or C# .NET Core ASP.

Demonstrated ability in working with SQL, NoSQL and Cloud computing technologies

Demonstrated testing experience in all phases of data science projects including problem definition, solution formulation, model building, productionizing, and delivering measurable impact.

Understanding of data structures and software/data product design principles.

Experience testing visualizations that enable deeper insight into data.

Ability to understand, process and extract value from scientific data.

Ability to simplify and communicate complex information in an easily understandable manner.

Independent, positive, and proactive approach to problem-solving within a team.

What will make you stand:

Working knowledge with Life Sciences such as Chromatography Data Systems is a plus.

Familiarity with Regulatory Compliance such as FDA 21 CFR Part 11, GDPR requirements.

Excellent problem-solving skills, a positive and a “can-do” attitude.

Excellent teamwork and collaboration skills.

Experience working with cross-organizational, cross-geographical teams.

Knowledge of high-performance and resilient microservices and use of relevant design patterns.

Having worked with containerized and cloud deployments is a plus (ex: Kubernetes, Docker, Terraform, ...).

Familiarity with both Windows and Linux environments is a plus.

Knowledge REST APIs and basic networking concepts.

Essential Functions and Objectives:

Applies engineering principles, techniques and scientific methods in a specific area of expertise (building, construction, technology, etc.). Responsible for solving technical problems and discovering new ways to improve the districts systems, infrastructures, processes and operations.

Designs, develops, and implements a complex blueprint to provide highly-complex, reliable, and scalable data systems to meet the organization's objectives and requirements. Analyzes organization's business requirements for database design, and executes changes to database as required. Lead the District's enterprise data strategy to aligning short term and long business objectives with the technology, processes, policy, and people. This role will also be responsible for reducing and/or controlling costs while increasing scalability and stability of the data environment.

Define tools, technology, and development approach that best meets organizational needs. Work with data operations on prototype support, operation coaching, and facilitating architecture design blueprints to operationally build a plan and action steps.
Focus on data quality solutions, frameworks, models for governance management, establishing business glossaries, and metadata management. Improve data management approaches and perform requirements gathering, develop concepts of operations, and establish initiative roadmaps.
Establish strategies for data management functions, business cases, and enterprise technology solutions. This would include supporting initiatives in early phase efforts for district planning, vendor solutions and enterprise efficiencies.
As a liaison role, ensure departments know where to turn to for data needs. Adapt and address existing data management, workflow, warehousing to integrate and interoperate between new and legacy solutions.
Align requirements from senior and/or business leaders with changes to data platforms and architecture initiatives to ensure efficient and effective solutions for projects and operational needs.
Manage ongoing development to ensure the timely and accurate delivery of requests to stakeholders. Manage/oversee the user experience including design standards for delivering data.
Introduce new data community engagement models to create awareness of data that is available for use to schools, departments, and district leaders. Oversee the design and implementation of data architecture from source to warehouse, marts, analytics, and visualizations.

Knowledge, Experience & Other Qualifications:

Seven (7) or more years of experience in Data Architecture and/or Data Governance is required.
Experience and proficiency with G-Suite products and/or Project Management Software (e.g. Google Sheets, Google Docs, etc).
Preferred experience with data analytics.
Strong attention to detail.
Excellent interpersonal, analytical, critical thinking, problem-solving, and organizational skills.
Ability to communicate effectively in a credible and confident manner at all levels in the organization, both orally and in writing.
Ability to assess appropriate priorities and organize workload on multiple assignments.
Ability to collaborate with others on challenging, time sensitive projects as a team player.
Ability to work independently with minimal direction Preferred Change Management certification or experience Preferred Experience leading and implementing data governance.
Preferred Change Management certification or experience.
Preferred experience leading and implementing data governance.
Preferred experience with Jia and Confluence.

Education Requirements:

Bachelor's Degree is required.
Master’s Degree is preferred.

Other information:

The mission of the DPS Department of Technology Services (DoTS) is to be a proactive partner enabling the success of every child. We support the students, families, and staff of Denver Public Schools by providing the infrastructure, tools, data, and support to enable effective educators and efficient operations. Our leading-edge technology work includes delivering custom portals for our students, parents, teachers, and administrators, managing one of the largest networks in the state of Colorado, providing unparalleled levels of customer support, finding new ways to get technology in the hands of our students, and much more. We believe that technology is a positive, enabling force for parent engagement, student engagement, educator effectiveness, operational efficiency, student safety, and student achievement. By joining us, you too will be enabling the success of every child!

Additional Information:

Work Year Calendars (including accrued time off): http://thecommons.dpsk12.org/Page/1129
Benefits (including DPS contributions): http://thecommons.dpsk12.org/Page/1397
Compensation Structures: http://thecommons.dpsk12.org/Page/244
Employee must live and work with a permanent home address in Colorado while working for Denver Public Schools.

About Denver Public Schools:

Denver Public Schools is committed to meeting the educational needs of every student with great schools in every neighborhood. Our goal is to provide every child in Denver with rigorous, enriching educational opportunities from preschool through high school graduation. DPS is comprised of nearly 200 schools including traditional, magnet, charter and alternative pathways schools, with an enrollment of more than 90,000 students.

DPS has become the fastest-growing school district in the country in terms of enrollment and the fastest-growing large school district in the state in terms of student academic growth. Learn more at dpsk12.org.

Denver Public Schools is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability, or any other status protected by law or regulation. It is our intention that all qualified applicants be given equal opportunity and that selection decisions be based on job-related factors.

Job_title: Data Scientist I/II, Strategic Planning & Forecasting (Contact Center Operations)
Job_description:
YOUR LIFE'S MISSION: POSSIBLE

You have goals, dreams, hobbies and things you’re passionate about.


What’s Important to You Is Important to Us
We’re looking for people who not only want to do meaningful, challenging work, keep their skills sharp and move ahead, but who also take time for the things that matter to them—friends, family and passions. And we're looking for team members who are passionate about our mission—making a difference in military members' and their families' lives. Together, we can make it happen.


Don’t take our word for it.

Military Times 2021 Best for Vets Employers
WayUp Top 100 Internship Programs
Forbes® 2022 The Best Employers for New Grads
Forbes® America's Best Employers
Newsweek Top 100 Most Loved Workplaces
FortuneBest Workplaces for Women
Fortune100 Best Companies to Work For®
Computerworld® Best Places to Work in IT

Basic Purpose

Provide independent data science, machine learning, and analytical insights using member, financial, and organizational data to support mission critical decision making for various areas of the organization. Understand business needs and identify opportunities for new products, services, and process optimization to meet business objectives through the use of cutting-edge data science. Create descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive models and insights to drive impact across the organization. Conduct work assignments of increasing complexity, under moderate supervision with some latitude for independent judgment. Intermediate professional within field; requires moderate skill set and proficiency in discipline.

Responsibilities


Support the delivery of strategic advanced analytics solutions across the organization with solutions drawing on descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analytics and modeling
Leverage a broad set of modern technologies – including Python, R, Scala, and Spark – to analyze and gain insights within large data sets
Manage, architect, and analyze big data in order to build data driven insights and high impact data models
Evaluate model design and performance and perform champion/challenger development. Analyze model input data, assumptions, and overall methodology.
Using statistical practices, analyze current and historical data to make predictions, identify risks, and opportunities, enabling better decisions on planned/future events
Provide analytics insights and solutions to solve complex business problems
Apply business knowledge and advanced statistical modeling techniques when building data structures and tools
Collaborate with other team members, subject matter experts, pods, and delivery teams to deliver strategic advanced analytic based solutions from design to deployment
Examine data from multiple sources and share insights with leadership and stakeholders
Transform data presented in models, charts, and tables into a format that is useful to the business and aids in effective decision making
Point of contact between the data analyst/data engineer and the project/functional analytics leads
Develop and maintain an understanding of relevant industry standards, best practices, business processes and technology used in modeling and within the financial services industry
Identify improvements to the way in which analytics service the entire function
Recognize potential issues and risks during the analytics project implementation and suggest mitigation strategies
Prepare project deliverables that are valued by the business and present them in such a manner that they are easily understood by project stakeholders
Perform other duties as assigned

Qualifications


Master’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering or another quantitative field, or related field, or the equivalent combination of education, training and experience
Skill interpreting, extrapolating, and interpolating data for statistical research and modeling
Advanced skill in Data Interpretation, Qualitative and Quantitative Analysis
Advanced skill in Python, R, SQL and querying (able to pull/transform your own data)
Ability to understand complex business problems and determine what aspects require optimization and articulate those aspects in a clear and concise manner
Advanced skill in communicating actionable insights using data to technical and non-technical audiences
Proven experience working in a dynamic, research-oriented groups with several ongoing concurrent projects
Demonstrates functional knowledge of data visualization libraries such as matplotlib or ggplot2; knowledge of other visualization tools such as Microsoft Power BI and Tableau
Ability to manipulate raw data within visualization tools to create effective dashboards that communicate end-to-end data outcomes visually
Proficient in storytelling with data skills
Exceptional technical writing skills
Advanced skill communicating thoughts, concepts, practices effectively at all levels, adjusting as needed to a target audience
Advanced verbal, interpersonal and written communication skills
Advanced database, word processing, spreadsheet, and presentation software skills (e.g., Microsoft Access, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.)
Moderate skill in descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analytics and modeling; demonstrated success in building models that are deployed and have made measurable business impact
Experience in using two or more of the following modeling types to solve business problems: classification, regression, time series, clustering, text analytics, survival, association, optimization, reinforcement learning
Working knowledge of advanced techniques such as: SMOTE, dimension reduction techniques, natural language processing, sentiment analysis, anomaly detection, geospatial analytics, etc.
Demonstrates a deep understanding of the modeling lifecycle
Moderate skill data mining, data wrangling, and data transformation with both structured and unstructured data; deep understanding of data models
Understanding of data models, large datasets, business/technical requirements, BI tools, statistical programming languages and libraries
Familiar with Data Engineering concepts
Familiar with the use of standard ETL tools and techniques
Familiar with the concepts and application of data mapping and building requirements
Demonstrates a deep understanding of multiple data related concepts
Familiar with Data Integration, Data Governance and Data Warehousing
Moderate skill in Data Management, Data Validation & Cleansing and Information Analysis

Desired Qualifications and Education Requirements


Doctoral degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering or another quantitative field, or related field
Working knowledge of Navy Federal Credit Union instructions, standards, and procedures
Familiar with project management concepts and frameworks such as Agile Frameworks (SAFE), Communication Strategy and Management, Delivery Excellence and Requirements management

Hours: Monday - Friday, 8:00AM - 4:30PM CT

Location: 820 Follin Lane Vienna, VA 22180 | 5550 Heritage Oaks Dr. Pensacola, FL 32526 | 141 Security Dr. Winchester, VA 22602

Level I Salary Range: $85,500 - $146,300 annually

Level II Salary Range: $98,500 - $168,400 annually

Navy Federal Credit Union assesses market data to establish salary ranges that enable us to remain competitive. You are paid within the salary range, based on your experience, location and market position.

Posting End Date: 03/16/2023

Job postings are subject to close early or extend out longer than the anticipated closing date at the hiring team’s discretion based on qualified applicant volume.

Equal Employment Opportunity

Navy Federal values, celebrates, and enacts diversity in the workplace. Navy Federal takes affirmative action to employ and advance in employment qualified individuals with disabilities, disabled veterans, Armed Forces service medal veterans, recently separated veterans, and other protected veterans. EOE/AA/M/F/Veteran/Disability

Disclaimer

Navy Federal reserves the right to fill this role at a higher/lower grade level based on business need. An assessment may be required to compete for this position.

Bank Secrecy Act

Remains cognizant of and adheres to Navy Federal policies and procedures, and regulations pertaining to the Bank Secrecy Act.

Job_title: Managerial - Data and Systems Manager (Tier C) (SY22-23) (Anticipated Vacancy)
Job_description:
Boston Day and Evening Academy (BDEA) is seeking an extraordinary Data and Systems Manager to work in our school. BDEA is an innovative public high school that engages young adults to build a vision for their futures through supportive relationships and meaningful competency-based learning. BDEA students are 16 to 23 years old, having attended traditional schools where they may have felt lost, unsafe, or disengaged. Upon entering BDEA, students remain eager to succeed and flourish because they are listened to and respected for who they are and for the gifts they possess. Working with experienced faculty in an environment that blends strong academics and support, students are given the opportunity to earn a Boston Public Schools diploma and to reach their fullest potential through a competency-based curriculum that inspires critical and creative thinking, independent learning, and active citizenship. As a competency-based school, BDEA does not have grade levels. Our extended program, beginning at 8am and running until 4:30pm serves students with different academic needs up to age 23, including those who are being promoted from middle school without being academically prepared for high school; those who have dropped out of high school and have decided to return to earn a diploma, and those who are unable to attend regular school hours due to health issues, full time work and/or full time parenting obligations. The school employs 60 full and part-time staff to work with 405 students and is governed by an active Board of Trustees. All employees of the school are expected to uphold the mission of the school to build a consistent, unified, anti-racist, inclusive community that stimulates greater student agency, engagement, and academic achievement

The Data and Systems Manager will manage multiple tasks related to the school’s accountability requirements relative to assessments, and data collection, analysis, and reporting. This person will manage BDEA’s unique data infrastructure CONNECTs built on the SalesForce platform. Working collaboratively with the school staff and leadership team, the developer helps to streamline and improve whole school system efficiencies.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:

Systems Development

Develop and manage system infrastructure(s) across various platforms (PowerSchool, Salesforce, and Schoology) to make work more sustainable
Develop API crosswalks and connections from software to software to ensure streamlined computing of benchmarks, scheduling, and attendance
Continually identify new approaches to efficiency while integrating user feedback into improvement practices
Perform new user setup, user maintenance, workflow rules, permission allowances, customizations. reporting and dashboard configurations, data security, and training across various systems
Ensure system sustainability across various platforms, including on-going training, notification of system updates, and documentation of capabilities.

Student Assessments

Collaboratively provide oversight of BDEA’s Systems and Technology Associate to accurately monitor the school’s performance toward state accountability indicators
Ensure accurate rostering and data uploads for each assessment (MCAS, WIDA, and other state assessments)
Order, receive, safeguard, and ship materials
Ensure proper staffing and training of test proctors
Distribute results to staff, students, and families
Monitor and ensures accurate completion and informed use of school-wide data (e.g., student performance, attendance, graduation, and dropout), including required assessment tools for existing and new programs
Use data analysis as a foundation for developing, implementing, and monitoring student achievement and school wide initiatives/decision-making

Data Management

Lead processes for data retrieval and analysis used to inform key staff and programs at BDEA
Understand the priorities of the various school programs and departments and incorporate their needs into a data collection and analyses process
Develop, coordinate, and administer surveys (students, families) to solicit input regarding school climate, attendance, programming, scheduling, safety, health and wellness, etc. in order to identify and address barriers to improving student outcomes, highlight promising practices
Using data from surveys and other databases, identify challenges and successes. This will be an opportunity to help quantitatively define the systemic problems faced by the school and help monitor ongoing efforts to address them
Highlight policy changes or program intervention where necessary

Communications

Report data from surveys and mine data for additional analyses to inform the work of multiple departments and programs
Summarize findings and outcomes in clear and concise reports to be presented to appropriate administrators, board, and staff
Assist Head of School with all Board of Trustees communications and accountability requirements
Performs other related duties as requested by the Head of School

Terms: BPS Managerial Class, Tier C, step based on experience. As a Horace Mann Charter School, employees are paid a competitive salary in accordance with the BPS managerial scale. The position is 223 work days between July 1st and June 30th each year. The employee will be required to adhere to the work conditions, including calendar, schedule and flexibility established by the School. The work schedule will be set by the staff member and the HoS according to school needs. Other benefits include Medical and Dental benefits, eligibility for City of Boston retirement.

Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree or higher, and a minimum of 2 years experience working in data analysis, collection, & reporting.
Experience in program and/or project evaluation; analysis of large, relational databases; excellent written and oral presentation skills.
Familiarity with state and other assessments, quantitative data analyses, programming in SPSS or other statistical packages is an advantage.
Mastery of Excel is required.
Knowledge and comfort in the use of social media (Twitter, Facebook, text messaging)
Have excellent communication and organizational skills; Bilingual Spanish, Creole, other: a strong plus
Acute attention to detail and project completion
Strong and tested ability to participate effectively in teams; have collaborative management style
Passion for coordinating multiple “moving parts” (logistics, schedule, people, etc.)
Ability to work in a fast-paced, challenging environment
Be able to interact with young people and their families in a respectful and caring manner
Adhere to BDEA’s Non-Discrimination Policy (see below)
A sense of humor!

TERMS:

Managerial Tier C

Please refer to www.bostonpublicschools.org/ohc (under "Employee Benefits and Policies") for more information on salary and compensation. Salaries are listed by Unions and Grade/Step.

NOTE: School-based managerial employees will work 223 days between July 1st and June 30th each year. The 223 day work-year will include the 180 days in which school is in session, and the additional days will be determined by the employee and the principal or headmaster of the school. This position subject to the City of Boston residency requirement as well as U.S. citizenship.

School-based managerial employees are not eligible for vacation time or compensatory time. In the event of school cancellation due to snow or inclement weather, school-based managerial employees need not report to work.

The Boston Public Schools, in accordance with its nondiscrimination policies, does not discriminate in its programs, facilities, or employment or educational opportunities on the basis of race, color, age, criminal record (inquiries only), disability, homelessness, sex/gender, gender identity, religion, national origin, ancestry, sexual orientation, genetics or military status, and does not tolerate any form of retaliation, or bias-based intimidation, threat or harassment that demeans individuals’ dignity or interferes with their ability to learn or work.Show Less  Report

Job_description:
In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence by tapping into the power of data analytics, robotics, and cognitive technologies such as Artificial Intelligence (AI).

Our Strategy & Analytics portfolio helps clients leverage rigorous analytical capabilities and a pragmatic mindset to solve the most complex of problems. Play a key role in helping to our clients uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data and transforming the Government and Public Services marketplace.

Work you'll do:

Deloitte is looking for a Data Scientist to join our team and help accelerate a federal mission client's discovery and delivery of identity and network-based intelligence insights to counter national security threats and malicious actors.

Our Data Scientists apply advanced exploitation methods, models, and emerging technologies and work side-by-side with mission customers and fellow analytics team members to drive data science support to the entire intelligence cycle.

Preferred:



Experience leveraging data analysis to construct compelling narratives
Familiarity with AWS/cloud development and solutions architecture
Experience extracting features from data stored in a wide range of possible formats, including JSON, XML, raw text logs, industry-specific encodings, and graph link data
Experience executing data science method using parallel computing frameworks (e.g., deeplearning4j, Torch, Tensor Flow, and distributed data processing frameworks (e.g. Hadoop and Spark)
Familiarity with and experience developing in Govt cloud environments (C2S, ICGC), Custom Application Development Windows, and Admin/Scripting. Familiarity with Relational Databases and Querying languages (SQL. CAML)
Comfortable with Agile Methodology / SCRUM development, JIRA, Confluence. Experience with graph databases
Experience with statistical methodologies

Job_title: Internal Audit – Data Analytics and Automation Manager
Job_description:
Benefits Overview:

A career at CoBank can offer you the opportunity to make a personal impact on the people and communities where we do business. When you choose a career with CoBank, you make a difference by doing work that matters. In order to be the best, we hire the best!

Remarkable Benefits offered by CoBank

Competitive Compensation & Incentive
Hybrid work model – flexible arrangements for most positions
Benefits Packages, including: Medical, Dental and Vision coverage, Disability, AD&D, and Life Insurance
CoBank University robust curriculum –associate training and development, including higher education tuition reimbursement
Outstanding 401k – up to 6% matching and additional 3% non-elective contribution
Time-Off Packages – Vacation 15+ days, 10 Paid Sick Days, and 11 Paid Holidays
Community Impact – United Way Angel Day, Volunteer Day and Associate Directed Contribution
Associate Resource Groups – creating a culture of diversity and inclusion
Recognize a fellow associate with “GEM” awards, including a monetary value
On-site Fitness Center and Cafe
ECO transportation pass provided to every Denver associate
Job Description:

At CoBank, our Audit Manager – Audit and Digital Innovation manages plans and/or assigns audits based on risk assessments and requests from CoBank Management, the Board of Directors, or the Audit Committee. Responsible for coordinating the execution of audit analytics and championing initiatives aimed at improving analytic capabilities within the audit function. Develops expertise in navigating the application infrastructure and data environments within CoBank, and provides data analysis solutions to audit team members and business partners. Builds and maintains an Internal Audit Center of Excellence for data-driven auditing techniques in alignment with CoBank’s Enterprise Information Management’s program and other best practices. Assists the Audit management team with annual planning activities for the department. Proposes departmental procedural changes as needed. Supervises the performance of audit work, assists audit managers, senior and staff auditors in the performance of audit work, and independently performs audit work when necessary. Provides ongoing training and career development opportunities for supervised staff. Maintains professional expertise in leading practices of the audit profession and in the technical areas of responsibility.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Plans and/or assigns audits based on risk assessments and requests from CoBank management, the Board of Directors, or the Audit Committee. Aids in the development of annual audit plans and schedules work based on the audit plan and special requests. Performs high level, detailed planning for audit engagements as necessary.
Assists Audit management with annual planning activities for the department. Assistance includes, but is not limited to the establishment of a comprehensive audit plan to evaluate the design and effectiveness of control environments across bank functions in the mitigation of known, emerging, or perceived risks.
Proposes departmental procedural changes to Audit management, as needed. Monitors appropriateness and accuracy of policies and procedures within the department, and assists management with the establishment and compliance of department procedures, CoBank policy/directives and bank wide guidance.
Builds and maintains relationships by actively working with CoBank management and the Board, the FCA and external auditors. Facilitates productive two-way communication channels among CoBank stakeholders.
Manages and/or executes advanced audit services, and supervises/mentors audit team in the effective design and implementation of work products, scope, execution, work paper review, and reporting.
Supports and participates in advancing the Internal Audit team’s ability to assess the organization’s control environment through the use of data analytics or other non-traditional methods. Generates insights resulting in high-quality audits that ensure the mitigation of risks to the bank.
Supports audit leadership by utilizing data models to identify and solve a variety of business issues. Reviews tools, techniques and best practices. Leverages technology through the implementation and use of automated analytics.
Partners with technology teams, and develops and implements quantitative solutions that leverage structured and unstructured data from internal and external sources. Utilizes existing and new systems and solutions to develop automated approaches to auditing. Develops and maintains continuous monitoring tools, and conducts follow-ups as needed. Performs pre-implementation reviews for significant changes in the IT environment.
Assists with peer reviews and internal self-compliance reviews with department quality standards and externally published standards (IIA, AICPA, COSO, et al).
Evaluates the effectiveness and efficiency of manual and automated controls used to mitigate complex processes and their associated risks for both Internal Audit and Sarbanes-Oxley requirements. Manages SOX 404 testing to maximize external auditor’s reliance, if applicable.
Mentors and trains staff through the development and presentation of fraud/data mining-related training and intranet materials.
Supervises audit managers, seniors and staff auditors in the performance of audit work. Ensures audit work is performed in accordance with professional audit standards and department procedures. Sets performance standards, manages workflow, evaluates performance, and recommends personnel actions within delegated authorities. Consults with Human Resources, as appropriate.
Maintains professional expertise in the leading practices of the audit profession, the banking industry, and the specific technical areas of responsibility including data analytics, robotics process automation and similar initiatives.
Serves as a subject matter expert, and provides a center of excellence (COE) and advisory service on data analytics and related controls to the business. Increases auditor efficiency and quality by promoting leading practices for conducting integrated audits and incorporating analytics.
Manages co-sourced and outsourced resources, as necessary.
Manages or performs special reviews, projects, and additional duties as assigned.

Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in business, accounting, finance, information technology or other relevant discipline.
Six (6) or more years of industry-related audit experience, with Big 4 accounting experience preferred; or an appropriate combination of education and experience.

Preferred Qualifications

CISA, CISSP, CIA, CPA, CAP, DASCA SDS or PDS, CCP Data Engineer, IBM Data Architect, MCSE, SAS Data Scientist, or other related professional certification preferred.
Expertise with COSO/COBIT and leading data analytics and automation practices. Understanding of the COSO framework, GAAS, GAAP, and regulatory requirements for financial institutions.
Advanced knowledge, understanding and application of auditing, data science, and statistical and analytical tools, techniques, principles and best practices.
Advanced understanding of bank processes, systems, controls and related standards.
Strong proficiency in identifying, analyzing and evaluating complex business and technology risks, and identifying internal controls, tools and methods to mitigate risk and improve quality and control.
Proven analytical reasoning, strategic thinking and creative problem-solving abilities.
Demonstrated teambuilding and leadership skills, with the ability to manage a high performing, effective, diverse and inclusive team. Able to effectively oversee and positively motivate team members, instill accountability and facilitate successful achievement of individual, team, business and strategic goals.
Proven executive presence and interpersonal and negotiation skills. Able to lead teams, work collaboratively and build and maintain effective working relationships with all levels of associates, management, executive leadership, and internal and external customers and partners.
Excellent organizational and time management skills. Able to manage and schedule workload and projects in order to navigate peaks and prioritize multiple competing commitments. Skilled at managing short-term objectives to meet long-term goals.
Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills, including the ability to understand and translate abstract concepts and ideas, and communicate in both a business and technical context to non-technical audiences at all levels of the organization. Able to establish credibility and facilitate clear understanding of audit issues, and influence change as appropriate.
Excellent attention to detail and customer focused orientation.
Ability to work independently with minimal guidance, as well as collaboratively in a team environment.
Knowledge of and skills in using automation, data analytics, as well as intermediate ability with query languages (Automation Anywhere, Tableau, SAS, SQL, etc.). Familiarity with data warehouse and data mart concepts.
Knowledge of Microsoft Office (e.g., Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, Excel) and other business applications and management reporting tools (e.g., Cognos, Outlook, Hyperion).
Availability for occasional work outside normal business hours.
Some travel may be required to complete job assignments and fulfill responsibilities.

Compensation Information

Estimated Base Salary Range: $125,000-$150,000
Target short-term incentive opportunity: 18%
About CoBank:

CoBank stands strong as an enterprise dedicated to the financial needs of rural communities. That means we help fund new ways to grow food, generate energy, access technology, and otherwise improve life in America. When you choose a career with us, you make a difference by doing work that matters. A career at CoBank can offer you the opportunity to make a personal impact on the people and communities where we do business. We also provide competitive compensation, health and wellness benefits, company-funded retirement plan, matching 401(k), and professional development programs.


CoBank will not consider a work visa H1B, EAD (Employment Authorization Document or Permit) or OPT (Optional Practical Training) for this position.
CoBank is an Equal Opportunity Employer.


CoBank requires all newly hired associates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, and new hires will be asked to register their proof of vaccination. Any offer of employment will be conditioned upon an applicant supplying proof of vaccination against COVID-19; provided, however that CoBank may provide a reasonable accommodation for an applicant’s known disability or sincerely held religious belief.

Job_title: Program & Data Manager - DBH Prevention & Education
Job_description:
Davis Behavioral Health (DBH) is seeking a full-time Program & Data Manager to oversee program planning, implementation, evaluation, and reporting for Prevention & Education efforts in Davis County. The ideal candidate possesses excellent communication skills, is meticulous, creative, and is a strong team player.

Essential Functions

The essential functions assigned to the Program & Data Manager include, but are not limited to the following:

Gather, track, evaluate, and report on Prevention & Education efforts on the program, coalition, and county levels.
Create visual materials such as print and digital marketing, reporting charts, and infographics to market programs and highlight effectiveness.
Write and report on grants to support the Prevention & Education efforts in Davis County
Work with the Prevention Coordinator to illustrate the significance of prevention to key stakeholders, and strategize how to continue to grow support, funding, and community reach.
Oversee and manage all aspects of scheduling, set up, facilitation, and follow-up for DBH sponsored Prevention & Education programs, as well as community events, on occasion.
Supervise program instructors and childcare staff, and provide them support, training, and professional development.
Coordinate with the Prevention Team regarding Prevention & Education programming needs across the county, as well as in individual schools and coalition areas.
Work with Diversity Coordinator regarding potential program barriers and solutions for diverse populations within Davis County

Preference may be given for candidates who use his/her own recovery experience and training to assist consumers.

Schedule

This position works in an office setting 40 hours per week. May be required to work occasional evening hours and weekends, as needed. Limited remote work may be allowed. There will be periodic travel required.

The successful candidate will primarily work a Monday through Friday day schedule but will be required to be flexible to attend required meetings, trainings, and other events associated with the role of Program and Data Manager as well as to oversee and supervise the prevention and education efforts, which mostly take place in the evening hours.

Compensation

The starting annual wage for the successful candidates is outlined below:

$55,000.00 per annum for candidates with a Master's degree (exempt FLSA status)
$21.00 per hour for candidates with a Bachelor's degree (non-exempt FLSA status)
Spanish-language incentive stipend (paid bi-weekly) available. Must pass a verbal Spanish-language proficiency assessment to qualify.

Davis Behavioral Health, Inc.

Davis Behavioral Health's mission is to provide access to quality behavioral healthcare by:

Adhering to principles of choice, safety, transparency, and collaboration with our clients, staff, and partners;
Utilizing evidence-informed practices to best serve our clients; and
Being fiscally wise and responsible.

Davis Behavioral Health understands that excellent clinicians are vital to meeting the standards established by its mission and vision statements.

It is highly preferred that individuals who are interested in obtaining employment at DBH, their spouse, or one of their dependents not be actively receiving services at DBH except for medication management services to eliminate/avoid possible conflicts or uncomfortable boundaries.

DBH understands that excellent employees are vital to meeting the standards established by its mission and vision statements. DBH is committed to excellence in community-based behavioral health treatment, progressive, vital and continually responsive to the needs of the community, and advocates for the behavioral health needs of our clients.

Davis Behavioral Health is an equal opportunity employer.

Required Experience

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Public Health, Social Work, Communication, Business, or other related fields, required. Master’s Degree preferred.
Experience with program development and implementation.
Ability to collaborate well with people of all ages and backgrounds.
Must be willing to complete a criminal background check and pre-employment drug screen.
Valid Utah Driver’s License in good standing.
Must have own transportation.

Required Skills and Abilities

Strong, effective, clear, and concise communication skills, both oral and written
Organized and meticulous.
Dependable, with proven ability to work independently and follow-through with responsibilities.
Able to take initiative and solve problems effectively.
Gather, track, evaluate, and report program data.
Analyze and synthesize data into written and visual formats.
Computer skills, including familiarity with the Microsoft Office products, design software such as the Adobe Suite, and ability to learn new systems.

Job_title: CHC Data and Analytics Lead - NA
Job_description:
JOB PURPOSE

The Team

The newly founded and multiskilled Data & Analytics team aims at delivering data across CHC globally. The team is composed of several entities “Data Governance”, “Advanced Analytics”, “Data Modelling & Architecture”, “Program & Operations” and regional “Data & Analytics Lead”.



Your role as a Data & Analytics Lead for CHC North America Region

Reporting directly to the Head of Data & Analytics, your role is to ensure interaction between CHC business stakeholders from CHC North America region and the Data & Analytics team. You will have a direct impact on the regional business by enabling solutions, either by leveraging CHC Data & Analytics capabilities or by enabling local solutions, in agreement with the CHC data standards.

You enjoy partnering with stakeholders at top management level to deliver value. You are analytical, creative, and collaborative, ready to dive into the details when need be. You understand the value of implementing standards and well as the importance of helping locally stakeholders to fulfil their data needs and challenges. You continually seek to improve your knowledge of new technologies and industry standards to drive the development of simple, yet effective solutions. You see challenges as opportunities and are results oriented. You take pride knowing your work enables innovation and helping CHC build better data solutions.

Your key responsibilities will be

Drive alignment across business regional stakeholders to ensure adoption of enterprise governance, best practices, and other standards (and monitor adherence to data managements standard?)

Actively partner with regional stakeholders to understand their data needs and challenges and, in line with CHC Data & Analytics central standard’s, help them find solution forward to drive improvement

Actively communicate with central Data & Analytics team to keep track of latest innovation or seek for support

Keep track (Be responsible?) for the data solutions developed locally in the entire region

Recommend KPIs and develop reports to communicate towards Regional Heads as well as Data & Analytics central team.

Contribute to the Data & Analytics team by being collaborative, sharing best practices, success stories and participate in the team’s continuous improvement approach

Own the delivery of data products for the region from resource, budget, and timeline perspective

This position is an individual contributor role at the moment with many indirect FTEs including external contractors/ service providers

PROFILE

Key Functional Requirements & Qualifications

Strong experience in collaborating with management & top management stakeholders

Strong understanding of databases and data structures

Experience with process design, implementation, and improvement

Exposure to tools used to support data management, specifically business glossary and metadata management, data cataloging, and data quality

Strong ability to identify, quantify, and effectively raise business risks associated with data quality or non-compliance

Experience developing best Lean & Agile practices, policies, and/or procedures

Rigorous, attention to detail to map data systems and curious to understand what is behind each data field

Understanding local data privacy laws and regulations

Define a D&A roadmap for the region and drive implementation

Work on RFP’s and vendor selection for the prioritized demands with detailed ROI

Ensure budget planning and allocation for the regional initiatives

This position will be reporting directly to the Global head of data & analytics and dotted to the regional head of digital CHC

Key Technical Requirements & Qualifications

Excellent capacity to dig business issue, find value at stake and develop consistent, clear analysis to drive action plan

Experience in implementing multiple mid to large scale data & analytics programs

Experience in the data & analytics technology stack including Snowflake, AWS, Informatica, Power BI and others is a must

Transversal experience with projects involving business functions such as Commercial, Sales & Marketing, Supply Chain, Manufacturing, Finance, ERP (SAP)

Familiarity with data science methods and scaling data science methods

Familiarity with cloud computing and data storages.

Excel, PowerPoint, Word

One or multiple of the following visualization skills such as Tableau or Power BI

Strong Project management experience & support: working knowledge of JIRA, service now, Confluence, Teams, Slack and other collaboration tools & solutions

Soft and Behavioral Skills

Ability to collaborate with management & top management

Experience working with multiple teams to drive alignment and results

Service-oriented, flexible, positive team player

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Self-motivated, takes initiative

Problem solving

Your Background

+10 years of experience in general management, data management or IT management

Preferred qualifications: Master’s Degree in Data Analytics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics

Team management experience is a strong plus

Experience in a healthcare company is a strong plus

Responsible for completing preventative maintenance checks throughout data center (cleaning,

been placed in the repair queue, diagnosing unit, and putting the unit in the appropriate status

devices, as well as correction and routing/escalation when situations require

Processing of all hardware RMA’s
Work with corporate ticketing system
Maintenance of documentation
Following all stated policies and procedures

with customer-facing focus

management

knowledge.

2 years’ experience in IT position
2 years’ experience PC level help desk and repairs

None

This job operates in a data center environment. This role routinely uses standard data center
equipment such as laptop computers, smartphones voltmeter’s, hash board testers, scissor lifts,
forklifts, ladders and screwdrivers etc. While performing these duties the employee will be
exposed to hot and cold environments.

Able to meet physical requirements of the job, such as working on ladders, racking heavy
servers (up to 50 lbs.), running cables, lifting miners, bending, reaching, standing for long
periods of time, working in hot and cold environments etc.

This is a full-time position with 12-hour shifts with 4 days on/3 off. Overtime as needed.

Occasional travel between data centers.
