Job_title: ETL Data Analyst - Third Party Indices Automation
Job_description:
Bloomberg runs on data, and as part of the Data team, we're responsible for acquiring it, providing it to our clients and helping derive significant insights out of it. We collect, analyze, process, and publish the data, which is the backbone of our iconic Bloomberg Terminal and our enterprise products - the facts and figures which ultimately move the financial markets. We apply problem-solving skills to identify innovative workflow efficiencies, and we implement technology solutions to improve our systems, products, and processes - and all this while providing platinum customer support to clients.


The Third Party Index Data team supports Bloomberg's suite of Indices to fulfill our clients' needs. We process over 15,000 files per day and as such need to have highly efficient data pipelines and quality processes to support the timely execution and publishing of that data for our clients.


What's the role?

The Third Party Automation Team is a dynamic group of individuals who tackle the more challenging technical aspects of our data product including data pipelining and sophisticated data analysis. Our Data Analysts possess a unique combination of technical skills and eye for business, as well as good communication and interpersonal skills. As such, we are looking for a highly motivated individual with a passion for data and the technology that surrounds it.


As a Data Analyst you will apply your problem-solving skills to handle the data pipelines, automation processes and human-in-the-loop workflows that feed our Third Party Indices Data Products. In addition to the data pipelining work, you will analyze our data from an operational as well as product standpoint. This might be by building the associated ETLs and Data Visualizations to report on our most important Operational Metrics or by building prototype applications in BQNT with our product teams. You will be expected to lead projects, collaborate with Engineering and Product and mentor junior members of the group who are looking to develop technically.


We'll trust you to:
Develop and support the data pipelines and processes that feed our Bloomberg Index Database
Find opportunities and build automated solutions for data standardization, ETL pipelines, and human-in-the-loop data processing
Design, develop, and deploy data quality validations written in Python to drive quality improvements and standards across the team, improving areas such as accuracy, completeness, consistency, reliability and more
Draw on your knowledge of scripting and programming to scale and standardize pipelining across our team and the department, always identifying improvements to current workflows
Use statistics and data visualization to report on results of ongoing operations and projects, as required
Leverage data analysis skills to find opportunities to optimize our operations or create prototypes to advance the third-party index data product
Partner with a wide variety of collaborators including Engineering, Product and Sales on product development and execution
You'll need to have: (from other DA2 role)
A BA/BS degree or higher in Computer Science, Mathematics, or relevant data technology field, or equivalent professional work experience
2+ years of Python programming and scripting in a production environment
2+ years of experience working with databases either SQL or NoSQL
Understanding of large-scale, distributed systems
Strong aptitude for problem solving, particularly to modify and enhance processes and workflows
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, especially when explaining technical processes and solutions to business stakeholders and management
High attention to detail and degree of demonstrated decision-making and problem-solving skills
Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment
Ability to influence others and lead change
Experience training and mentoring others
Legal authorization to work full-time in the United States and not require visa sponsorship now or in the future
We'd love to see:
Financial Market experience including an understanding of how benchmarks are used by our clients
Agile/Scrum Project Management experience
Experience using data analysis and visualization tools such as Tableau or QlikSense
Does this sound like you?

Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are.

Job Summary:

The Data Governance Manager is responsible for the implementation and oversight of the Company’s data management goals, standards, process and procedures. Furthermore, the Data Governance Manager is a communicator that is in charge of organizing and streamlining the process with which data identified, classified, organized, maintained and configured; all while maintaining efficiency and saving the company from inappropriate data handling and storage, and potentially saving time and money by keeping data congruent with the Company's goals.

Primary Functions and/or Responsibilities:

Establish and govern an enterprise data governance implementation roadmap including strategic priorities for development of information-based capabilities
Roll out an enterprise wide data governance framework, with a focus on improvement of data quality and the protection of sensitive data. This will include the development and implementation of data governance strategy, data quality and protection standards, and adoption requirements in policies and procedures which define performance and quality metrics.
Define roles and responsibilities related to data governance and ensure clear accountability for stewardship of the company’s principal information assets
Serve as a liaison between Business and Functional areas and technology to ensure that data related business requirements for protecting sensitive data are clearly defined, communicated and well understood and considered as part of operational prioritization and planning to achieve objectives and resolve issues
Develop & maintain inventory of the enterprise information maps, including authoritative systems, owners to achieve objectives and resolve issues
Define indicators of performance and quality metrics and ensure compliance with data related policies, standards, roles and responsibilities, and adoption requirements through ongoing monitoring
In conjunction with IT, provide progress reports to Board and Executive leadership
Coordinate external data sources to eliminate redundancy and streamline the expense related to those services
Ensure controls are implemented and integrated with applications to ensure data integrity by performing gap analysis
Other duties as assigned

Education and/or Experience:

3-5 years in Project Management and/or 5+ years in Banking IT preferred
Degree in Information Technology/Data Management related field preferred or general business degree w/ significant experience in data management, project management and/or Banking IT

Specific Skills, Knowledge & Abilities:

Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook)
Analytical and problem solving skills
Strong attention to detail
Excellent communication skills (written and/or oral)
Strong organizational and planning skills
Ability to multi-task
Ability to work independently and use independent judgment
Excellent project management skills

Job Description

The Data Management Specialist is responsible for working with a directorate office to effectively manage data and data sources. The Specialist will work extensively with the stakeholders to identify single sources of truth (authoritative data sources), establish relationships between other data sources, and integrate them into an organizational data model. The Data Management Specialist should recommend moving any ad-hoc sources of truth to a properly managed system (determined and recommended by the Specialist) that allows for easy data access and reporting. The Specialist should assist the directorate in creating an environment that efficiently supports structured, repeatable reporting, including the promotion of high standards for data quality, identifying data gaps as discovered.

The Data Management Specialist will collaborate with Government customers, data owners, data stewards, developers, data scientists and other data ingestion, data analytics and data services personnel to accomplish the overall goal of effective data management, analytics and reporting.

The Data Management Specialist will report to the Deputy Program Manager for Data Management and Automation. In addition to data management skills and experience, he or she must have excellent communication, coordination, and customer service skills, and work well within a team environment. Experience within the Missile Defense Agency is preferable.

Requirements

Education and Experience

BS Degree in Information Systems or related field
5+ years’ experience in Data Management, Data Analysis or related field


Skills

Familiarity with database systems such as SQL Server, SQL Analysis Services, Oracle, Hadoop, etc.
Familiarity with data-centric programming languages such as SQL, PHP, and R preferable
Familiarity with SQL reporting services and SharePoint Business Intelligence preferable
Ability to assess the quality of data and create processes to address any quality issues
Ability to define and maintain relationships between datasets and depict those clearly to stakeholders
Proficient in the use of MS Office Suite tools

Position Details:

Summary of Duties:

This position is responsible for the development, implementation and management of systems used to collect research data for the Paul G. Allen School for Global Health (SGH) at Washington State University. This position interacts with a broad range of researchers to gather requirements for data collection and storage, and then designs, implements, and maintains these systems. Working as an intermediary between the School for Global Health and the College of Veterinary Medicine's Veterinary Information Systems unit, this position will also assist in the preparation of data sets for analysis and will act as the primary support contact for a REDCap instance supporting both domestic and international research programs, as well as other data collection systems. Infrequent international travel to assist international research programs may be necessary in this position.

To support WSU's ability to attract talent in a competitive job market, this recruitment has been approved for a hiring incentive/moving allowance payment of up to one month's salary.


Depending on your level of experience, you may begin as a IT Data Management-Entry or a IT Data Management- Journey.

Position requires a Bachelor's degree in a related technology field. Any combination of relevant education and experience may be substituted for the educational requirement on a year-for-year basis.

What's the role?

As an Exchange Market Data Coordinator, you will focus on providing exceptional customer service for Exchange real-time data enablement requests, Exchange invoicing and product changes while ensuring compliance. The role includes project managing real-time data implementation and account management. You will have the opportunity to be the vital link that our clients depend on. You will also interact with clients in a range of sectors, including the finance and legal industries.

We'll trust you to:
Be responsible for onboarding clients onto various Exchange products and executing relevant exchange agreements

Identify and mitigate risks by proactively seeking solutions to resolve the issue, while remaining compliant

Partner with internal business groups to ensure requirements normalize Exchange data to comply with systems standards
Analyze current and future data pricing, reporting obligations, enablement logic and systematic limitations required for product implementation
Plan and organize resources to ensure prompt execution of projects. This includes setting strategy and planning, milestone tracking, ensuring all deadlines are met, and providing project status updates to stakeholders
Identify all areas of risk associated to product implementation
Develop a strong understanding of Bloomberg's and Exchanges' products
Liaise with Engineering Teams to articulate system enhancements, test new functionalities, improve workflow inefficiencies, and rectify glitches

Bachelor's degree and a minimum of 1 year of relevant experience

Demonstrated ability to grasp workflow changes, learn new systems and be technologically savvy
Proficiency in Microsoft Suite
Strong communication and collaboration skills
We'd love to see:
Knowledge of SAP
Knowledge of or interest in financial markets
Outstanding customer support

Job_title: Machine Learning Data Scientist - Python / R
Job_description:
In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence by tapping into the power of data analytics, robotics, and cognitive technologies such as Artificial Intelligence (AI).

Our Strategy & Analytics portfolio helps clients leverage rigorous analytical capabilities and a pragmatic mindset to solve the most complex of problems. By joining our team, you will play a key role in helping to our clients uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data and transforming the Government and Public Services marketplace.

Work you'll do



Developing advanced analytics products
Apply data visualization and statistical programming tools to enterprise data
Work directly with customers in the federal, state, and/or local government.
Support all phases of analytic work product development, from the identification of key business questions to delivery insights to decision-makers.
Requires special attention to the interplay between data and the business processes that produce it and the decision-makers that consume insights.



The team

The GPS Analytics and Cognitive (A&C) offering is responsible for developing advanced analytics products and applying data visualization and statistical programming tools to enterprise data in order to advance and enable the key mission outcomes for our clients.

Our team supports all phases of analytic work product development, from the identification of key business questions through data collection and ETL, and from performing analyses and using a wide range of statistical, machine learning, and applied mathematical techniques to delivery insights to decision-makers. Our practitioners give special attention to the interplay between data and the business processes that produce it and the decision-makers that consume insights.

Requirements:

5+ years of experience with programming languages such as Python, Java, R
5+ years of experience with data visualization tools, such as Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, or equivalent
5+ years data engineering experience with ETL, SQL, NoSQL Apache Hadoop
Top Secret, or TS/SCI clearance required
Bachelor's degree required

Preferred:



Experience with structured and unstructured data and using ML to solve problems with unstructured data sets and relational database
Experience with Spark
Experience deploying ML models to low power systems for inference
Experience with containerization



How you'll grow

At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there's always room to learn.

We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career. #LI-BL2

What You Will Do:
As a member of the Integrated Resource and Asset Planning Solution team, you will help to innovate new transformational offerings for our clients, focus on helping to build Guidehouse’s integrated planning analytics models, whilst working with various clients on their data and analytics journey. You will provide subject matter expertise and delivery oversight for cross-functional projects and oversee advanced data and analysis techniques to discover insights that will guide strategic decisions and uncover optimization opportunities for Guidehouse’s client network. In this role, you will demonstrate a drive to disrupt the energy industry data and analytics space; with an entrepreneurial spirit that employs both technical and business problem solving capabilities

What You Will Need:

Bachelor’s degree
A minimum of 7-10 years working experience in related fields excluding internships, co-ops, fellowships and academic research
Total years of work experience must include 5 years of Utility Analytics (e.g., Solar & EV demand forecasts, Load Forecasting/Planning and Capital Planning Analysis)
Experience managing a data and analytics team through successful implementation across enterprise level engagements
Experience in developing and managing data and analytics product development and/or taking new products to market
Experience developing business & functional requirements and working with a technical team to translate to technical requirements/design
Experience implementing utility analytics models across a full delivery lifecycle (developing client business & functional requirements, implementation, user acceptance testing, support and maintenance)
Experienced and skilled with R Studio, Python, PowerPoint, Excel, Word, and Visio
Experienced and skilled with at least one or more data, process, and architecture modeling toolset
Ability to effectively communicate with C-level executives and promote data & analytics offerings to support organizational goals and objectives
Must be able to work fluently in English (written and spoken)
Able to work on multiple projects and provide either remote or on-site support based on client expectations
No sponsorship available for this position
Position open virtually to candidates in the United States
The successful candidate must not be subject to employment restrictions from a former employer (such as a non-compete) that would prevent the candidate from performing the job responsibilities as described
Compensation decisions depend on a wide range of factors, including but not limited to skill sets, experience and training, security clearances, licensure and certifications, and other business and organizational needed

What Would Be Nice To Have:

Master's, MBA or PhD degree in engineering, energy science, economics, physics, mathematics, or business
Academic course work in energy sciences with a focus of data and analytics
Proven extracurricular activities and/or international experience aligned with the position
Familiarity with and demonstrable passion for the following is a bonus:
Energy (e.g., advanced energy technologies, electricity power and gas industries, neural grid networks)
Innovation (e.g., advancement of new ideas and technologies)
Experience implementing and configuring Data Management Tools and Ontological Based Data Models

Work at ROCKET PHARMA and help cure rare diseases!

Rocket Pharma is a fully integrated, clinical-stage company advancing gene therapies with curative potential for multiple rare childhood diseases. Rocket places enormous value on people and considers team member progress and well-being to be as important as the progress of its pipeline. We are looking for hands-on team players who enjoy collaborating with colleagues. We share a passion for seeking gene therapy cures for devastating diseases and making a difference for patients. This is an opportunity to become an integral part of a small, highly productive team and to help grow an entrepreneurial, scientifically driven organization that is increasingly recognized as a leading biotechnology innovator. In addition to a competitive compensation package featuring a generous 401K match and stock options, the position includes excellent health benefits.

We are seeking a Senior Engineer, MS&T-Data Analytics who will be responsible for process/product data collection, analyses, and monitoring across all phases of GMP manufacturing for cell/gene therapy products. The ideal applicant will have a strong background in statistical methodologies used in the analysis of large manufacturing data sets. The incumbent will support internal manufacturing activities in collaboration with cross-functional department colleagues within Rocket Pharma, as well as engage with external partners, to ensure data is appropriately trended and analyzed.
Responsibilities:
Provide leadership in identifying and implementing appropriate statistical methodologies for evaluating all types of CMC data.
Develop strong cross-functional relationships with analytical development, manufacturing, process development, Quality Control and Quality Assurance to collaborate and align on appropriate statistical methodologies and interpretation of the output.
Support process and analytical (including stability) data monitoring by summarizing, trending, and presenting data.
Support the design and implementation of reliable and relevant continuous process verification (CPV) programs.
Author technical reports summarizing analyses and contribute to relevant sections of regulatory filings.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s + 10 years/Master’s +8 years/PhD + 2 years of experience in a technical discipline (biostatistics, engineering, mathematics or similar)
Experience with using design of experiments (DOE), linear and nonlinear regression, variance component analysis, multivariate analysis, process capability and control charts.
Excellent attention to detail, communication, time management, organizational skills, and flexible attitude with respect to work assignments/new learning with proven ability to interact in a team environment
Comfortable in a fast-paced small company environment with the ability to manage a variety of projects simultaneously and handle rapidly changing information
Expert computer skills including MS Office Suite, JMP Statistical Software (or MiniTab)
Ability to travel up to 10%
A diverse workforce fosters innovation and strengthens Rocket’s business. We ensure equal opportunity without discrimination or harassment in the workplace on the basis of gender, race, color, religion, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, citizenship, status as a protected veteran, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local, state, and federal laws.

Full COVID-19 vaccination is required for employment at Rocket Pharmaceuticals.

Job_description:
Posted
07-Mar-2023
Service line
GWS Segment
Role type
Full-time
Areas of Interest
Construction, Data Centers
Location(s)
Charleston - South Carolina - United States of America, Moncks Corner - South Carolina - United States of America, North Charleston - South Carolina - United States of America, Summerville - South Carolina - United States of America
Job Summary
The Datacenter Automation Systems (DAS) team is committed to the successful implementation of autonomous and semi-autonomous vehicles throughout multiple datacenters. CBRE is seeking a full-time, permanent, CAD Operator with experience in MEP design, manufacturing or data center robotics-centric automation solutions. The DAS CAD Operator will report to the Client-approved location:
Moncks Corner, SC - full time / on site
The DAS CAD Operator requirements may vary according to Client-determined assignments, but most content relates to creating detailed designs for industrial automation equipment and systems in the DAS robotics portfolio at the Client's data centers. This position is part of a multi-disciplinary team creating engineering documentation and design drawing packages. The individual will collaborate with project engineers, technical writers, project managers, and other CAD/BIM Operators. Ideal candidates would be familiar with establishing and managing a design environment. Ideal candidates must be comfortable communicating regularly via video conference, email and internal ticketing systems.

Job Duties:
Acquire clear understanding of product requirements by reviewing, understanding, interpreting and revising technical specifications, blueprints and engineering illustrations, mockups, and prototypes.
Ability to read and interpret design standards and specifications, blueprints, drawings, redlines, etc
Coordinate the CAD design for Navigation Tape and GeoMarker installation package
Installation Drawings
Navigation DesignLayout
GeoMarker datum development
Material Takeoff
Working understanding of construction design package development for field installation.
Ability to translate existing field conditions from documentation and redlines to revise/edit design drawing packages.
Ability to learn software such as Lucidchart to generate shape files for navigation translated from design drawings. .
Capable of managing shifting design production to coordinate with field installation schedules.
Coordinate file management with 3rd party teams for document file transfer.
Maintain audits of latest design revisions against floor plan modifications.
Ability to perform repetitive field measurement tasks for long durations such as bending, kneeling, squatting ,walking, climbing stairs, etc.
Must have excellent organizational skills
Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing

Other duties as assigned.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position.

QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE

Bachelor's degree in Architecture, Engineering, Construction Management, or related field. Minimum two or more years' construction administration, architecture, engineering or similar experience.

Preferred experience with some data center infrastructure projects. Experience in mission critical data centers is a strong plus. Preferred experience with robotic process automation.

CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES

Working towards or eligible for licensure as either a Professional Engineer or Registered Architect is desired.

COMMUNICATION SKILLS

Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information.

FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE

Requires knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and/or commissions. Conducts basic financial analysis.

REASONING ABILITY

Ability to understand and carry out general instructions in standard situations. Ability to solve problems in standard situations. Requires intermediate analytical and quantitative skills.

OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES

Intermediate skills with Microsoft Office Suite. Ability to read and understand architectural drawings. Working knowledge in MS Project is helpful. Knowledge of leases, contracts, and construction practices preferred. 3+ years of minimum proficiency in the use of AutoCAD and Revit. Knowledge of Best Management Practices CAD/BIM environment. Autodesk Software - CAD BIM Solidworks BIM360 etc.

Basic knowledge of the entitlement/permitting process and construction delivery methods and agreements. Some familiarity with construction best practices, general building codes, and various building types and systems. Passion for being detail oriented and highly organized.

SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY

Decisions made with general understanding of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to co-workers and supervisor.

At Customers Bank, we believe in working hard, working smart, working together to deliver memorable customer experiences and having fun. Our vision, mission, and values guide us along our path to achieve excellence. Passion, attitude, creativity, integrity, alignment, and execution are cornerstones of our behaviors. They define who we are as an organization and as individuals. Everyone is encouraged to have personal development plans. By doing so, our team members are on their way to achieve their highest potential and be successful in their personal and professional lives.
Summary of Role:
Customers Bank is seeking a Chief Data Architect (CDA) who will play a crucial role in setting the strategy, technical direction, and providing expert insights and council on data to the organization’s business units and executive leaders. The architect will work as part of a team to modernize our data solutions and change the way we think about and apply data in solutions across our architecture. The architect designs constructs that enable senior management to leverage data to make business decisions and takes a strategic approach to information delivery to ensure accurate and effective data delivery to stakeholders. We consider this an evolutionary role, taking data to the next level for our organization and driving breakthrough outcomes using data.
Key areas of accountability:
The CDA will serve as part of a leadership team focused to driving decisions with data for the organization.
Technical Expertise: The CDA is a senior executive responsible for gaining an understanding of our current state and defining the target state architecture and strategy for the Bank’s information platforms. Serving as the primary technical product owner for our data lakes and related technologies.
Culture and Technical Currency: The new CDA will have a passion for learning and staying abreast of new and emerging trends in IT. He/she should advise the executive team on these new trends as well as competitive and financial impact. He/she will be an innovator, bringing new ideas to the table to enhance service to customers both external and internal. The CDA will have a balanced approach of serving his/her internal customers, while setting the tone for a culture of growth.

Relationship Development: The CDA will have excellent relationships, building trust and credibility throughout the institution as well as with partners and vendors. He/she will build partnerships with fellow team members and industry associates to continually keep abreast of business needs in a rapidly changing digital environment.

Candidate Qualities AND Characteristics:
In addition to the responsibilities outlined above, and the necessary skills and experience to perform them well, there are several traits that a successful candidate will possess. These are listed by category below:
A friendly personal style. Comfortable with communicating complex data management concepts to an executive and board level audience.
High degree of personal integrity and candor. The new leader will have a reputation for ethical behavior and personal responsibility.
A customer service style, recognizing their function as a business enabler and as a support for business decisioning who can work with various teams to develop meaningful solutions.
Results oriented, with a strong drive and work ethic Must have “roll up your sleeves attitude.”
A passion for learning and keeping current on new and emerging technologies; ability to bring new ideas to the table.
Self-starting personality: ability to prioritize and manage diverse responsibilities.
Capacity to get up-to-speed quickly in a new role. Adaptability and flexibility; ability to adjust easily to change.
Communication and Management:
Proven track record of interaction with senior executives, Board members, regulators, and customers.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Strong listening skills and a collaborative style.
Must Haves:
Bachelor’s Degree required; Master’s is preferred.
8+ years’ experience in data architecture with a focus on translating business requirements into technology requirements, defining data standards, and principles, and building the model-development frameworks for our data scientists to leverage.
Strong understanding of the AI landscape - including emerging technologies, players and strategies.
Track record of presenting business cases and cost/benefit analysis for data related spending and initiatives to executive members.
Demonstrated ability to drive alignment and execution in complex rapidly growing organizations.
Excellent leadership, communication, presentation, analytical and problem-solving skills
Nice to Haves:
Experience with Banking and Financial Services business experience highly preferred
Experience working in large enterprise organizations w/ defined, mature processes
Startup experience, including working closely with founders or a founding team
Customers Bank will provide consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to their race, color, religion, national origin, sex/ gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability.
VEVRAA Federal Contractor, seeking priority referral of qualified protected veterans.

Job_title: Americas Credit, Fixed Income Corporate Actions Data Specialist
Job_description:
Bloomberg runs on data. In Data, we are responsible for onboarding, analyzing, and supplying data to answer our clients' most pressing questions. Our product is responsible for corporate action events affecting corporate bonds and preferred shares.
Whether you are sourcing relevant market data from new or existing providers, processing complex financial data or implementing technology solutions to enhance our processes and software, your work will ensure that we deliver accurate market data to the financial world first!

What you can expect from this opportunity:
You are the type of person that looks beyond the headline. You live for the detail and understand the importance of the underlying data that drives news and analysis. You enjoy the challenge of solving complex problems. You are just the sort of person we are looking for to join Data.

Bloomberg Data is looking for a highly motivated and driven individual to develop and expand the scope of Bloomberg's Fixed Income Corporate Actions Product. You will be part of a fast-paced environment and will be responsible for secondary market transactions happening on North American corporate bonds and preferred shares. Analysts within the team are in constant communication with liability management desks and other market participants who are involved with voluntary and mandatory distribution, redemption, and reorganization events. You will play a key role in producing financial content, calculations, research notes and analyses for our clients using the Bloomberg Terminal. Demonstrating a commitment to learning and a passion for the Fixed Income industry is required.

We'll trust you to:
Build positive and accountable relationships with clients, colleagues, and partners of the Fixed Income Corporate Actions product (including buy- and sell-side firms)
Acquire an understanding of the workflows designed to deliver class-leading quality while meeting or exceeding the timeliness demands of the market
Collaborate with colleagues to implement solutions and frameworks to enhance our processes, software, and data offerings
Maintain the existing proprietary database
Improve the relationships of our Terminal users to provide subject matter expertise by quickly and accurately answering client inquiries
Integrate your natural interests and strengths with the Fixed Income product to add value beyond data acquisition and remediation. Explore new strengths and opportunities by upskilling.
Support product development
You'll need you to have:
Relevant experience in a role within the financial markets, data analysis, information technology, credit document analysis, or research
2+ years of work experience is highly preferred
Proven ability to build and maintain client relationships
Effective research and analysis skills with attention to detail
Excellent communication, customer service, and teamwork skills
An interest in technology (Python, SQL, etc) and data analysis
Ability to spot market trends and act on them to enhance depth and breadth of coverage
Legal authorization to work in the US without visa sponsorship now or in the future
Does this sound like you?
Apply if you think we're a good match! We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are.

Job_title: Supervisor, QA Data Integrity, Computer Software Validation
Job_description:
Jubilant HollisterStier LLC, a well-established member of the business community in Spokane, Washington, provides a complete range of services to support the pharmaceutical and biopharmaceutical industries. The Allergy business is a worldwide leader in the manufacture of allergenic extracts, targeted primarily at treating allergies and asthma. Jubilant HollisterStier is also a nationally recognized contract manufacturer of sterile injectable vials, and lyophilized products. Jubilant HollisterStier is a proud member of the Jubilant Pharma family.

Our Promise: Caring, Sharing, Growing

We will, with the utmost care for the environment and society, continue to enhance value for our customers and stakeholders by providing innovative products and economically efficient solutions’ through growth, cost effectiveness and wise investment of resources.


Job Description:

Supervisor, QA Data Integrity/Governance and Computer Software Validation - Responsible for the overall supervision and execution of CSV activities/systems compliance and data governance and will be accountable for all computer and IT related compliances at the JHS-Spokane site. Support deviation investigations related to site level IT system and applications. SME for site external & internal audit DI/CSV support. SME for site in managing IT system compliance related issues and leading efforts related to compliance in these areas.



The QA Supervisor oversees the Quality Assurance team and assures that team outputs meet necessary quality standards.
Provides daily tactical planning and oversight of QA CSV and Data Integrity programs to ensure that all work meets the requirements as defined by Standard Operating Procedures and GMP.
Establishes and maintains standard operating procedures and records associated with the above listed areas of responsibility.
This position provides direction and support of the daily operations in the Quality Assurance Validation and Quality Systems Department through scheduling, assignment of tasks among the QA team.
The individual in this position will establish and maintain a program to ensure the appropriate training and documentation of training of QA team (including safety, cGMP, and job functions).
The individual in this position will also be responsible for providing supervisor oversight for the QA team, including conducting performance evaluations of that staff.
Partner with other departments to ensure site is compliant.


Qualifications:

Bachelor of Science required.
Minimum 5 years related experience with Bachelor of Science, -OR- 10 years experience without Bachelor of Science.
Experience with technical writing, building and manufacturing computer control processes/systems, QA operation systems and validation, computer software validation, data integrity, and risk assessment is required.
Experience with GMP records storage, and SAP is preferred.

The salary range for this position is $76,817 - $128,005 depending on experience.

Boulder Community Health is a Certified Level II Trauma Center. In 2022, we celebrated the 100thanniversary of the founding of our organization. We are honored to hold the awards of 2021 U.S. News & World ‘Best Hospitals for Maternity Care’, 2019 Best Medical Facility from Boulder Weekly, and Best Local Employer from Daily Camera. Come be part of an independent, community-focused health system; feel good knowing that your work will make a difference in people’s lives and positively contribute to the community.

POSITION SUMMARY

Coordinates the cancer data management system to promote quality care for the cancer patients at Boulder Community Health. Maintains compliance with the requirements for an approved cancer program and national accreditation program for breast centers set forth by the American College of Surgeons Commission on Cancer. Maintains compliance with the requirements for mandatory statewide reporting set forth by the Colorado Cancer Registry and Department of Public health.

JOB QUALIFICATIONS

Education or Formal Training

Accredited Record Technician (RHIT) or Registered Record Administrator (RHIA) preferred. Certified Tumor Registrar (CTR) required. ICD-9 Coding, cancer staging and word-processing. Expertise required with Excel spreadsheets and CNExT (or similar automated cancer registry system) ACOS web-based data upload process including but not limited to the National Call for Data (NCDB) and the Facility Identifiable data (FIPS level 1 & 2). State of Colorado Public Health and Environment compliance with state and federal laws mandating data collection and compliance in the research of those diagnosed with and treated for cancer. The Cancer Registry is responsible for guarding the hospitals compliance and fostering a cohesive relationship with the State liaisons and personnel and providing documentation to them upon request, to evidence the hospitals compliance with the state and federal statutes.

Special Qualifications (Licensure, Registration, etc.)

Bachelor or Associate Degree in health information technology are related field preferred. Certified Tumor Registrar (CTR) required.

Knowledge, Skill and Ability

Knowledge of all American College of Surgeons and State of Colorado requirements for Cancer Registry accreditation process. Working knowledge of all levels of accreditation and evidence of experience with standards.
Evidence of ability to produce an annual report and comply with procedures for reporting to the state as required by American College of Surgeons.
Demonstrated ability for successful completion of ACOS accreditation survey.
Demonstrated excellent communication skills:
Writing ability including accurate grammar and spelling as evidenced by concise and clear report writing, compilation and organization of annual reports, preparation of tumor conference agendas, and synopses of data.
Verbal skills as evidenced by ability to communicate with all members of the health care team, the state tumor registry and patients when appropriate.
Demonstrated ability to execute a successful breast & cancer conference.
Demonstrated ability to accurately analyze and abstract patient records with an average time of 60 minutes or less per abstract.
Detail-oriented with ability to make independent decisions and use critical thinking skills.
Demonstrated ability to execute accomplishment of ACOS required registry data studies
Demonstrated ability to execute scientific studies leading to sound data to be presented to the Cancer Committee as a source of outcomes analysis.
Demonstrated ability to keep apprised of the ever-changing policies and procedures of the state of Colorado and the data reporting elements involved in this process.
Demonstrated ability to research and comply with changing federal agency regulations.
Demonstrated ability to stay up to date with regulatory and complementary agencies to adjust hospital abstracting when a specific precedent has been changed or set. The agencies include but are not limited to; coding schemes (CPT, ICD-0-3, ICD-9-CM), Surveillance Epidemiology & End Results (SEER), American Joint Commission on Cancer (AJCC).
Must have knowledge and ability to perform required aspects of the computer and its programs: follow-up letters, statistical reports, Colorado State Cancer Registry reporting and other required medical and cancer data.

Experience

At least five years of experience as a cancer data registrar in an ACOS accredited Cancer Program.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Assists in developing and maintaining cancer program standards by ACoS/COC and NAPBC.
Coordinates maintenance of appropriate files, reports and other cancer related data to ensure approval standards by the American College of Surgeons and the Colorado State Cancer Registry. Preparing graphs and statistics.
Prepares cancer reports and statistical data of the cancer program and breast center activities to administration, physician, outside agencies and/or Colorado State Cancer Registry.
Develops and implement changes in cancer registry policies and procedures to ensure CoC and NAPBC requirements
Monitors quality data (including periodic audits) to ensure data quality and compliance with state and CoC and NAPBC requirements.
Coordinates, plans, attends, documents, and promotes attendance at all Tumor Conferences.
Schedules a minimum of 4 Cancer Committee meetings a year on the medical staff calendar.
Drafts Cancer Committee agendas to represent each standard outlined by the ACOS. Allocate time on the agenda for each coordinator and specialty to give report, at the designated intervals required by the ACOS, if not more often.
Serves as a member of the Cancer Committee.
Coordinates Cancer Registry abstractors and oversight of all of their encompassing cancer registry activities.

About Boulder Community Health and Boulder, Colorado

Uncompromising medical excellence delivered with respect and compassion. Since 1922, Boulder Community Health has built a strong reputation on these values. As community-owned and operated not-for-profit hospital and clinic locations, we remain dedicated to the evolving needs of our citizens and providing access to high-quality care. Nestled in the foothills of the Rocky Mountains, the Boulder lifestyle is conductive to enjoying the outdoors and brings a fresh perspective to healthcare practice. Surround yourself by natural beauty and an active, life-embracing community. Enjoy state-of-the-art facilities and equipment along with competitive compensation and benefits, including health/dental/life, tuition reimbursement, on-site fitness center, Employee Wellness, Employee Activities & Discounts, and many more!


Location: Boulder Community Health · Oncology Services Admin
Schedule: Full-time, Days - 8 hour shifts, M - F, flexible schedule

Job_title: Global Risk Data & Business Intelligence Manager
Job_description:
WHAT YOU'LL DO

Global Risk Management (RM) is dedicated to identifying and managing significant risk exposure at BCG.

The Data & Business Intelligence Manager position involves designing, managing, and deploying data analytics, reports, and dynamic dashboards. The tools and dashboard created will be utilized by both the Assurance and Advisory team and key functional stakeholders. This position is responsible for extracting data from multiple sources, processing and validating data, and conducting root cause and trend analysis. The Data & Business Intelligence Manager will also present analytic findings to various stakeholders.


In addition, this role will participate in risk assessment for BCG Offices, functions and processes and looks to provide management with an independent and objective assessment of business risk and internal controls.

The successful candidate should be comfortable performing the following: writing queries in programing languages such as SQL and Python, developing analytical visualizations using Alteryx and Tableau (e.g. building complex dashboards), understanding cloud data warehousing (e.g. Snowflake), business intelligence architecture, application and design, Machine Learning & AI concepts. The candidate must also understand and assess risks across a wide variety of business areas, build relationships with diverse stakeholders, manage a complex network of individuals, influence change management across the organization, prioritize issues, and escalate appropriately.

YOU'RE GOOD AT
We are looking for someone with a passion and understanding of data analytics and business intelligence, risk management, change management, and global business. The role will entail the following:

Data & Business Analytics (60%)
Assist the team with developing short-, medium- and long-term data analytics strategy
Review, update, and investigate pertinent data from various data sources to ensure a high level of quality, accuracy, and timeliness
Query multiple data sources using programing languages such as SQL and Python
Produce visualization and developing dashboards using Tableau/Alteryx
Analyze data and provide insights and recommendations for organizational planning and operations.
Create business analytics by synthesizing information from multiple sources of data for business decisions and strategic planning.
Demonstrate continuous effort to improve operations, streamline work processes, and work cooperatively and jointly to provide quality deliverables
Provide training and education to the team on data and analytics related topics

Office Risk Review Program (20%)
Meet with Office Leadership and the Global Functions to lead the planning, execution, and post-review efforts for a portfolio of Office risk reviews and BCG’s extension businesses.
Travel to any BCG’s Office throughout the world and work with the team to develop and maintain the risk review work program
Assist the team with the execution of risk reviews to assess the risk and controls environment in the offices and test the effectiveness of controls
Perform substantive tests of transactions
Prepare timely and comprehensive documentation of findings and recommendations, including local management comments
Maintain risk profiles for each office and prioritizing offices for a visit
Act as a risk liaison with the local office, providing support and education on important risk issues
Global Process Review Program (20%)
Lead targeted functional/operating risk reviews, which are focused on global or regional processes.
Responsibilities will include defining the project scope and strategy, conducting process walk-throughs, performing detailed testing, drafting detailed reporting/action plans, and following up on implementation efforts.
Focus on the scope and objectives of each review to ensure the highest risk areas are addressed and the key findings are communicated
Evaluate, in detail, the use of new digital technologies and the risks these solutions may pose to the global functions as BCG’s business operations continue to evolve and modernize.
Develop relationships with key functional leaders.
Work with Global Risk Management Senior Director to develop an annual plan of global functional risk reviews; align staffing and coordinate scheduling with key stakeholders.
Monitor trends and emerging issues for reporting to leadership (i.e., Audit and Risk Committee).
Act as a risk liaison with the global functions, providing support and education on important risk issues.
YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)
An academic degree in a relevant discipline: Data Science, Business Analytics, Mathematics or Computer Science
5+ years successful experience related to Data Warehouse and Data Analytics, preferably in professional services, or the consulting industry.
Understanding of enterprise data warehouses (Snowflake), business intelligence architecture, application and design, ML & AI concepts
Deep knowledge of current analytics technologies and software applications such as SQL/Python query language, Alteryx, Tableau and Microsoft tools
Strong analytical skills with detail orientation; strong communication skills – written and verbal
Ability to work cross-functionally in a global environment
Ability to travel to all BCG office locations Worldwide
Travel is required approximately 15% of the time, with the need to be flexible if additional travel is required. Travel is typically one week in length (may include weekends) but must be adaptable for risk reviews of up to 2+ weeks if required. Travel is generally planned well in advance but must be flexible to travel on limited notice.
Travel will align with BCG’s Covid-19 protocols and applicable laws and regulations.
YOU'LL WORK WITH
Local/system/regional operational leaders, global functional leaders, and BCG leadership. BCG's Chief Risk Officer leads the team, which is comprised of team members across various cities and countries. This role will report to the Global Risk Management Director
ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
Candidates should be aware that BCG currently maintains a policy requiring all US & Canada based employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Newly hired employees must be fully vaccinated prior to their employment start date. BCG is an equal opportunity employer and will provide a reasonable accommodation to those unable to be vaccinated for medical or religious reasons where it is not an undue hardship to the company to do so as provided under applicable federal, state, provincial and local law.

Job_title: Product Manager - Data Management Lab, Bloomberg Data Dictionary
Job_description:
Bloomberg's Data Management Lab enables internal and external users to efficiently leverage an elite data set to perform analysis, uncover vital insights. and make financial decisions. To this end, the Data Management Lab empowers our Data professionals to understand their domains end-to-end, make their products "ready-to-use", and improve the way users interact with our data. We focus on five areas of data management: discoverability, accessibility, appraisability, interoperability and consistency.

In this role you will be working with the Bloomberg Data Dictionary (BDD) team. We are in the midst of taking our metadata models and data management products to the next level. The goal is to promote the use of our data models by both external clients and internal applications. This person will have a high level of business, communication, and technology skills, so that they can build working prototypes as well as work optimally with internal stakeholders and clients.

The Role:

We are enhancing existing metamodels and metadata management systems. This includes building new tools and systems to manage, govern, link and discover metadata. It also involves developing and improving new functions and services to distribute metadata.

In this exciting role, we expect you to deliver a product vision and implement that vision in collaboration with Engineering, Product, and Data. You will be a key person in developing technical products that provide best-in-class customer experience. You will understand the requirements of both internal users, and external clients, and then shape the product offering to meet their needs. You would be familiar with specifying requirements including writing JIRA stories. You would have deep technical experience around using structured data models and data sets to solve complex business demands.

What's in it for you:
An influential business role within a fast-growing area of Bloomberg's Data business.
Broad scope to craft and specify meta-model for the company.
We'll trust you to:
Take responsibility for Bloomberg Data Dictionary's technology products.
Develop a product roadmap by evaluating what is possible and viable
Communicate the roadmap across the organization, and work with engineering to execute the roadmap
Develop functional and technical requirements by leading conversations among internal partners (Engineering, Product, Data, Sales), and clients
You'll need to have:
Bachelor's (or Master's) degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related technical discipline
4+ years of relevant work experience
Experience in developing and implementing technology systems
Understanding of data modelling (either ER, RDF, or other similar techniques)
Understanding of financials markets and how Bloomberg's clients use our data
The ability to address multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment
We'd love to see:
Knowledge of metadata systems and models
Knowledge of linked data and knowledge graphs
Knowledge of Market Data and Reference Data
Does this sound like you?

Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are.

Job_title: Senior Software Engineer - Data Platform - Bloomberg Second Measure
Job_description:
Bloomberg is a data company that is redefining how people use alternative data. This transformation started with Bloomberg Second Measure (BSM), a data product for understanding company performance and consumer trends using consumer transaction data. These financial transactions are the foundation upon which we build as we acquire, ingest, enrich, and distribute additional alternative data sets to innovate through our novel and valuable data products.

The Alternative Data Platform team is a software and systems engineering team focused on providing a usable, scalable, and reliable platform for building data products from alternative data. Our platform provides primitives and abstractions enabling our users to creatively solve problems and run the powerful analytical workflows necessary for alternative data. We empower our users to focus on the data by reducing the pain and frustration of using existing data and analytics tools, and adopt new and innovative technologies to enable the continuous evolution necessary for innovation.

As the foundational engineering team supporting alternative data, the team has two core responsibilities:

Design, build, and maintain the data processing platform that empowers data scientists, data analysts, and data engineers to rapidly prototype and autonomously build, develop, and release data products
Design, build, and maintain the query and data infrastructure critical to the research, development, and publication of alternative data
We run our platform in AWS. We build upon open-source technologies such as Kubernetes, Spark, Argo Workflows, Argo Events, and Trino in addition to adopting and supporting open standards such as OpenAPI, CloudEvents, and Open Lineage. Our users inform and guide our roadmap. Together, we evolve and deliver an ambitious vision for how to develop data products.


What's in it for you:
You'll be part of a diverse team with varying levels of experience and backgrounds that work together to create the platform. We support each other where we have expertise and become experts together where we have none. We seek input and feedback from our teammates, valuing open discussion and collaboration.

You'll have an opportunity to:
Building APIs to orchestrate deployments and execution of data processing systems.
Prototype data and analytics technologies to adopt and incorporate into our platform.
Use established and existing technologies in novel ways to solve our problems.
Integrate and manage cloud resources and services.
Create tools and UIs to enhance usability and developer autonomy
We'll trust you to:
Build and maintain systems that are scalable, reliable, and usable while simplifying the complexities for the benefit of our users
Take ownership in the design and implementation of technical solutions from start to finish including prototyping, development, testing, and release.
Collaborate with your team and the wider engineering organization and Alternative Data product teams to achieve the team's goals.
Own the infrastructure, services, systems used to provide the platform.
Write and review code, develop documentation, debug problems with large, distributed, and complex systems.
You'll need to have:
4+ Years working with one or more of our development language (Python, Go, Typescript) and libraries, frameworks, and APIs within those languages.
A Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, similar field of study or equivalent work experience
Experience building, maintaining, and debugging production systems and services such as cloud infrastructure, load balancers and APIs.
Curiosity for investigating and understanding all areas of the platform whether it is working with AWS VPCs, improving a CLI used by developers, or understanding the primitive and logical types in a supported file format.
Experience with distributed systems and service architectures.
We'd love to see:
Polyglot engineers that are comfortable with using multiple languages for building production systems
Experience in and around technical data systems such as Spark, Flink, Dask, Clickhouse, Druid and technologies such as Parquet, Iceberg, and cloud object-stores.
Support of production systems with knowledge of Linux, networking (transport and application layer protocols), and deploying systems and services using Kubernetes, Mesos or Nomad.
Experience building on Kubernetes using the operator pattern, admission webhooks, and other services that work with the Kubernetes API.
Prior design and automating operations cloud infrastructure such as AWS, GCP, Azure using tools such as Terraform and Ansible

Bloomberg is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of age, ancestry, color, gender identity or expression, genetic predisposition or carrier status, marital status, national or ethnic origin, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, sexual and other reproductive health decisions, parental or caring status, physical or mental disability, pregnancy or parental leave, protected veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, or any other classification protected by applicable law.

Bloomberg is a disability inclusive employer. Please let us know if you require any reasonable adjustments to be made for the recruitment process. If you would prefer to discuss this confidentially, please email amer_recruit@bloomberg.net.

Interviewing with us:
We believe interviewing is a two way street. It's a way for us to get to know you and your skills, and also a way for you to learn more about the team, our technical challenges, and what you'd be working on. The content of each interview round will be tailored to the role and your background.

We want to ensure you can put your best foot forward throughout the process, so if you have any questions or need any accommodations to be successful, please let us know!

We have a lot of opportunities to choose from in Engineering, and it is important to us that your skills and experience align best with the team you are interviewing with. To help ensure you are placed on the right team, your application will be considered for all of our current vacancies in Engineering at the first stage of the interview process.

Oasis Systems has an exciting opportunity for a Senior Python Data Scientist to support the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) in Washington, DC. The contractor shall provide support in data analytics (including descriptive and predictive analytics and data mining), large data manipulation, data visualization, and the use of data analytic tools. Activities that the contractor may be tasked to perform include gathering requirements from stakeholders, conducting financial data analysis in a Big Data environment, and creating reports and documentation.

LOCATION: Washington, DC
JOB STATUS: Full-Time
TRAVEL: N/A
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS (Education, Certifications, Experience, Skills)
SECURITY CLEARANCE: Ability to pass a Special Agreement Check (SAC) and a National Agency Check and Inquiries (NACI) Background Investigation and U.S. Citizenship is required for all applicants.
EDUCATION: Bachelor’s degree
CERTIFICATIONS AND TOOLS: Experience developing data-driven applications in Python and/or other data management tools. Highly experienced with data manipulation and transformation. Experience in Finance is a plus.

Creating documentation as required under the Project Management Life Cycle and the Configuration Change Board (CCB) in order to move projects to the production environment.
Participating in facilitated meetings between stakeholders at CFTC, which may include regular status meetings, user acceptance testing meetings, and ad hoc development discussions.

The Software Application Developer is part of the Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES) development group and responsible for technical design, development, testing, implementation and support of the order entry and shop-floor applications. This function is the 2nd / 3rd level application support for the MES systems and collaborates with the application users to improve current processes, develop solution proposal to fulfill the changing business needs and programming of new functionality. Since the order entry applications communicate with customers via EDI this function is also involved in all phases of the life cycle to integrate external customer. Training and support of key-users is part of the role to assure a strong knowledgeable user community.

Job Description:

Analyze business requirements and translate business needs into functional software solutions.
Development and programming of applications, new functionality and reports according to the business requirements
Implementation of the software solution through the development life cycle, including documentation.
Develop solution design and documentation for EDI interfaces, including business requirements, process definition, data mapping and data flow modeling.
Monitor and troubleshooting of existing applications and interfaces, analysis and resolution of related help tickets.
Work with the user community to determine business requirements

Job Requirements:

Work at ROCKET PHARMA and help cure rare diseases!

Rocket Pharma is a fully integrated, clinical-stage company advancing gene therapies with curative potential for multiple rare childhood diseases. Rocket places enormous value on people and considers team member progress and well-being to be as important as the progress of its pipeline. We are looking for hands-on team players who enjoy collaborating with colleagues. We share a passion for seeking gene therapy cures for devastating diseases and making a difference for patients. This is an opportunity to become an integral part of a small, highly productive team and to help grow an entrepreneurial, scientifically driven organization that is increasingly recognized as a leading biotechnology innovator. In addition to a competitive compensation package featuring a generous 401K match and stock options, the position includes excellent health benefits.

We are seeking a Senior Engineer, MS&T-Data Analytics who will be responsible for process/product data collection, analyses, and monitoring across all phases of GMP manufacturing for cell/gene therapy products. The ideal applicant will have a strong background in statistical methodologies used in the analysis of large manufacturing data sets. The incumbent will support internal manufacturing activities in collaboration with cross-functional department colleagues within Rocket Pharma, as well as engage with external partners, to ensure data is appropriately trended and analyzed.
Responsibilities:
Provide leadership in identifying and implementing appropriate statistical methodologies for evaluating all types of CMC data.
Develop strong cross-functional relationships with analytical development, manufacturing, process development, Quality Control and Quality Assurance to collaborate and align on appropriate statistical methodologies and interpretation of the output.
Support process and analytical (including stability) data monitoring by summarizing, trending, and presenting data.
Support the design and implementation of reliable and relevant continuous process verification (CPV) programs.
Author technical reports summarizing analyses and contribute to relevant sections of regulatory filings.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s + 10 years/Master’s +8 years/PhD + 2 years of experience in a technical discipline (biostatistics, engineering, mathematics or similar)
Experience with using design of experiments (DOE), linear and nonlinear regression, variance component analysis, multivariate analysis, process capability and control charts.
Excellent attention to detail, communication, time management, organizational skills, and flexible attitude with respect to work assignments/new learning with proven ability to interact in a team environment
Comfortable in a fast-paced small company environment with the ability to manage a variety of projects simultaneously and handle rapidly changing information
Expert computer skills including MS Office Suite, JMP Statistical Software (or MiniTab)
Ability to travel up to 10%
A diverse workforce fosters innovation and strengthens Rocket’s business. We ensure equal opportunity without discrimination or harassment in the workplace on the basis of gender, race, color, religion, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, citizenship, status as a protected veteran, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local, state, and federal laws.

At Customers Bank, we believe in working hard, working smart, working together to deliver memorable customer experiences and having fun. Our vision, mission, and values guide us along our path to achieve excellence. Passion, attitude, creativity, integrity, alignment, and execution are cornerstones of our behaviors. They define who we are as an organization and as individuals. Everyone is encouraged to have personal development plans. By doing so, our team members are on their way to achieve their highest potential and be successful in their personal and professional lives.
Summary of Role:
Customers Bank is seeking a Chief Data Architect (CDA) who will play a crucial role in setting the strategy, technical direction, and providing expert insights and council on data to the organization’s business units and executive leaders. The architect will work as part of a team to modernize our data solutions and change the way we think about and apply data in solutions across our architecture. The architect designs constructs that enable senior management to leverage data to make business decisions and takes a strategic approach to information delivery to ensure accurate and effective data delivery to stakeholders. We consider this an evolutionary role, taking data to the next level for our organization and driving breakthrough outcomes using data.
Key areas of accountability:
The CDA will serve as part of a leadership team focused to driving decisions with data for the organization.
Technical Expertise: The CDA is a senior executive responsible for gaining an understanding of our current state and defining the target state architecture and strategy for the Bank’s information platforms. Serving as the primary technical product owner for our data lakes and related technologies.
Culture and Technical Currency: The new CDA will have a passion for learning and staying abreast of new and emerging trends in IT. He/she should advise the executive team on these new trends as well as competitive and financial impact. He/she will be an innovator, bringing new ideas to the table to enhance service to customers both external and internal. The CDA will have a balanced approach of serving his/her internal customers, while setting the tone for a culture of growth.

Relationship Development: The CDA will have excellent relationships, building trust and credibility throughout the institution as well as with partners and vendors. He/she will build partnerships with fellow team members and industry associates to continually keep abreast of business needs in a rapidly changing digital environment.

Candidate Qualities AND Characteristics:
In addition to the responsibilities outlined above, and the necessary skills and experience to perform them well, there are several traits that a successful candidate will possess. These are listed by category below:
A friendly personal style. Comfortable with communicating complex data management concepts to an executive and board level audience.
High degree of personal integrity and candor. The new leader will have a reputation for ethical behavior and personal responsibility.
A customer service style, recognizing their function as a business enabler and as a support for business decisioning who can work with various teams to develop meaningful solutions.
Results oriented, with a strong drive and work ethic Must have “roll up your sleeves attitude.”
A passion for learning and keeping current on new and emerging technologies; ability to bring new ideas to the table.
Self-starting personality: ability to prioritize and manage diverse responsibilities.
Capacity to get up-to-speed quickly in a new role. Adaptability and flexibility; ability to adjust easily to change.
Communication and Management:
Proven track record of interaction with senior executives, Board members, regulators, and customers.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Strong listening skills and a collaborative style.
Must Haves:
Bachelor’s Degree required; Master’s is preferred.
8+ years’ experience in data architecture with a focus on translating business requirements into technology requirements, defining data standards, and principles, and building the model-development frameworks for our data scientists to leverage.
Strong understanding of the AI landscape - including emerging technologies, players and strategies.
Track record of presenting business cases and cost/benefit analysis for data related spending and initiatives to executive members.
Demonstrated ability to drive alignment and execution in complex rapidly growing organizations.
Excellent leadership, communication, presentation, analytical and problem-solving skills
Nice to Haves:
Experience with Banking and Financial Services business experience highly preferred
Experience working in large enterprise organizations w/ defined, mature processes
Startup experience, including working closely with founders or a founding team
Customers Bank will provide consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to their race, color, religion, national origin, sex/ gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability.
VEVRAA Federal Contractor, seeking priority referral of qualified protected veterans.
