Job_description:
Posted
07-Mar-2023
Service line
GWS Segment
Role type
Full-time
Areas of Interest
Construction, Data Centers
Location(s)
Charleston - South Carolina - United States of America, Moncks Corner - South Carolina - United States of America, North Charleston - South Carolina - United States of America, Summerville - South Carolina - United States of America
Job Summary
The Datacenter Automation Systems (DAS) team is committed to the successful implementation of autonomous and semi-autonomous vehicles throughout multiple datacenters. CBRE is seeking a full-time, permanent, CAD Operator with experience in MEP design, manufacturing or data center robotics-centric automation solutions. The DAS CAD Operator will report to the Client-approved location:
Moncks Corner, SC - full time / on site
The DAS CAD Operator requirements may vary according to Client-determined assignments, but most content relates to creating detailed designs for industrial automation equipment and systems in the DAS robotics portfolio at the Client's data centers. This position is part of a multi-disciplinary team creating engineering documentation and design drawing packages. The individual will collaborate with project engineers, technical writers, project managers, and other CAD/BIM Operators. Ideal candidates would be familiar with establishing and managing a design environment. Ideal candidates must be comfortable communicating regularly via video conference, email and internal ticketing systems.

Job Duties:
Acquire clear understanding of product requirements by reviewing, understanding, interpreting and revising technical specifications, blueprints and engineering illustrations, mockups, and prototypes.
Ability to read and interpret design standards and specifications, blueprints, drawings, redlines, etc
Coordinate the CAD design for Navigation Tape and GeoMarker installation package
Installation Drawings
Navigation DesignLayout
GeoMarker datum development
Material Takeoff
Working understanding of construction design package development for field installation.
Ability to translate existing field conditions from documentation and redlines to revise/edit design drawing packages.
Ability to learn software such as Lucidchart to generate shape files for navigation translated from design drawings. .
Capable of managing shifting design production to coordinate with field installation schedules.
Coordinate file management with 3rd party teams for document file transfer.
Maintain audits of latest design revisions against floor plan modifications.
Ability to perform repetitive field measurement tasks for long durations such as bending, kneeling, squatting ,walking, climbing stairs, etc.
Must have excellent organizational skills
Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing

Other duties as assigned.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position.

QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE

Bachelor's degree in Architecture, Engineering, Construction Management, or related field. Minimum two or more years' construction administration, architecture, engineering or similar experience.

Preferred experience with some data center infrastructure projects. Experience in mission critical data centers is a strong plus. Preferred experience with robotic process automation.

CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES

Working towards or eligible for licensure as either a Professional Engineer or Registered Architect is desired.

COMMUNICATION SKILLS

Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information.

FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE

Requires knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and/or commissions. Conducts basic financial analysis.

REASONING ABILITY

Ability to understand and carry out general instructions in standard situations. Ability to solve problems in standard situations. Requires intermediate analytical and quantitative skills.

OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES

Intermediate skills with Microsoft Office Suite. Ability to read and understand architectural drawings. Working knowledge in MS Project is helpful. Knowledge of leases, contracts, and construction practices preferred. 3+ years of minimum proficiency in the use of AutoCAD and Revit. Knowledge of Best Management Practices CAD/BIM environment. Autodesk Software - CAD BIM Solidworks BIM360 etc.

Basic knowledge of the entitlement/permitting process and construction delivery methods and agreements. Some familiarity with construction best practices, general building codes, and various building types and systems. Passion for being detail oriented and highly organized.

SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY

Decisions made with general understanding of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to co-workers and supervisor.

Job_description:
For UCOP internal applicants, please login to the internal candidate gateway at: Jobs at UCOP

Position Base
Riverside

Location
UCPath Center

UCPATH CENTER

At the University of California (UC), your contributions make a difference. A world leader producing Nobel and Pulitzer prize recipients with over 150 years of groundbreaking research transforming the world. Choose a career where you can leverage your knowledge, skills and aspirations to inspire and support some of the greatest minds in the world, and those who will follow in their footsteps. Working at the University of California is being part of a unique institution, and a vibrant and diverse community. At the University of California, Office of the President, we propel our mission through impactful work locally, in government centers and systemwide. We are passionate people, serving the greater good.

The University of California, one of the largest and most acclaimed institutions of higher learning in the world, is dedicated to excellence in teaching, research and public service. The University of California Office of the President is the headquarters to the 10 campuses, six academic medical centers and three national laboratories and enrolls premier students from California, the nation and the world. Learn more about the UC Office of the President

The UCPath Center is the University of California's shared services center in Riverside, CA. The UCPath Center manages the payroll, benefits, and other human resources transactions for more than 200,000 UC employees working across ten UC campuses, five medical centers, three national labs and more. The staff at the UCPath Center work in a variety of areas including business operations, customer service, quality management, technology, training, human resources and communications. Learn more about the UCPath Center

POSITION SUMMARY

Applies skills as a seasoned, experienced professional with a full understanding of industry-wide business process and analysis practices and organizational policies and procedures. Resolves a wide range of business process issues of moderate to complex scope. Demonstrates good judgment in selecting methods and techniques to obtain solutions.

Applies human resources (HR) and Workforce Administration (WFA) business process analysis, professional HR and Compensation concepts as well as department/unit and campus policies and procedures to resolve a variety of business process problems and to make recommendations for system and process improvement. Works on business process issues of moderate to complex scope where evaluation of processes, procedures and data requires analysis using a variety of factors.

Responsibilities

65%

SYSTEM SUPPORT, TESTING, AND CONFIGURATION


Works closely with other department members and ITSS to support the PeopleSoft Human Capital Management system for HR/ WFA related processes.


This position will serve as the UCPath Center subject matter expert (SME) for the Workforce Administration, Compensation Administration, Absence Management and Position Management modules within UCPath.


This position will also serve as UCPath Center SME for all HR, Leave of Absence and Compensation customizations and vendor processes.


Analyze processes and identify system discrepancies related to Primary Job Derivation, Paygroup assignment, Mass Compensation processing and other HR/ WFA related customized batch processes that run to no success or produce errors. Will review error logs and record system issues and develop and implement solutions.


Coordinates testing process for system changes to include scheduling test cycles with the appropriate parties, obtaining testers and applicable test database access, and translates business requirements into test cases. Executes testing according to testing plan and communicates results to required parties. Plans and executes unit integration and acceptance testing.


Coordinates and performs table and configuration maintenance within the HR/ WFA department modules and tables.


Use in-depth knowledge of HR/ WFA business processes and rules to communicate system needs and requirements.


Assists with data analysis to find trends or indications of potential issues and provides support for processing and troubleshooting changes within the UCPath system.


Creates and edits queries for data audits, testing validation and troubleshooting issues.


Assess new functionality as it is released and advise the UCPath Center leadership on the use of new functionality to improve business operations.


25%

BUSINESS AND SYSTEM ANALYSIS


Provides and applies technical expertise in identifying, evaluating and developing complex systems and procedures. Creates complex specifications for systems to meet end-user requirements. Involved in developing complex user interface designs. Plans and executes unit integration and acceptance testing.


Participates in cross-functional teams to address complex business or systems issues.


Identifies gaps in business processes and system functionality and works with the necessary parties to recommend and implement system changes.


Monitors policy and rate changes to update business process and system modifications to salary plan and grade tables, including the preparation of Business Requirement Documents. Gathers, analyzes, prepares and summarizes recommendations for approval of business process and procedural documentation. Recommends and implements changes in processes and procedures.


Stays current on configuration changes needed to implement upcoming mass wage implementations as well as salary plan, department and table requirements.


Creates and updates testing scripts when implementing enhancements and/or during the migration process for system defects.


Provides knowledge transfer to WFA Workstreams on business process and system changes.


Review existing business processes, assist operational groups with identifying inefficiencies, enhance quality control standards and recommend optimal solutions for process improvement.


Provides project management support between WFA teams and ITSS as required.


Creates, tracks, manages, and drives all business process defects to full resolution via workarounds and incidents. Uses internal tracking tools to maintain a current status of issues. Partners with ITSS department to ensure effective and timely resolution of all workarounds, change requests and incidents. Consults with WFA department supervisors and manager to ensure defects, workarounds, and incidents are managed according to specific business/process need.


5%

Gathers, analyzes, prepares and summarizes business and user needs, documenting requirements and revising existing system and process logic issues as necessary. Provides support and training on new applications. Guides and advises less-experienced Business Systems Analysts.


5%

Gathers, analyzes, prepares and summarizes recommendations for approval of business process and procedural documentation. Recommends and implements changes in processes and procedures. Negotiates with stakeholders on the creation of specifications.


Required Qualifications

A minimum of three (3) years of relevant HCM system experience or equivalent combination of education/experience.
Self-motivated and works independently and as part of a team. Able to learn independently and meet deadlines.
Ability to exercise critical judgment in defining and developing system requirements and implementing polices and processes. Ability to promote and implement changes to current practices and processes.
Ability to provide high quality work utilizing highly developed and effective communication, project management, time management and collaboration skills.
Demonstrated ability to work with others from diverse backgrounds.
Ability to prioritize, streamline and accomplish assigned projects. Ability to maintain flexibility and quickly address changing priorities.
Demonstrates advanced problem solving and analytical skills. Ability to accomplish assigned projects without compromising the integrity of the UCPath Center and/or University of California policies and procedures. Ability to think strategically and focus on the accomplishment of the UCPath Center mission and priorities.
Thorough knowledge of business processes and procedures.
Demonstrated testing and test planning expertise.
Demonstrated effective communication and interpersonal skills. Demonstrated ability to communicate technical information to technical and non-technical personnel at various levels in the organization. Interpersonal and communications skills to work with both technical and non-technical personnel at various levels in the organization.
Ability to appropriately handle confidential matters and material.
Preferred Qualifications

Has a thorough knowledge of modules in PeopleSoft related to Workforce Administration, Compensation Administration, Absence Management and Position Management. Understanding of the system structure and modifications and how they impact operations and business objectives.
Knowledge of UC personnel and payroll policies and procedures.
Experience with configuration rules and tables updates. Understanding of the interdependencies between PeopleSoft modules.
Experience and proficiency in the PeopleSoft HCM 9.2.
In depth knowledge of PeopleSoft Human Resources/ Workforce Administration, Absence Management, Position Management, and Compensation Administration Modules.
Education

Bachelor's degree in human resources, business administration, computer science, or related field.

Job_title: Manager IS Analytics and Business Intelligence - FT - Days - IS Business Systems
Job_description:
El Camino Health is committed to hiring, retaining and growing the best and brightest professionals who will carry our mission and vision forward. We are proud of our reputation in the community: One built on compassion, innovation, collaboration and delivering high-quality care. Come join the team that makes this happen.
Applicants MUST apply for position(s) by submitting a separate application for each individual job posting number they are interested in being considered for.
FTE
1
Scheduled Bi-Weekly Hours
80
Work Shift
Day: 8 hours
Job Description
Lead the development of reporting, data warehousing, and analytics solutions for Epic, Workday, ServiceNow, and other application systems at El Camino Health. Oversee a team of report writers, analysts, and business intelligence engineers in the development of clinical, operational, and financial data solutions for the health system. Drive innovation in analytics for the organization through effective resource management. Implement strategies to support data governance, data visualization, security, and analytical solutions. Lead the use of modern data science, predictive modeling, machine learning (Python). Present decisions to leaders at all levels from clinicians to executives leading high visibility committees and projects. Most of the Manager’s time is spent on project management, analytics strategy, process development, and team management.
Duties may include: managing design services, providing configuration assistance, performing needs assessments, analyzing current business practices, as well as identifying future business opportunities for leveraging data storage and retrieval system capabilities. Manage relationships with software and hardware vendors to understand the potential impact of different vendor strategies. Ensure the development of proper training and documentation for enterprise-wide technical architecture, systems use, maintenance, planning, and integration of next-generation technologies into the analytics strategy. Selects, develops and evaluates personnel to ensure the efficient operation of the team.
Other duties as assigned.
Key Responsibilities
Management of a team of data analysts, report developers, and business intelligence engineers.
Lead strategies for data architecture, ETL development, extracts, and coordinate with outside vendors.
Project management of key organization initiatives around data use, analytics, extracts, regulatory reporting, and warehousing.
Oversee the development of dashboards, reports, security, and other related tools with a focus on Epic Cogito.
Develop analytics capabilities for the organization around predictive modeling, data warehousing, forecasting, and data science.
Share their understanding of the analytics ecosystem and enhance data literacy for the organization.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree with 4 years related work experience or Master’s degree in related field with 2 years related work experience. Degree in information technology, business or health care preferred.
Minimum of 2 years of experience directly managing a team of report developers, business intelligence engineers, and/or data scientists with responsibility for their performance and career development.
Ability to communicate effectively with employees from all levels within the organization, including senior management.
Project management, process leadership experience, ability to lead meetings, conflict resolution, and delegation.
Knowledgeable, experienced and accountable for data warehouse, visualization tools and analytics platforms in a hospital setting.
Strong understanding of transactional, operational, and dimensional data models.
Demonstrates robust capabilities in the areas of dashboards and balanced scorecards supporting lines of business, strategic goals, and business operations.
Experience with Epic Cogito, SQL, and Tableau.
Proficiency in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
Experience with Visio, flow diagrams, Smartsheets, ServiceNow, and SharePoint is preferred. Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills.
Must be able to learn, understand, and apply new technologies.
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment is crucial.
Moderate to expert levels of knowledge around IT and healthcare sector concepts and trends.
License/Certification/Registration Requirements
Certification in one or more Epic modules preferred.
Salary Range:
76.61 - 114.91 USD Hourly
The Physical Requirements and Working Conditions of this job are available. El Camino Health will provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with a disability if that will allow them to perform the essential functions of a job unless doing so creates an undue hardship for the hospital, or causes a direct threat to these individuals or others in the workplace which cannot be eliminated by reasonable accommodation.
Sedentary Work - Duties performed mostly while sitting; walking and standing at times. Occasionally lift or carry up to 10 lbs. Uses hands and fingers. - (Physical Requirements-United States of America)

Intro:
As a Data Architect, you will use cutting-edge cloud and data technologies to help global brands and federal agencies solve challenging problems through innovative technology solutions. Work on exciting projects, future-proof your skills, and grow into your dream job alongside some of the industry's most talented, knowledgeable, and dedicated technologists.
What You'll Be Doing:
Work in a team with other smart AIS employees and use cutting-edge technologies to solve challenging enterprise problems.
Design data platform solutions using Azure data services such as Data Factory, Azure Event Hub, Azure Synapse Analytics, and Azure Databricks.
Design scalable data processing and analytics solutions, including Big data storage for various data types and large-scale data processing using Databricks.
Apply your skills in Azure Cognitive Services, Azure P,aaS, and Machine Learning services.
Use experience working with Azure Data & Storage, Azure Analytics & Azure IoT tools, and the traditional Microsoft BI Stack.
Provide mentorship to more junior consultants.

This opportunity is client facing in the Lorton, VA area.

Proven experience developing Big Data solutions in the Azure space

Expert in both traditional and modern data architecture and processing concepts, including relational databases, Data warehousing, big data, NoSQL, and business analytics

Desire to obtain or utilize relevant technical certifications as part of continuous professional growth.
About AIS:
AIS, Dedicated to Our People

AIS employees can spend their entire career at AIS doing challenging, rewarding work and reach their desired level of achievement and responsibility. We offer the opportunity to move up, without the obligation to move out of a position where one excels. We are committed to our employee's success; however, they define it.

It's our dedication to our employees that inspired our leadership to invest in our future and become partially employee-owned through an Employee Stock Ownership Program (ESOP).

Our employees are our greatest strength, and we do all that we can to serve them. We invest in technology as early adopters, allowing us to create transformative and innovative solutions for our customers while exposing our team to cutting edge technology.

We hire outstanding individuals who are committed to curiosity, passionate about emerging technology, and who are excited to find innovative solutions for the biggest tech challenges facing international brands and government agencies today.

We Invest in Individuals Committed to Innovation

AIS is seeking professionals of a certain character and level of excellence. People that we can learn from and that we can help grow to achieve their personal career goals.

Smart people with a passion for technology
Strong technical capabilities with a consultancy mindset
Close involvement with local technical communities
A willingness to think outside of the box to provide innovative solutions to clients
Ability to solve challenging technical business problems
Self-directed professionals
Our Core Values
Client Success

Strong Client Relationships
Citizenship and Community

Job Description

The Data Management Specialist is responsible for working with a directorate office to effectively manage data and data sources. The Specialist will work extensively with the stakeholders to identify single sources of truth (authoritative data sources), establish relationships between other data sources, and integrate them into an organizational data model. The Data Management Specialist should recommend moving any ad-hoc sources of truth to a properly managed system (determined and recommended by the Specialist) that allows for easy data access and reporting. The Specialist should assist the directorate in creating an environment that efficiently supports structured, repeatable reporting, including the promotion of high standards for data quality, identifying data gaps as discovered.

The Data Management Specialist will collaborate with Government customers, data owners, data stewards, developers, data scientists and other data ingestion, data analytics and data services personnel to accomplish the overall goal of effective data management, analytics and reporting.

The Data Management Specialist will report to the Deputy Program Manager for Data Management and Automation. In addition to data management skills and experience, he or she must have excellent communication, coordination, and customer service skills, and work well within a team environment. Experience within the Missile Defense Agency is preferable.

Job_title: ETL Data Analyst - Third Party Indices Automation
Job_description:
Bloomberg runs on data, and as part of the Data team, we're responsible for acquiring it, providing it to our clients and helping derive significant insights out of it. We collect, analyze, process, and publish the data, which is the backbone of our iconic Bloomberg Terminal and our enterprise products - the facts and figures which ultimately move the financial markets. We apply problem-solving skills to identify innovative workflow efficiencies, and we implement technology solutions to improve our systems, products, and processes - and all this while providing platinum customer support to clients.


The Third Party Index Data team supports Bloomberg's suite of Indices to fulfill our clients' needs. We process over 15,000 files per day and as such need to have highly efficient data pipelines and quality processes to support the timely execution and publishing of that data for our clients.


What's the role?

The Third Party Automation Team is a dynamic group of individuals who tackle the more challenging technical aspects of our data product including data pipelining and sophisticated data analysis. Our Data Analysts possess a unique combination of technical skills and eye for business, as well as good communication and interpersonal skills. As such, we are looking for a highly motivated individual with a passion for data and the technology that surrounds it.


As a Data Analyst you will apply your problem-solving skills to handle the data pipelines, automation processes and human-in-the-loop workflows that feed our Third Party Indices Data Products. In addition to the data pipelining work, you will analyze our data from an operational as well as product standpoint. This might be by building the associated ETLs and Data Visualizations to report on our most important Operational Metrics or by building prototype applications in BQNT with our product teams. You will be expected to lead projects, collaborate with Engineering and Product and mentor junior members of the group who are looking to develop technically.


We'll trust you to:
Develop and support the data pipelines and processes that feed our Bloomberg Index Database
Find opportunities and build automated solutions for data standardization, ETL pipelines, and human-in-the-loop data processing
Design, develop, and deploy data quality validations written in Python to drive quality improvements and standards across the team, improving areas such as accuracy, completeness, consistency, reliability and more
Draw on your knowledge of scripting and programming to scale and standardize pipelining across our team and the department, always identifying improvements to current workflows
Use statistics and data visualization to report on results of ongoing operations and projects, as required
Leverage data analysis skills to find opportunities to optimize our operations or create prototypes to advance the third-party index data product
Partner with a wide variety of collaborators including Engineering, Product and Sales on product development and execution
You'll need to have: (from other DA2 role)
A BA/BS degree or higher in Computer Science, Mathematics, or relevant data technology field, or equivalent professional work experience
2+ years of Python programming and scripting in a production environment
2+ years of experience working with databases either SQL or NoSQL
Understanding of large-scale, distributed systems
Strong aptitude for problem solving, particularly to modify and enhance processes and workflows
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, especially when explaining technical processes and solutions to business stakeholders and management
High attention to detail and degree of demonstrated decision-making and problem-solving skills
Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment
Ability to influence others and lead change
Experience training and mentoring others
Legal authorization to work full-time in the United States and not require visa sponsorship now or in the future
We'd love to see:
Financial Market experience including an understanding of how benchmarks are used by our clients
Agile/Scrum Project Management experience
Experience using data analysis and visualization tools such as Tableau or QlikSense
Does this sound like you?

Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are.

company: Response: Support for Survivors of Domestic and Sexual Abuse
Job_description:
Office and Data Manager Job Description

Job Summary: Response is a non-profit in Aspen that works with survivors of domestic and sexual abuse. The office and data manager is responsible for managing the Response office and data collection and reporting as well as supporting the fundraising and outreach functions of the organization. (part time considered for the right applicant).

Responsibilities:

1. General Office:

Performs the full range of administrative duties for the office, including office management, maintaining office supplies and equipment. Answers incoming calls; assists visitors; handles mail.
Maintains agency files, ensures payment requests are submitted to the executive director, processes reports and renewals.
Works with vendors and other agencies to ensure the highest level of service.
Paying bills and processing payments.
Support other staff as needed.

2. Crisis Helpline:

Communicating with volunteer advocates with updates and scheduling to ensure that crisis helpline is adequately staffed.
Maintains volunteer and back up staff records and individual hours.
After completing the 30-hour volunteer advocate training, may be asked to work up to one week per month on the crisis line for evenings and a full weekend (additional compensation).

3. Fundraising and Outreach

Maintains Response website and social media outlets with accurate and timely postings.
Maintains donor database for fundraising and outreach efforts.
Provide logistical support for all Response events including volunteer management, soliciting donations, working with sponsors, marketing and more.
Works with executive director to create email and print newsletters on a regular basis.

4. Grant and Data Management

Coordination of Response’s annual grant calendar.
Assist executive director with grant reporting and tracking.
Coordination of program evaluation systems.
May include grant writing and proofing under the supervision of the executive director.
Maintains organizational databases and is responsible for overall records management.

Qualifications:

At least three years of work in an office setting.
Strong computer skills: Microsoft office, including Excel and Word and database experience.
A professional office manner and careful attention to detail.
The ability to maintain confidentiality and a calm manner when dealing with people in crisis.
A strong team player who is flexible with time and duties as they evolve.
Passionate about Response’s mission, culturally sensitive and trauma informed.

Bloomberg runs on data, and Data is responsible for acquiring it, contributing value and providing that value to our clients. We collect, analyze, process and publish the data which is the backbone of our iconic Bloomberg Terminal.

The Debt Capital Markets Automation (DCMA) team builds solutions that introduce efficiencies in data workflows, ensure optimum data quality and add new value for our clients.

What's the role?
The DCMA Team is a dynamic group of individuals who love to tackle challenging problems with technical solutions. Our focus is to use our technical skills to introduce efficiencies in workflow processes, improve data quality, ensure timely execution of published data and add new value for our clients.

As a Data Analyst, you will apply your problem-solving skills to develop and manage the data pipelines, and use your data analysis skills to find opportunities that require us to build automation processes and human-in-the-loop workflows within Debt Capital Markets. The work involved would vary from using our Bloomberg Data Technology Stack to write and productionize data pipelines using python, develop regression, classification and data-point extraction techniques using machine-learning methodologies, generating reports with data visualizations highlighting KPIs, and building prototypes using BQNT with our product teams.

As an experienced data analyst, you will be expected to drive projects, lead conversations, collaborate with Engineering and Product and mentor junior members of the group who are looking to develop technically. We are looking for highly motivated and driven individuals with a passion for data and the technology that surrounds it.

We'll trust you to:
Use your engineering skills and data science knowledge to develop and support the data pipelines and processes that we build for our clients and firm-wide partners
Use your data analysis skills to find opportunities to build automated solutions for data standardization, ETL pipelines, and human-in-the-loop data processing
Design, develop, and deploy data quality validations to drive quality improvements
Use your statistical knowledge and data visualization to report on results of ongoing operations and projects, as required
Partner with a wide variety of collaborators, including Engineering, Product and Sales, to drive and lead product development and execution
Stay on top of the latest developments in your field and suggest improvements to supported workflows
You'll need to have:
Bachelor's/Master's degree in STEM-related field or equivalent professional working experience
Preferable experience in Data Science/ML, Computational Finance, Statistical modeling
Python programming experience addressing business problems and working on big data sets
Proficiency with python, git, UNIX, software engineering principals, SDLC, MDLC
Proven track record of using technology to innovate data products and processes
Strong passion for data, technology and finance with the aspiration to work in the financial/FinTech services industry
Problem-solving mentality and attention to detail
Legal authorization to work full-time in the United States and not require visa sponsorship now or in the future

We'd love to see:

Financial Market experience, including an understanding of how benchmarks are used by our clients
Experience using Data Tech Stack components
Experience using data analysis and visualization tools to complement our research and approach

Does this sound like you?
Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are.

This position is responsible for the development, implementation and management of systems used to collect research data for the Paul G. Allen School for Global Health (SGH) at Washington State University. This position interacts with a broad range of researchers to gather requirements for data collection and storage, and then designs, implements, and maintains these systems. Working as an intermediary between the School for Global Health and the College of Veterinary Medicine's Veterinary Information Systems unit, this position will also assist in the preparation of data sets for analysis and will act as the primary support contact for a REDCap instance supporting both domestic and international research programs, as well as other data collection systems. Infrequent international travel to assist international research programs may be necessary in this position.

Job_title: Americas Credit, Fixed Income Corporate Actions Data Specialist
Job_description:
Bloomberg runs on data. In Data, we are responsible for onboarding, analyzing, and supplying data to answer our clients' most pressing questions. Our product is responsible for corporate action events affecting corporate bonds and preferred shares.
Whether you are sourcing relevant market data from new or existing providers, processing complex financial data or implementing technology solutions to enhance our processes and software, your work will ensure that we deliver accurate market data to the financial world first!

What you can expect from this opportunity:
You are the type of person that looks beyond the headline. You live for the detail and understand the importance of the underlying data that drives news and analysis. You enjoy the challenge of solving complex problems. You are just the sort of person we are looking for to join Data.

Bloomberg Data is looking for a highly motivated and driven individual to develop and expand the scope of Bloomberg's Fixed Income Corporate Actions Product. You will be part of a fast-paced environment and will be responsible for secondary market transactions happening on North American corporate bonds and preferred shares. Analysts within the team are in constant communication with liability management desks and other market participants who are involved with voluntary and mandatory distribution, redemption, and reorganization events. You will play a key role in producing financial content, calculations, research notes and analyses for our clients using the Bloomberg Terminal. Demonstrating a commitment to learning and a passion for the Fixed Income industry is required.

We'll trust you to:
Build positive and accountable relationships with clients, colleagues, and partners of the Fixed Income Corporate Actions product (including buy- and sell-side firms)
Acquire an understanding of the workflows designed to deliver class-leading quality while meeting or exceeding the timeliness demands of the market
Collaborate with colleagues to implement solutions and frameworks to enhance our processes, software, and data offerings
Maintain the existing proprietary database
Improve the relationships of our Terminal users to provide subject matter expertise by quickly and accurately answering client inquiries
Integrate your natural interests and strengths with the Fixed Income product to add value beyond data acquisition and remediation. Explore new strengths and opportunities by upskilling.
Support product development
You'll need you to have:
Relevant experience in a role within the financial markets, data analysis, information technology, credit document analysis, or research
2+ years of work experience is highly preferred
Proven ability to build and maintain client relationships
Effective research and analysis skills with attention to detail
Excellent communication, customer service, and teamwork skills
An interest in technology (Python, SQL, etc) and data analysis
Ability to spot market trends and act on them to enhance depth and breadth of coverage
Legal authorization to work in the US without visa sponsorship now or in the future
Does this sound like you?
Apply if you think we're a good match! We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are.

Job_title: Product Manager - Data Management Lab, Bloomberg Data Dictionary
Job_description:
Bloomberg's Data Management Lab enables internal and external users to efficiently leverage an elite data set to perform analysis, uncover vital insights. and make financial decisions. To this end, the Data Management Lab empowers our Data professionals to understand their domains end-to-end, make their products "ready-to-use", and improve the way users interact with our data. We focus on five areas of data management: discoverability, accessibility, appraisability, interoperability and consistency.

In this role you will be working with the Bloomberg Data Dictionary (BDD) team. We are in the midst of taking our metadata models and data management products to the next level. The goal is to promote the use of our data models by both external clients and internal applications. This person will have a high level of business, communication, and technology skills, so that they can build working prototypes as well as work optimally with internal stakeholders and clients.

The Role:

We are enhancing existing metamodels and metadata management systems. This includes building new tools and systems to manage, govern, link and discover metadata. It also involves developing and improving new functions and services to distribute metadata.

In this exciting role, we expect you to deliver a product vision and implement that vision in collaboration with Engineering, Product, and Data. You will be a key person in developing technical products that provide best-in-class customer experience. You will understand the requirements of both internal users, and external clients, and then shape the product offering to meet their needs. You would be familiar with specifying requirements including writing JIRA stories. You would have deep technical experience around using structured data models and data sets to solve complex business demands.

What's in it for you:
An influential business role within a fast-growing area of Bloomberg's Data business.
Broad scope to craft and specify meta-model for the company.
We'll trust you to:
Take responsibility for Bloomberg Data Dictionary's technology products.
Develop a product roadmap by evaluating what is possible and viable
Communicate the roadmap across the organization, and work with engineering to execute the roadmap
Develop functional and technical requirements by leading conversations among internal partners (Engineering, Product, Data, Sales), and clients
You'll need to have:
Bachelor's (or Master's) degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related technical discipline
4+ years of relevant work experience
Experience in developing and implementing technology systems
Understanding of data modelling (either ER, RDF, or other similar techniques)
Understanding of financials markets and how Bloomberg's clients use our data
The ability to address multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment
We'd love to see:
Knowledge of metadata systems and models
Knowledge of linked data and knowledge graphs
Knowledge of Market Data and Reference Data
Does this sound like you?

Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are.

We do not discriminate on the basis of age, ancestry, color, gender identity or expression, genetic predisposition or carrier status, marital status, national or ethnic origin, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, sexual and other reproductive health decisions, parental or caring status, physical or mental disability, pregnancy or maternity/parental leave, protected veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, or any other classification protected by applicable law. Job_title: Global Risk Data & Business Intelligence Manager
Job_description:
WHAT YOU'LL DO

Global Risk Management (RM) is dedicated to identifying and managing significant risk exposure at BCG.

The Data & Business Intelligence Manager position involves designing, managing, and deploying data analytics, reports, and dynamic dashboards. The tools and dashboard created will be utilized by both the Assurance and Advisory team and key functional stakeholders. This position is responsible for extracting data from multiple sources, processing and validating data, and conducting root cause and trend analysis. The Data & Business Intelligence Manager will also present analytic findings to various stakeholders.


In addition, this role will participate in risk assessment for BCG Offices, functions and processes and looks to provide management with an independent and objective assessment of business risk and internal controls.

The successful candidate should be comfortable performing the following: writing queries in programing languages such as SQL and Python, developing analytical visualizations using Alteryx and Tableau (e.g. building complex dashboards), understanding cloud data warehousing (e.g. Snowflake), business intelligence architecture, application and design, Machine Learning & AI concepts. The candidate must also understand and assess risks across a wide variety of business areas, build relationships with diverse stakeholders, manage a complex network of individuals, influence change management across the organization, prioritize issues, and escalate appropriately.

YOU'RE GOOD AT
We are looking for someone with a passion and understanding of data analytics and business intelligence, risk management, change management, and global business. The role will entail the following:

Data & Business Analytics (60%)
Assist the team with developing short-, medium- and long-term data analytics strategy
Review, update, and investigate pertinent data from various data sources to ensure a high level of quality, accuracy, and timeliness
Query multiple data sources using programing languages such as SQL and Python
Produce visualization and developing dashboards using Tableau/Alteryx
Analyze data and provide insights and recommendations for organizational planning and operations.
Create business analytics by synthesizing information from multiple sources of data for business decisions and strategic planning.
Demonstrate continuous effort to improve operations, streamline work processes, and work cooperatively and jointly to provide quality deliverables
Provide training and education to the team on data and analytics related topics

Office Risk Review Program (20%)
Meet with Office Leadership and the Global Functions to lead the planning, execution, and post-review efforts for a portfolio of Office risk reviews and BCG’s extension businesses.
Travel to any BCG’s Office throughout the world and work with the team to develop and maintain the risk review work program
Assist the team with the execution of risk reviews to assess the risk and controls environment in the offices and test the effectiveness of controls
Perform substantive tests of transactions
Prepare timely and comprehensive documentation of findings and recommendations, including local management comments
Maintain risk profiles for each office and prioritizing offices for a visit
Act as a risk liaison with the local office, providing support and education on important risk issues
Global Process Review Program (20%)
Lead targeted functional/operating risk reviews, which are focused on global or regional processes.
Responsibilities will include defining the project scope and strategy, conducting process walk-throughs, performing detailed testing, drafting detailed reporting/action plans, and following up on implementation efforts.
Focus on the scope and objectives of each review to ensure the highest risk areas are addressed and the key findings are communicated
Evaluate, in detail, the use of new digital technologies and the risks these solutions may pose to the global functions as BCG’s business operations continue to evolve and modernize.
Develop relationships with key functional leaders.
Work with Global Risk Management Senior Director to develop an annual plan of global functional risk reviews; align staffing and coordinate scheduling with key stakeholders.
Monitor trends and emerging issues for reporting to leadership (i.e., Audit and Risk Committee).
Act as a risk liaison with the global functions, providing support and education on important risk issues.
YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)
An academic degree in a relevant discipline: Data Science, Business Analytics, Mathematics or Computer Science
5+ years successful experience related to Data Warehouse and Data Analytics, preferably in professional services, or the consulting industry.
Understanding of enterprise data warehouses (Snowflake), business intelligence architecture, application and design, ML & AI concepts
Deep knowledge of current analytics technologies and software applications such as SQL/Python query language, Alteryx, Tableau and Microsoft tools
Strong analytical skills with detail orientation; strong communication skills – written and verbal
Ability to work cross-functionally in a global environment
Ability to travel to all BCG office locations Worldwide
Travel is required approximately 15% of the time, with the need to be flexible if additional travel is required. Travel is typically one week in length (may include weekends) but must be adaptable for risk reviews of up to 2+ weeks if required. Travel is generally planned well in advance but must be flexible to travel on limited notice.
Travel will align with BCG’s Covid-19 protocols and applicable laws and regulations.
YOU'LL WORK WITH
Local/system/regional operational leaders, global functional leaders, and BCG leadership. BCG's Chief Risk Officer leads the team, which is comprised of team members across various cities and countries. This role will report to the Global Risk Management Director
ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
Candidates should be aware that BCG currently maintains a policy requiring all US & Canada based employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Newly hired employees must be fully vaccinated prior to their employment start date. BCG is an equal opportunity employer and will provide a reasonable accommodation to those unable to be vaccinated for medical or religious reasons where it is not an undue hardship to the company to do so as provided under applicable federal, state, provincial and local law.

Full Time, Flexible weekday schedule. 36 hours/week.

Pay Range is between $23.21-$34.80/hr, depending on years of relevant and like experience.

Boulder Community Health is a Certified Level II Trauma Center. In 2022, we celebrated the 100thanniversary of the founding of our organization. We are honored to hold the awards of 2021 U.S. News & World ‘Best Hospitals for Maternity Care’, 2019 Best Medical Facility from Boulder Weekly, and Best Local Employer from Daily Camera. Come be part of an independent, community-focused health system; feel good knowing that your work will make a difference in people’s lives and positively contribute to the community.

POSITION SUMMARY

Coordinates the cancer data management system to promote quality care for the cancer patients at Boulder Community Health. Maintains compliance with the requirements for an approved cancer program and national accreditation program for breast centers set forth by the American College of Surgeons Commission on Cancer. Maintains compliance with the requirements for mandatory statewide reporting set forth by the Colorado Cancer Registry and Department of Public health.

JOB QUALIFICATIONS

Education or Formal Training

Accredited Record Technician (RHIT) or Registered Record Administrator (RHIA) preferred. Certified Tumor Registrar (CTR) required. ICD-9 Coding, cancer staging and word-processing. Expertise required with Excel spreadsheets and CNExT (or similar automated cancer registry system) ACOS web-based data upload process including but not limited to the National Call for Data (NCDB) and the Facility Identifiable data (FIPS level 1 & 2). State of Colorado Public Health and Environment compliance with state and federal laws mandating data collection and compliance in the research of those diagnosed with and treated for cancer. The Cancer Registry is responsible for guarding the hospitals compliance and fostering a cohesive relationship with the State liaisons and personnel and providing documentation to them upon request, to evidence the hospitals compliance with the state and federal statutes.

Special Qualifications (Licensure, Registration, etc.)

Bachelor or Associate Degree in health information technology are related field preferred. Certified Tumor Registrar (CTR) required.

Knowledge, Skill and Ability

Knowledge of all American College of Surgeons and State of Colorado requirements for Cancer Registry accreditation process. Working knowledge of all levels of accreditation and evidence of experience with standards.
Evidence of ability to produce an annual report and comply with procedures for reporting to the state as required by American College of Surgeons.
Demonstrated ability for successful completion of ACOS accreditation survey.
Demonstrated excellent communication skills:
Writing ability including accurate grammar and spelling as evidenced by concise and clear report writing, compilation and organization of annual reports, preparation of tumor conference agendas, and synopses of data.
Verbal skills as evidenced by ability to communicate with all members of the health care team, the state tumor registry and patients when appropriate.
Demonstrated ability to execute a successful breast & cancer conference.
Demonstrated ability to accurately analyze and abstract patient records with an average time of 60 minutes or less per abstract.
Detail-oriented with ability to make independent decisions and use critical thinking skills.
Demonstrated ability to execute accomplishment of ACOS required registry data studies
Demonstrated ability to execute scientific studies leading to sound data to be presented to the Cancer Committee as a source of outcomes analysis.
Demonstrated ability to keep apprised of the ever-changing policies and procedures of the state of Colorado and the data reporting elements involved in this process.
Demonstrated ability to research and comply with changing federal agency regulations.
Demonstrated ability to stay up to date with regulatory and complementary agencies to adjust hospital abstracting when a specific precedent has been changed or set. The agencies include but are not limited to; coding schemes (CPT, ICD-0-3, ICD-9-CM), Surveillance Epidemiology & End Results (SEER), American Joint Commission on Cancer (AJCC).
Must have knowledge and ability to perform required aspects of the computer and its programs: follow-up letters, statistical reports, Colorado State Cancer Registry reporting and other required medical and cancer data.

Experience

At least five years of experience as a cancer data registrar in an ACOS accredited Cancer Program.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Assists in developing and maintaining cancer program standards by ACoS/COC and NAPBC.
Coordinates maintenance of appropriate files, reports and other cancer related data to ensure approval standards by the American College of Surgeons and the Colorado State Cancer Registry. Preparing graphs and statistics.
Prepares cancer reports and statistical data of the cancer program and breast center activities to administration, physician, outside agencies and/or Colorado State Cancer Registry.
Develops and implement changes in cancer registry policies and procedures to ensure CoC and NAPBC requirements
Monitors quality data (including periodic audits) to ensure data quality and compliance with state and CoC and NAPBC requirements.
Coordinates, plans, attends, documents, and promotes attendance at all Tumor Conferences.
Schedules a minimum of 4 Cancer Committee meetings a year on the medical staff calendar.
Drafts Cancer Committee agendas to represent each standard outlined by the ACOS. Allocate time on the agenda for each coordinator and specialty to give report, at the designated intervals required by the ACOS, if not more often.
Serves as a member of the Cancer Committee.
Coordinates Cancer Registry abstractors and oversight of all of their encompassing cancer registry activities.

About Boulder Community Health and Boulder, Colorado

Uncompromising medical excellence delivered with respect and compassion. Since 1922, Boulder Community Health has built a strong reputation on these values. As community-owned and operated not-for-profit hospital and clinic locations, we remain dedicated to the evolving needs of our citizens and providing access to high-quality care. Nestled in the foothills of the Rocky Mountains, the Boulder lifestyle is conductive to enjoying the outdoors and brings a fresh perspective to healthcare practice. Surround yourself by natural beauty and an active, life-embracing community. Enjoy state-of-the-art facilities and equipment along with competitive compensation and benefits, including health/dental/life, tuition reimbursement, on-site fitness center, Employee Wellness, Employee Activities & Discounts, and many more!


Location: Boulder Community Health · Oncology Services Admin
Schedule: Full-time, Days - 8 hour shifts, M - F, flexible schedule

Job_title: ETL Data Analyst - Third Party Indices Automation
Job_description:
Bloomberg runs on data, and as part of the Data team, we're responsible for acquiring it, providing it to our clients and helping derive significant insights out of it. We collect, analyze, process, and publish the data, which is the backbone of our iconic Bloomberg Terminal and our enterprise products - the facts and figures which ultimately move the financial markets. We apply problem-solving skills to identify innovative workflow efficiencies, and we implement technology solutions to improve our systems, products, and processes - and all this while providing platinum customer support to clients.


The Third Party Index Data team supports Bloomberg's suite of Indices to fulfill our clients' needs. We process over 15,000 files per day and as such need to have highly efficient data pipelines and quality processes to support the timely execution and publishing of that data for our clients.


What's the role?

The Third Party Automation Team is a dynamic group of individuals who tackle the more challenging technical aspects of our data product including data pipelining and sophisticated data analysis. Our Data Analysts possess a unique combination of technical skills and eye for business, as well as good communication and interpersonal skills. As such, we are looking for a highly motivated individual with a passion for data and the technology that surrounds it.


As a Data Analyst you will apply your problem-solving skills to handle the data pipelines, automation processes and human-in-the-loop workflows that feed our Third Party Indices Data Products. In addition to the data pipelining work, you will analyze our data from an operational as well as product standpoint. This might be by building the associated ETLs and Data Visualizations to report on our most important Operational Metrics or by building prototype applications in BQNT with our product teams. You will be expected to lead projects, collaborate with Engineering and Product and mentor junior members of the group who are looking to develop technically.


We'll trust you to:
Develop and support the data pipelines and processes that feed our Bloomberg Index Database
Find opportunities and build automated solutions for data standardization, ETL pipelines, and human-in-the-loop data processing
Design, develop, and deploy data quality validations written in Python to drive quality improvements and standards across the team, improving areas such as accuracy, completeness, consistency, reliability and more
Draw on your knowledge of scripting and programming to scale and standardize pipelining across our team and the department, always identifying improvements to current workflows
Use statistics and data visualization to report on results of ongoing operations and projects, as required
Leverage data analysis skills to find opportunities to optimize our operations or create prototypes to advance the third-party index data product
Partner with a wide variety of collaborators including Engineering, Product and Sales on product development and execution
You'll need to have: (from other DA2 role)
A BA/BS degree or higher in Computer Science, Mathematics, or relevant data technology field, or equivalent professional work experience
2+ years of Python programming and scripting in a production environment
2+ years of experience working with databases either SQL or NoSQL
Understanding of large-scale, distributed systems
Strong aptitude for problem solving, particularly to modify and enhance processes and workflows
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, especially when explaining technical processes and solutions to business stakeholders and management
High attention to detail and degree of demonstrated decision-making and problem-solving skills
Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment
Ability to influence others and lead change
Experience training and mentoring others
Legal authorization to work full-time in the United States and not require visa sponsorship now or in the future
We'd love to see:
Financial Market experience including an understanding of how benchmarks are used by our clients
Agile/Scrum Project Management experience
Experience using data analysis and visualization tools such as Tableau or QlikSense
Does this sound like you?

Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are.

07-Mar-2023

Job Summary
The Datacenter Automation Systems (DAS) team is committed to the successful implementation of autonomous and semi-autonomous vehicles throughout multiple datacenters. CBRE is seeking a full-time, permanent, CAD Operator with experience in MEP design, manufacturing or data center robotics-centric automation solutions. The DAS CAD Operator will report to the Client-approved location:
Moncks Corner, SC - full time / on site
The DAS CAD Operator requirements may vary according to Client-determined assignments, but most content relates to creating detailed designs for industrial automation equipment and systems in the DAS robotics portfolio at the Client's data centers. This position is part of a multi-disciplinary team creating engineering documentation and design drawing packages. The individual will collaborate with project engineers, technical writers, project managers, and other CAD/BIM Operators. Ideal candidates would be familiar with establishing and managing a design environment. Ideal candidates must be comfortable communicating regularly via video conference, email and internal ticketing systems.

Job Duties:
Acquire clear understanding of product requirements by reviewing, understanding, interpreting and revising technical specifications, blueprints and engineering illustrations, mockups, and prototypes.
Ability to read and interpret design standards and specifications, blueprints, drawings, redlines, etc
Coordinate the CAD design for Navigation Tape and GeoMarker installation package
Installation Drawings
Navigation DesignLayout
GeoMarker datum development
Material Takeoff
Working understanding of construction design package development for field installation.
Ability to translate existing field conditions from documentation and redlines to revise/edit design drawing packages.
Ability to learn software such as Lucidchart to generate shape files for navigation translated from design drawings. .
Capable of managing shifting design production to coordinate with field installation schedules.
Coordinate file management with 3rd party teams for document file transfer.
Maintain audits of latest design revisions against floor plan modifications.
Ability to perform repetitive field measurement tasks for long durations such as bending, kneeling, squatting ,walking, climbing stairs, etc.
Must have excellent organizational skills
Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing

Other duties as assigned.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position.

QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE

Bachelor's degree in Architecture, Engineering, Construction Management, or related field. Minimum two or more years' construction administration, architecture, engineering or similar experience.

Preferred experience with some data center infrastructure projects. Experience in mission critical data centers is a strong plus. Preferred experience with robotic process automation.

CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES

Working towards or eligible for licensure as either a Professional Engineer or Registered Architect is desired.

COMMUNICATION SKILLS

Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information.

FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE

Requires knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and/or commissions. Conducts basic financial analysis.

REASONING ABILITY

Ability to understand and carry out general instructions in standard situations. Ability to solve problems in standard situations. Requires intermediate analytical and quantitative skills.

OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES

Intermediate skills with Microsoft Office Suite. Ability to read and understand architectural drawings. Working knowledge in MS Project is helpful. Knowledge of leases, contracts, and construction practices preferred. 3+ years of minimum proficiency in the use of AutoCAD and Revit. Knowledge of Best Management Practices CAD/BIM environment. Autodesk Software - CAD BIM Solidworks BIM360 etc.

Basic knowledge of the entitlement/permitting process and construction delivery methods and agreements. Some familiarity with construction best practices, general building codes, and various building types and systems. Passion for being detail oriented and highly organized.

SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY

Decisions made with general understanding of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to co-workers and supervisor.

We are proud of our reputation in the community: One built on compassion, innovation, collaboration and delivering high-quality care. Come join the team that makes this happen.

Lead the development of reporting, data warehousing, and analytics solutions for Epic, Workday, ServiceNow, and other application systems at El Camino Health. Oversee a team of report writers, analysts, and business intelligence engineers in the development of clinical, operational, and financial data solutions for the health system. Drive innovation in analytics for the organization through effective resource management. Implement strategies to support data governance, data visualization, security, and analytical solutions. Lead the use of modern data science, predictive modeling, machine learning (Python). Present decisions to leaders at all levels from clinicians to executives leading high visibility committees and projects. Most of the Manager’s time is spent on project management, analytics strategy, process development, and team management.

Manage relationships with software and hardware vendors to understand the potential impact of different vendor strategies. Ensure the development of proper training and documentation for enterprise-wide technical architecture, systems use, maintenance, planning, and integration of next-generation technologies into the analytics strategy. Lead strategies for data architecture, ETL development, extracts, and coordinate with outside vendors.
Project management of key organization initiatives around data use, analytics, extracts, regulatory reporting, and warehousing.

Develop analytics capabilities for the organization around predictive modeling, data warehousing, forecasting, and data science.
Share their understanding of the analytics ecosystem and enhance data literacy for the organization.

Ability to communicate effectively with employees from all levels within the organization, including senior management.
Project management, process leadership experience, ability to lead meetings, conflict resolution, and delegation.
Knowledgeable, experienced and accountable for data warehouse, visualization tools and analytics platforms in a hospital setting.
Strong understanding of transactional, operational, and dimensional data models.

Proficiency in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).

Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills.

Job_title: Cloud Data Engineer I - AWS, Python, Snowflake, SQL
Job_description:
Who Are We?

Taking care of our customers, our communities and each other. That’s the Travelers Promise. By honoring this commitment, we have maintained our reputation as one of the best property casualty insurers in the industry for over 160 years. Join us to discover a culture that is rooted in innovation and thrives on collaboration. Imagine loving what you do and where you do it.

Compensation Overview

The annual base salary range provided for this position is a nationwide market range and represents a broad range of salaries for this role across the country. The actual salary for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment. As part of our comprehensive compensation and benefits program, employees are also eligible for performance-based cash incentive awards.

Salary Range

$102,600.00 - $169,200.00

Target Openings

1

What Is the Opportunity?

Travelers Data Engineering team constructs pipelines that contextualize and provide easy access to data by the entire enterprise. As a Data Engineer, you will play a key role in growing and transforming our analytics landscape. In addition to your strong analytical mind, you will bring your inquisitive attitude and ability to translate the stories found in data. You will leverage your ability to design, build and deploy data solutions that capture, explore, transform, and utilize data to support Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and business intelligence/insights.

What Will You Do?

Build and operationalize complex data solutions, correct problems, apply transformations, and recommend data cleansing/quality solutions.
Design data solutions.
Analyze sources to determine value and recommend data to include in analytical processes.
Incorporate core data management competencies including data governance, data security and data quality.
Collaborate within and across teams to support delivery and educate end users on data products/analytic environment.
Perform data and system analysis, assessment and resolution for defects and incidents of moderate complexity and correct as appropriate.
Test data movement, transformation code, and data components.
Perform other duties as assigned.

What Will Our Ideal Candidate Have?

Bachelor’s Degree in STEM related field or equivalent
Six years of related experience
Proficient use of tools (Snowflake, Databricks), techniques, and manipulation including Cloud platforms (AWS), programming languages (Python and/or Java), and an understanding of software engineering practices.
The ability to deliver work at a steady, predictable pace to achieve commitments, decompose work assignments into small batch releases, and contribute to tradeoff and negotiation discussions.
Demonstrated track record of domain expertise including the ability to understand technical concepts and possess in-depth knowledge of immediate systems worked on.
Proven problem solving skills including debugging skills, allowing you to determine source of issues in unfamiliar code or systems and the ability to recognize and solve repetitive problems.
Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to interact with team members and business partners.
Leadership - Intermediate leadership skills with a proven track record of self-motivation in identifying personal growth opportunities.

What is a Must Have?

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent training with data tools, techniques, and manipulation.
Four years of data engineering or equivalent experience.

What Is in It for You?

Health Insurance: Employees and their eligible family members – including spouses, domestic partners, and children – are eligible for coverage from the first day of employment.
Retirement: Travelers matches your 401(k) contributions dollar-for-dollar up to your first 5% of eligible pay, subject to an annual maximum. If you have student loan debt, you can enroll in the Paying it Forward Savings Program. When you make a payment toward your student loan, Travelers will make an annual contribution into your 401(k) account. You are also eligible for a Pension Plan that is 100% funded by Travelers.
Paid Time Off: Start your career at Travelers with a minimum of 20 days Paid Time Off annually, plus nine paid company Holidays.
Wellness Program: The Travelers wellness program is comprised of tools and resources that empower you to achieve your wellness goals. In addition, our Life Balance program provides access to professional counseling services, life coaching and other resources to support your daily life needs. Through Life Balance, you’re eligible for five free counseling sessions with a licensed therapist.
Volunteer Encouragement: We have a deep commitment to the communities we serve and encourage our employees to get involved. Travelers has a Matching Gift and Volunteer Rewards program that enables you to give back to the charity of your choice.

Employment Practices

Travelers is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that we can deliver the very best products and services when our workforce reflects the diverse customers and communities we serve. We are committed to recruiting, retaining and developing the diverse talent of all of our employees and fostering an inclusive workplace, where we celebrate differences, promote belonging, and work together to deliver extraordinary results.



If you are a candidate and have specific questions regarding the physical requirements of this role, please send us an email so we may assist you.


Travelers reserves the right to fill this position at a level above or below the level included in this posting.

To learn more about our comprehensive benefit programs please visit http://careers.travelers.com/life-at-travelers/benefits/.

Summary

The Data Analytics Specialist, under the general direction of the Director of Information Technology, and in accordance with good business practices and established procedures, will gather, manage, analyze, and report data from internal Organ Procurement Organization (OPO) systems and external industry systems. Analyze data to establish baseline performance metrics. Produce internal and external reports and assist with publication initiatives. Make recommendations for process improvement initiatives. Provide continuous monitoring of local donation activity data and regular reports to leadership. Promote efficiency throughout the organization utilizing creative and innovative thinking to develop, analyze and verify statistical measures.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

Responsible for the integrity and quality of data within the Information Technology (IT) infrastructure to support operations, management and decision-making. Actively participate in cross departmental initiatives ensuring data is efficiently organized, managed and distributed. Enable strategic use of enterprise-wide information for cross-functional organizations and teams.
Provide data related services throughout the organization. Consult with leadership and workforce on process measures, evaluation techniques, as well as, current and potential IT related solutions.
Verify organ and tissue donor statistics in the electronic medical record system while using analytical tools.
Assist with process improvement where data or IT infrastructure is integral to the improvement. Monitors and participate in the compilation of OPO quality measures.
Ensure data collection processes are consistent, repeatable, and appropriate throughout the organization.
Assist with internal and external reporting requests and requirements.
Validates and analyzes various data, metrics, and information via business intelligence (BI), statistical and quality tools.
Analyze all organ and tissue recovery data and produces reports regarding activity, outcome, and recommended improvement areas.
Assist with the tracking of organizational metrics to support the success of the organization’s strategic efforts.
Facilitates team-based problem solving and multidisciplinary team use of various data-driven process improvement techniques such as Process Mapping and Root Cause Analysis. Applies business logic and ask questions that are not necessarily apparent.
Supports organizational survey processes with analysis, tracking and developing of survey data for both internal and external partners.
Develop and maintain specialized datasets and systems for recording and tracking appropriate data and statistical information.
Creates and distributes standardized and special reports, summaries, and analyses.
Organizes appropriate resources, organizational priorities and manages systems as related to data activities.
Maintains monthly scorecards and dashboards for the organization to ensure compliance with performance measures.
Integrates features and tools of Office 365 into the IT infrastructure.
Maintains a continuous and independent education on cutting-edge statistical techniques and tools.
Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications, Education & Experience


Bachelor’s Degree (preferred);
