POSITION DESCRIPTION

Government Grant Data Analyst/Database Administrator, works under the general supervision of the Director of Grants. This role is responsible for creation of reports, dashboards, and other visualizations on data associated with grant awards and projects and business processes to provide insights in support of decision-making efforts. The Grant Data Analyst works as a liaison with departments and Elected Officials to coordinate data capture of all direct and subrecipient data and required reporting. The Analyst also coordinates the capture, transfer, sharing, integration and implementation of data systems, add-ons, plug-ins and bridges. This role is responsible for coordination of database and repository centralizing all federal awards.

ROLES AND RESPONSIBLITIES

Analyzing data using statistical techniques and providing reports. Developing and implementing databases and data collection systems. Acquiring data from primary and secondary sources and maintain data systems Identifying, analyzing, and interpreting trends or patterns in complex data sets Filtering and cleaning data Maintain record of all grant operating department business processes and controls Suggest and implement approved tracking mechanisms to assist in convergence of data from current spreadsheets to database and upcoming ERP system. Locating and defining new process improvement opportunities Evaluates financial reports and performance reports makes escalate concerns to management regarding trends and potential negative impacts. Assist in the evaluation of the effectiveness of grants, compliance with federal regulations, federal agencies, and specific grant contract provisions. Monitors funded projects to prevent over-expenditure of funds; audit disallowance and ensure awards are fully expended. Evaluates grant expenditure agreements to differentiate between sub-recipients or contractors. Analyzes internal and external financial reports, including single audits. Assist in the set-up of electronic database and repository. Maintains electronic database and repository for efficient data collection and report production. Monitors and report the spending of awards, budget adjustments, contract amendments, grant match and cost allocation plans. Assists in the reduction and elimination of findings and questions regarding costs. Performs special project analysis as requested. Reconciles reported revenues and expenditures to the general ledger for grant and prepares the necessary journal entries for correction and posting. Communicates reminders to departments receiving monies of report submission deadlines and when the grant period will expire and/or when an extension maybe needed. Coordinate with external auditors for financial or audit support requests. Other duties as assigned by the Division Director of Grants and Contracts.

JOB SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS

Economics and Accounting Knowledge of economic and governmental accounting principles and practices, the financial markets, banking and the analysis and reporting of financial data.
Administration and Management Knowledge of business and management principles involved in strategic planning, resource allocation, human resources modeling, leadership technique, production methods, and coordination of people and resources.
Mathematics Knowledge of arithmetic and their applications. Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst, Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques, Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks), Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc), Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy, Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
Customer and Personal Service Knowledge of principles and processes for providing customer and personal services. This includes customer needs assessment, meeting quality standards for services, and evaluation of customer satisfaction.
English Language Knowledge of the structure and content of the English language including the meaning and spelling of words, rules of composition, and grammar. Law and Government Knowledge of laws, legal codes, court procedures, precedents, government regulations, executive orders, agency rules, and the democratic political process.
Grant Lifecycle Knowledge of the linear lifecycle that includes discovering, creating and programing the funding opportunity, applying, making award decisions, and successfully implementing the award.

Education

Bachelor’s degree in Information Management, Statistics, Business, Accounting, Computer Science, or related field and/or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
(5-6) years of professional accounting experience, governmental preferred, with a minimum of (4) years of grant administration, data analytics and auditing of state funded grant programs, within a governmental entity.
SQL Microsoft Suite including SQL Server and BI, Python, SAS, Oracle

DIVISION OF COURT SERVICES

Charleston, West Virginia

•

West Virginia Courts

West Virginia has a Unified Court System,under which all state courts, including the Intermediate Court of Appeals, Circuit Courts, Magistrate Courts, and Family Courts, are supervised and administered by the Supreme Court of Appeals. The Supreme Court of Appeals and its Administrative Office are located in Charleston and housed in the State Capitol Complex. More information about West Virginia’s Courts can be found on our website at www.courtswv.gov.

Equal Opportunity in Employment

It is the policy of the West Virginia judiciary to provide equal opportunity in employment for all persons, and to recruit, select, train, promote, retain, and discipline without regard to race, color, sex, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, or national origin. Further, it is the policy of the West Virginia judiciary to maintain a professional workplace in which individuals are accorded respect, and an environment free of harassment, including verbal or physical conduct that creates an intimidating or hostile environment for any individual on any prohibited basis. As an employer with an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Plan, the Court complies with government regulations and related Equal Employment Responsibilities where applicable.

Application Process

To apply for this position, please send the following completed Court Employment Application (available on Court website at www.courtswv.gov), along with a letter of interest highlighting applicable experience, and a resume, including references.

All positions of the Supreme Court of Appeals of West Virginia are considered at-will and may

be terminated at any time, with or without notice or cause.

Thank you for your interest in employment with the Supreme Court of Appeals of West Virginia.

Position Summary/Position

Under the direction of the Data Science Systems Manager, the Data Scientist II is responsible for modeling complex institutional problems, discovering insights and identifying opportunities using statistical, algorithmic, mining and visualization techniques. In addition to advanced analytic skills, this role is also proficient at integrating and preparing large, varied datasets, architecting specialized database, and computing environments, and communicating results.
Collaborating closely with Data Science Developers, this role will partner with our business stakeholders to identify ways to augment and enhance our data in order provide insight beyond what can be gleaned from the data we have today.

Major Functions (Duties and Responsibilities)

1. Lead and drive cross functional data science projects from beginning to end: build relationships with partner teams, frame and structure questions, collect and analyze data.
2. Apply descriptive and predictive analytics to help drive insights and business decisions.
3. Apply a diverse set of tactics such as statistics, quantitative reasoning, and machine learning to research and produce insights.
4. Work with data engineering and data solutions teams to ensure proper data tracking is set up for features and support debugging and development of new ETL processes.
5. Build deep-dive analyses and eventually machine learning models to better forecast risk across the portfolio for our contracts and claims activity.
6. Support business operations, finance, quality systems, and other internal teams by building analytics and reporting to understand overall business performance and increase organizational efficiencies
7. Manage tests for specific provider and generate data to build out case studies and messaging strategies.
8. Designs experiments, test hypotheses, and build models.
9. Conducts data analysis and moderately complex algorithm.
10. Works with Institute stakeholders to identify the business requirements and the expected outcome.
11. Works with and alongside business analysts by suggesting other products of interest to the client.
12. Models and frames business scenarios that are meaningful and which impact on critical business processes and/or decisions.
13. Collaborates with Institute subject matter experts to select the relevant sources of information.
14. Recommends ongoing improvements to methods and algorithms that lead to findings, including new information.
15. Provides on-going tracking and monitoring of performance of decision systems and statistical models.
16. Communicate analysis and decisions to high-level stakeholders and executives in verbal, visual, and written formats.
17. Collaborate with business leaders, subject matter experts, and decision makers to develop success criteria and optimize new solutions, features, policies, and models.
18. Demonstrate a commitment to support IEHP’s strategic priorities to become a 5-Star Health Plan and incorporate LEAN principles into daily work.

Major Functions (Duties and Responsibilities) Cont

Supervisory Responsibilities

Leading: Self

Experience Qualifications

Four or more (4+) years of experience in analytics, data science, and business intelligence. Experience in developing algorithms, predictive analytics, or statistical models. Experience in analyzing large data sets that have complex designs that are unstructured, structured, and semi-structured. Proven ability to facilitate cross-functional projects that depend on the contributions of others in a variety of disciplines. Fluency with data warehouse design practices, analytics, and visualization technologies. Experience in the use of statistical packages.

Preferred Experience

Experience in the areas of medical or health services is preferred.

Education Qualifications

Master Degree in Mathematics, Statistics or Computer Science, or related field from an accredited institution is required.

Preferred Education

Doctorate degree from an accredited institution preferred.

Professional Certification

Professional Licenses

Drivers License Required

No

Knowledge Requirement

Strong understanding of Machine Learning theory with significant applied experience. Strong scientific Python skills using pandas, scikit-learn, and statsmodels, as well as strong understanding of model deployment patterns. Manipulating large datasets and using database and general-purpose programming language (such as Hadoop MapReduce, Python, JavaScript, or other big data frameworks, Java). Familiarity with basic principles of distributed computing and/or distributed databases. Demonstrable ability to quickly understand new concepts-all the way down to the theorems- and to come out with original solutions to mathematical issues. Good communication and interpersonal skills. Knowledge of one or more business/functional areas. Working knowledge of diagnosis and procedure coding, medical terminology, knowledge of managed care, claims payment processes, and insurance terminology required.

Strong analysis and critical thinking skills. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Excellent interpersonal/ communication skills.

Abilities Requirement

Ability to multi-task while maintaining careful attention-to-detail. Ability to handle multiple projects, data input, and strong problem-solving capability. Ability to build relationships and influence across the organization. Independent self-starter who is driven to success, takes great pride in accomplishments and works with a sense of urgency to meet deadlines and address competing priorities.

Commitment to Team Culture

The IEHP Team environment requires a Team Member to participate in the IEHP Team Culture. A Team Member demonstrates support of the Culture by developing professional and effective working relationships that include elements of respect and cooperation with Team Members, Members and associates outside of our organization.

Word processing involving computer keyboard and screens. Willingness to be on call, 7x24x365 (less pre-approved exceptions) and attend to technical issues outside of normal business hours.

JOB PURPOSE

The Manager, Business Intelligence & Data Insights is responsible for leading one or more individuals, providing timely, accurate dashboards and reports to internal and external customers. The Manager may also be asked to participate in enterprise wide projects related to Business Intelligence.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Lead, train, coach and provide guidance for up to 10 team members
Manage or develop and maintain supply chain related reports and interactive dashboards using Business Intelligence software for distribution to internal and external clients and key stakeholders
Manage and/or maintain report distribution lists and schedules
Manage prioritization of reporting requests according to impact and difficulty
Create and maintain data sources within Tableau using advanced SQL techniques
Use SQL to create calculated fields, and improve performance of extracts and dashboards
Utilize communication and problem solving skills to define and satisfy clients’ information needs
Synthesize analytical information, industry knowledge and commercial understanding into actionable intelligence for clients
Develop new reporting tools, processes and procedures to deliver value-added supply chain analytical services
Support analytical studies using advanced software and/or advanced mathematical techniques
Partner with technology team and business to ensure that each dashboard or report meets the need and resolves successfully
Determine objectives by gathering information, studying business functions and evaluating requested reporting requirements and formats

PERFORMANCE METRICS

Accuracy of deliverables
On-time deliverables

LISCR, LLC, a Dulles, Virginia-based maritime international shipping company, is looking to complement its Commercial/Business Development Department by hiring a management level member who will use analytical skills, procedures and tools to support senior management with in-depth review of all areas of business operations and procedures. The Senior Manager, Data Analytics, is responsible for providing the necessary analysis for executive level management to improve the company’s competitiveness, profitability, growth, and performance across a broad spectrum of criteria.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Competition Analysis

Analyze, the shipping industry for macro trends such as the economics of the world shipping fleet such as growth, newbuildings, scrapping, lag and lead economic indicators;
Predict opportunities for company growth, additional sources of revenue, and analysis of raw data to provide conclusions, presentations and graphs; and
Provide risk analysis for potential problems in the fleet, competitive analyses, as well as looking at business trends and attrition analysis that might present risk for the company.

Financial Analysis

Collaborate with C-Suite by conducting financial analysis of company’s budget, business and accounting ratios;.
Provides executive Dashboards; and
Provide high level financial forecasts.

Support Regional Offices

Lead the creation of price comparisons for regional managers with a focus to minimize the required discounts to win the business;
Lead the creation of China port due savings calculations and analysis;
Creates client Target lists for regional managers based on flags, countries and other target criteria;
Collaborate with the CRM team with the creation of reports to analyze the efficiency of the regional offices; and
Review and update business development goals by analyzing marketing/sales results and variances; identifying trends; recommending actions.

Goal setting for Regional offices

Set the annual regional office goals in regards to vessel registrations and new client’s acquisition;
Monitor the regional goals on a regular basis; and
Ensure that the regional offices receive the support and information required to reach the goals.

Strategic planning

Collaborate with C-Suite by helping to draft the strategic plan; and
Provides action items based on the strategic plan and ensures follow-up.

Other

Increase commercial department and company-wide productivity by developing automated applications; eliminating duplications; coordinating information requirements;
Provide detailed, and timely, information to management by assembling and summarizing data; preparing reports; making presentations of findings, analyses, and recommendations;
Performs other duties and projects as required; and
Acts as business consultant by managing and/or providing support to maritime, manning and corporate special projects.

Economic forecasting and financial analysis skills
Understand budgets and basic accounting principles
Ability to enter and retrieve data from both Access and Oracle system
Project management skills
Adequate understanding of the maritime industry, seafarer manning and offshore corporate registries
Be service-minded, self-motivated and detail oriented
Ability to operate as a team leader and work in a team environment
Ability to organize and prioritize work, delegate effectively and meet deadlines
Be an effective written and verbal communicator with ability to develop and present promotional information in a business environment
Proficient knowledge of Microsoft Office applications (with expert/very high level of ability in Excel) and use of general office equipment
Speak, write and understand English
Able to lift approximately 15 – 20 lbs

Description
VP of Sales

The Vice President of Sales is responsible for acquiring new accounts and achieving overall revenue growth.
The position requires excellent communication skills including in-person, phone and writing skills.
The goal of this position is to offer clients and prospects a new perspective on how they can best utilize our SaaS solutions. This will be accomplished by having an in-depth understanding of an account’s business, what brings them value and leveraging that information to deliver an irresistible message.

Candidates will teach prospects about how our solutions will benefit them and will tailor their communication to suit different prospects. The candidate will demonstrate expert knowledge regarding our suite of products and services and their useful application across various Public Finance Capital
Markets participants, including the Sell-side and Buy-side.

The VP-Sales will manage the sales cycle from cold-calling through contract negotiation and closing, with a bit of ongoing client account management when needed.

This position works closely with, and will report to the President of the company.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

Networks and partners with customers - both over phone and in person - to build confidence and develop win/win solutions; proactively stays on top of additional sales opportunities while navigating through customer organizations, balances frequency of contact with potential for new sales.
Effectively manages the territory by allocating appropriate time to prioritize goals of managing renewals as well as developing both cross-sell and new business sales opportunities when needed.
Uses appropriate interpersonal skills to consistently build trust and confidence with users, key contacts, and internal resources; communicates and interacts effectively with internal

Operations and Product teams to achieve company revenue goals.

Exhibits solid knowledge of the Capital Markets, both Sell-side and Buy-Side, and has experience selling data, technology and software services into this marketplace, knowledge of Municipal

Bond Markets is a big plus.

Knowledge of Product Management Lifecycle and the effort required to bring new so lutions to market.

Responsibilities

Generate new business sales by in person visits, as well as phone and web meetings.
Demonstrate the value of products and solutions to both new prospects and existing clients
Obtains territory information regarding market intelligence and penetration
Manage and coordinate all customer-related issues
Uses Salesforce to manage sales cycle pipeline and participate in weekly sales performance reports discussions

The Opportunity:

To transform in today’s evolving digital world, organizations must harness data to resolve emerging problems at scale. Do you thrive on using your critical-thinking skills to dig deep into complex data and mining solutions? As an experienced analytics consultant, you know how to apply your business and technical expertise to develop analytical processes, tools, and applications using SharePoint Online and Microsoft Power Platform. If you’re ready to utilize your advanced consulting skills and full industry knowledge to develop solutions for DoD clients, there’s a place for you at Booz Allen. You’ll introduce and recommend new ideas that deliver deep visibility and insights while being part of a supportive team that roots you on.

How You’ll Contribute:

As a data analyst on our team, you’ll:

Consult on using business intelligence data for predictive analytics and facilitating implementation of new tools, including Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI, JavaScript, and SharePoint Framework.
Administer quantitative and qualitative modeling techniques to data using DoD Cloud tools.
Apply analytical best practices for data collection, aggregation, normalization, and analysis.
Analyze and process data, while creating and maintaining models and report templates and developing dynamic, data-driven solutions using DoD Cloud technologies.
Recommend appropriate performance measures to be produced, including lifts, efficiencies, confidence intervals, and other statistical metrics.
Mentor and provide guidance to fellow team members.
Provide business clients with detailed, actionable reports documenting the findings from data processing and data analysis for the Knowledge Management Program.

Bring your analytical mindset and passion for change to transform the defense industry for the better.


Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:

2+ years of experience developing SharePoint applications
2+ years of experience working in a customer-facing role
1+ years of experience with SharePoint Online solution capabilities of Power Apps, Power Automate, and Power BI
Experience working as an integral part of a team, including delivery
Experience with software development, including Agile development
Secret clearance
Bachelor’s degree

Nice If You Have:

Experience with modern web frameworks, including React, Vue, or Angular
Experience developing applications using the SharePoint Framework (SPFx) web part model
Experience with DoD software development
Experience with Jira and GitHub
Knowledge of web design principles, including navigation, usability, and accessibility
Possession of excellent verbal and written communication skills


Clearance:

Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; Secret clearance is required.

Create Your Career:

Grow With Us

Your growth matters to us—that’s why we offer a variety of ways for you to develop your career. With professional and leadership development opportunities like upskilling programs, tuition reimbursement, mentoring, and firm-sponsored networking, you can chart a unique and fulfilling career path on your own terms.

A Place Where You Belong

Diverse perspectives cultivate collective ingenuity. Booz Allen’s culture of respect, equity, and opportunity means that, here, you are free to bring your whole self to work. With an array of business resource groups and other opportunities for connection, you’ll build your community in no time.

Support Your Well-Being

Our comprehensive benefits package includes wellness programs with HSA contributions, paid holidays, paid parental leave, a generous 401(k) match, and more. With these benefits, plus the option for flexible schedules and remote and hybrid locations, we’ll support you as you pursue a balanced, fulfilling life—at work and at home.

Your Candidate Journey

At Booz Allen, we know our people are what propel us forward, and we value relationships most of all. Here, we’ve compiled a list of resources so you’ll know what to expect as we forge a connection with you during your journey as a candidate with us.

Compensation

At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen’s benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.

Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual’s particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $45,400.00 to $93,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen’s total compensation package for employees.

Work Model
Our people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.

If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you’ll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.
If this position is listed as onsite, you’ll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.

EEO Commitment

We’re an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer that empowers our people to fearlessly drive change – no matter their race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation, or related medical conditions), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, veteran status, military or uniformed service member status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.

Hamilton College invites applications for the position of Data Science/Analysis Research Librarian in the Library and Information Technology Services (LITS). The Data Science/Analysis Research Librarian will provide research support and introduce cutting-edge data analysis tools and methodologies to LITS patrons as a member of the Research and Instructional Design (R&ID) Team where research and technology experts work together to support faculty and students with research and teaching. The R&ID Team provides an inclusive, respectful, and responsive service point, works collaboratively to meet exciting research challenges, supports learning communities, and introduces and facilitates the use of innovative technologies through consultation and instruction.

In addition, the Data Science/Analysis Research Librarian will focus on assisting a diverse audience of social science faculty and students with collection or creation, processing, and analysis of data. The Data Science/Analysis Research Librarian will refer or work with others in LITS and with LITS partners to support visualization, preservation, access, and reuse of data with the purpose of informing social science research and helping undergraduate students understand important social science concepts.

We are seeking a creative and analytical individual who enjoys variety in their work, thrives on working with others to solve challenging data-related problems, and is committed to lifelong teaching and learning of data analysis and technical skills. The position will serve as library liaison to one or more academic departments, based on data analysis needs and the individual’s educational background.

Responsibilities Include:

Research, Teaching, and Learning Support:

Actively participate in supporting diversity, equity, and inclusion in the Hamilton community.
Provide research support to the Hamilton faculty and students in the social sciences, members of the public, and the larger scholarly community.
Collaborate with faculty, educational technologists, and other academic partners to provide instructional design support and promote digital and information literacy in the social sciences and across the curriculum.
Serve as primary liaison to assigned academic departments, programs, and academic resource centers.
Participate in the ongoing training and mentoring of the R&ID student tutors.
Build collections in multiple formats to support the academic goals of the college.
Maintain and apply a current awareness of best practices in teaching and learning, especially as related to data analysis and digital and information fluencies.
Develop and maintain library resource guides for faculty and students.
Engage in a variety of professional development activities.
Participate in other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Data Science/Data Analysis:

Uses advanced skills with data analysis, data cleaning/wrangling/normalization, regular expressions, web scraping, and APIs to support and collaborate with researchers on data-related research.
Retrieve/manipulate complex data from a variety of sources; transfer data between platforms for use in multiple computing environments.
Work closely with and provide direct assistance to students in data science/analysis including workshops or other instruction.
Assists with in-class instruction of statistic-based labs in the social sciences.
Assist students with research projects and course assignments that require data analysis.
Works collaboratively with others in LITS and with LITS partners such as the Quantitative & Symbolic Reasoning Center (QSR), Oral Communication Center (OCC), and the Writing Center.
Assist in the choice, application, and interpretation of quantitative research methods, and with the use of statistical software needed to implement these methods.
Works consistently to enhance technical skills and develop proficiency with new data analysis tools and techniques.
Develops services in response to needs of faculty and students in the social sciences, LITS priorities, and diverse Hamilton populations.
Build effective working relationships with faculty and students.
Identifies, evaluates and recommends new and emerging data analysis research tools and methods for social science students and faculty, and LITS.
Qualifications
ALA-accredited master’s degree in Library or Information Science, and/or related advanced degree in quantitative social science; extensive coursework in economics and econometrics.
Equivalent combination of education, training, and experience will be considered.
Experience conducting social science research at the graduate level.
Experience providing data-related services in a library or research setting, either one-on-one or in a classroom setting.
Intermediate to expert experience with R and STATA; experience with SPSS and SAS highly desirable.
Proficiency with at least one programming language (such as Python or Java) highly desirable.
Demonstrated advanced data skills, including data cleaning/wrangling/normalization, using regular expressions, and web scraping.
Knowledge of software and tools supporting the discovery, management, analysis, and visualization of research data; including keeping abreast of current and emerging trends.
Proficiency using tools and programming libraries to support text analysis.
Experience working effectively with a team to plan and complete projects.
Demonstrated ability to work with diverse populations as well as demonstrated commitment to diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.

Job-related qualifications representing the knowledge, skills, and attributes an individual needs to possess in order to perform the job in a satisfactory manner.

Demonstrated ability and experience functioning successfully in a fast-paced environment with a strong service orientation.
Ability to work collegially and communicate effectively with colleagues, faculty, and students.
In-depth knowledge of a wide range of information sources and technologies, especially data science/analysis.
Superior teaching skills.
Curiosity about how technology is affecting research and teaching, and enthusiasm for collaboration with faculty and students in a liberal arts context.
Excellent writing, problem-solving, and presentation skills.
Demonstrated aptitude for quickly learning new tools and technologies.
Application Instructions

Please submit a cover letter, resume and contact information for three professional references. Please address your cover letter to Dr. Nhora Serrano, Associate Director for Digital Innovation, Learning and Research. In your cover letter, please describe your experiences with diversity and inclusion and your potential to support Hamilton's commitment to the same. Consideration of candidates will begin March 20th, 2023 and continue until the position is filled.

LITS is committed to creating an accessible, supportive environment and an educational experience that recognizes diversity and cultural competence as integral components of academic excellence. Candidates who can contribute to that goal are encouraged to apply and to identify their strengths in this area.

Hamilton College (www.hamilton.edu) is a residential liberal arts college located in the Mohawk Valley of upstate New York. Applicants with dual-career considerations can find other Hamilton and nearby academic job listings at www.upstatenyherc.org, as well as additional information at https://www.hamilton.edu/dof/faculty-development/resources-for-prospective-or-new-faculty/opportunities-for-spouses-or-partners (Opportunities for Spouses or Partners).

Job_title: Program & Data Manager - DBH Prevention & Education
Job_description:
Davis Behavioral Health (DBH) is seeking a full-time Program & Data Manager to oversee program planning, implementation, evaluation, and reporting for Prevention & Education efforts in Davis County. The ideal candidate possesses excellent communication skills, is meticulous, creative, and is a strong team player.

Essential Functions

The essential functions assigned to the Program & Data Manager include, but are not limited to the following:

Gather, track, evaluate, and report on Prevention & Education efforts on the program, coalition, and county levels.
Create visual materials such as print and digital marketing, reporting charts, and infographics to market programs and highlight effectiveness.
Write and report on grants to support the Prevention & Education efforts in Davis County
Work with the Prevention Coordinator to illustrate the significance of prevention to key stakeholders, and strategize how to continue to grow support, funding, and community reach.
Oversee and manage all aspects of scheduling, set up, facilitation, and follow-up for DBH sponsored Prevention & Education programs, as well as community events, on occasion.
Supervise program instructors and childcare staff, and provide them support, training, and professional development.
Coordinate with the Prevention Team regarding Prevention & Education programming needs across the county, as well as in individual schools and coalition areas.
Work with Diversity Coordinator regarding potential program barriers and solutions for diverse populations within Davis County

Preference may be given for candidates who use his/her own recovery experience and training to assist consumers.

Schedule

This position works in an office setting 40 hours per week. May be required to work occasional evening hours and weekends, as needed. Limited remote work may be allowed. There will be periodic travel required.

The successful candidate will primarily work a Monday through Friday day schedule but will be required to be flexible to attend required meetings, trainings, and other events associated with the role of Program and Data Manager as well as to oversee and supervise the prevention and education efforts, which mostly take place in the evening hours.

Compensation

The starting annual wage for the successful candidates is outlined below:

$55,000.00 per annum for candidates with a Master's degree (exempt FLSA status)
$21.00 per hour for candidates with a Bachelor's degree (non-exempt FLSA status)
Spanish-language incentive stipend (paid bi-weekly) available. Must pass a verbal Spanish-language proficiency assessment to qualify.

Davis Behavioral Health, Inc.

Davis Behavioral Health's mission is to provide access to quality behavioral healthcare by:

Adhering to principles of choice, safety, transparency, and collaboration with our clients, staff, and partners;
Utilizing evidence-informed practices to best serve our clients; and
Being fiscally wise and responsible.

Davis Behavioral Health understands that excellent clinicians are vital to meeting the standards established by its mission and vision statements.

It is highly preferred that individuals who are interested in obtaining employment at DBH, their spouse, or one of their dependents not be actively receiving services at DBH except for medication management services to eliminate/avoid possible conflicts or uncomfortable boundaries.

DBH understands that excellent employees are vital to meeting the standards established by its mission and vision statements. DBH is committed to excellence in community-based behavioral health treatment, progressive, vital and continually responsive to the needs of the community, and advocates for the behavioral health needs of our clients.

Davis Behavioral Health is an equal opportunity employer.

Required Experience

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Public Health, Social Work, Communication, Business, or other related fields, required. Master’s Degree preferred.
Experience with program development and implementation.
Ability to collaborate well with people of all ages and backgrounds.
Must be willing to complete a criminal background check and pre-employment drug screen.

Must have own transportation.

Organized and meticulous.
Dependable, with proven ability to work independently and follow-through with responsibilities.

ACUPOLL Precision Research is a 30+ year market research firm that leverages innovative market research survey methods to drive client innovation and marketing success, so clients, their companies, and their communities thrive. We’ve maintained strong growth for several years by offering a wide variety of research solutions that delight our clients large and small across consumer products, health care, private equity, consulting, and other industries. We’ve helped nine clients achieve Top 10 U.S. launches in recent years. Our culture is friendly, casual, non-bureaucratic, and hard-working with current employees averaging 10+ years with the company. Employees work from home 4 days/week (local employees are a plus).

The Role- Asst. Director- Operations & Analytics

We are looking for an experienced data enthusiast to assist our VP in the group responsible for creating research reports- tabulating data, creating visuals, and any advanced analyses- without having to write analyses or manage clients. This role primarily handles in-depth or more complex research reports, but also helps the VP to lead important strategic initiatives, automation, and other efforts across the department.

Specific responsibilities include:

Developing the best data analysis plan for research projects to address client learning needs
Accurate and expeditious survey data review, compilation, and tabulation
Application of advanced research techniques/analyses to provide greater insight, both those developed by ACUPOLL as well as any additional techniques you can contribute
In collaboration with the Account Manager (who writes the questionnaire and verbal report analysis), creation and editing of Powerpoint reports and at times dashboards, that most effectively communicate the story and learnings to clients and ensures all project objectives are met
Survey programming as needed and skill set allows
Working with the VP to lead projects in process improvement, standardization, visualization, training, analytics development, and/or other areas

This job is for you if you are/have:

Must have experience working in a market research/insights role where survey research is your primary focus
Experienced (5+ years) in advanced market research survey tabulation software and creating Powerpoint reports/visuals
Proven leadership and analytic skills to manage complex studies and lead training and initiatives within the group
Strong people and communication skills to work with a diverse team
Familiar with a variety of research study types (e.g. concept/package/ad testing, idea/messaging/claims screening and optimization, A&Us, tracking/brand health, segmentation, etc.) and a variety of analytic techniques (e.g. MaxDiff, TURF, Discrete Choice/Conjoint, Drivers Analysis, etc.)
Desiring a career in the operations and analytics space
Demonstrated success as an efficient/high-volume producer able to juggle 3-4 projects simultaneously
Positive attitude, great work ethic, attention to detail, responsiveness, effective communicator, commitment to delivering for the client and team, and passion for continuous constructive improvement

Experience with SPSS or other analytic software, Sawtooth, Forsta/Confirmit programming/visualization, or Visual Basic is a plus

The benefits of working with us:

Competitive base compensation and bonus
Health, dental, and vision insurance
Work from home flexibility (1 day/week in-office required on-going, 2 days/week during on-boarding)
Competitive PTO, holidays including 4 day weekends for Memorial Day, July 4th, and Labor Day
Wide variety of research in a mid-size, collaborative company that constantly works to advance/innovate for clients

Avant is looking for a Data Loss Prevention Specialist (DLP). The DLP Associate is a practitioner responsible for securing and monitoring all data accessed, transmitted and stored throughout Avant and our third party partners.You have experience engaging throughout the entire data lifecycle, from inception through disposal, ensuring access to data is managed and maintained following Avant’s security, engineering and governance principles. The DLP Associate works closely with business units and stakeholders to help with data access, ownership and enforcement of policies, rules and safeguards. The engineer works closely with IT team members, cybersecurity threat operations and third party risk. This DLP specialist must be technically proficient with data protection technologies, including data loss prevention (DLP), cloud access security broker (CASB), data classification, privacy, encryption and have a firm understanding of GRC principles.

This candidate will collaborate with technical and non-technical teams to design, implement and manage data protection processes that reduce risk from insider threats and data breaches while also ensuring fair use of data for Avant’s customers. The role is expected to be knowledgeable about data storage and identity and access management, and adept at understanding security architecture. Advisement and validation of controls to ensure protection aligns with policies, procedures and risk oversight as well as support senior management to help maintain a safe and secure enterprise technical operation. Additionally, engineers work closely with incident response and security operations center (SOC) personnel when events and suspected incidents surface.

**This is a hybrid opportunity in Chicago**

What you do at Avant:

Key member of the information security team working on identifying, establishing and maintaining data protection technical controls in context of business and regulatory needs..
Work closely with security leadership, teammates and stakeholders to evaluate and implement data protection controls that align with organizational risk posture and regulatory compliance requirements.
Support and maintain a wide range of data protection technologies, including but not limited to DLP, CASB, data classification, data governance and encryption systems across a variety of technology ecosystems.
Familiar with cloud infrastructure and with applications required to support a dispersed remote workforce.
Manage and test business rules protecting data, as well as the use and handling of data assets.
Conduct data discovery to locate data at risk.
Document data protection policy exceptions, and periodically review with business units.
Make recommendations for improvements to ensure least privilege to data and rigorous security practices, without negatively impacting end-user experience or leading to employees attempting to circumvent controls.
Execute tactical requests supporting the strategic vision for rigorous and scalable data protection controls.
Maintain understanding of business processes to aid in managing enterprise data protection.
Frequently interact with business units to understand their plans, risk posture and tolerance, and how to share responsibility and support their vision and business obligations securely.
Implement data protection projects from inception to completion on time and within budget.
Analyze systems and data sources for accidental, malicious and unauthorized activities that may jeopardize the security and privacy of protected data.
Develop relationships with engineering, IT, CTOC, business and dev engineering team members.
Perform other duties as assigned.

Why you are a fit for Avant:

3-5+ years’ experience in security systems administration, with 2+ years’ technical hands-on data protection practitioner experience.
Familiarity with administering security controls, databases, role-based access, DLP, data classification and governance solutions.
Strong understanding of data protection principles and control frameworks.
Ideally familiar with regulatory requirements and laws, such as Payment Card Industry (PCI), Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX), California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) and Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLBA). Additionally, experience in NIST Cybersecurity Framework (CSF) and NIST Privacy Framework.
Preferably some basic experience with one or more scripting languages (e.g., Python, PowerShell and Bash).
Track record of acting with integrity, taking pride in your work, seeking to excel, and being curious and flexible.
Strong written and oral communication skills across varying levels of the organization.
Highly organized with the ability to prioritize and complete tasks within defined SLAs.
Excellent judgment and the ability to make quick decisions when working within complex situations
One or more of CISSP, CIPP, CISA CRISC, CDPSE and GSEC is preferable, but not required

Check out our Avant Blog!

We believe that a diverse set of backgrounds and experiences helps us create the most innovative solutions for our customers. We invite you to apply to our positions even if you do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed in the description. If you’re passionate about our mission and aligned to our values, we hope you’ll come contribute to our awesome culture.

Why Avant is the place for you:

At Avant, we believe our values make a difference:

Authenticity. We show up to work as our whole selves and make sure others can too.

Collaboration. We can only succeed when we do so as a team.

Problem-Solving. The harder the problem, the more satisfying the solution.

We believe that great ideas come from anyone and anywhere, that everyone is an owner who drives change, and that we have more fun when we work together. We're problem solvers who love collaborating with intelligent and highly-motivated people to reshape the face of digital banking. Avant offers terrific perks and benefits, fun social events with employees who actually like hanging out together, and a flexible growth environment where trying your hand at new projects and being the active owner of your career path is encouraged and supported.

Job_title: Data Collector, Reassessment Services - Clarion County, PA
Job_description:
Don't want to sit at a desk all day? Want to serve your community? Like managing your own time?

Join our team! No Experience required, paid training provided!

About Vision Government Solutions

Vision Government Solutions is a leading high-tech firm providing cutting-edge software and services to the public sector. Our organization is at an incredible inflection point and we are looking for people to join our data collection team.

Why This Opportunity is Different

This is an incredible opportunity to grow and develop a career as many of our senior leadership team members started at Vision as data collectors. Learn the appraisal business from the ground-up with the largest firm in Pennsylvania.

Job Description

Immediately hiring Data Collectors in Clarion County with reliable transportation who are dependable, customer-service oriented and enjoy working outdoors. In this role, you would be responsible for inspecting, verifying and recording details of commercial and residential properties required for property valuation.

If you are looking for an opportunity to advance your career - Vision Government Solutions is the place for you. Our team takes pride in their work and many successful candidates have enjoyed long-term career growth with our company. NO EXPERIENCE NECESSARY - just dependability and a willingness to learn.

Job Responsibilities

Accurately record all required data on the collection form that will be pertinent to the valuation of the property.
Interact effectively and professionally with taxpayers to neutralize any misgivings on their part regarding the inspection process.
Anticipate unusual situations and make quick and responsible decisions.

Desire to learn and grow in the real estate appraisal field.

Strong communication skills with the ability to adapt to different stakeholders to ensure positive taxpayer experiences.
Exhibit the flexibility necessary to multi-task and perform contracted services in multiple communities as needed.
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to anticipate unusual situations and make quick and responsible decisions.
Spatial ability to read maps and locate a physical location on a map.
Ability to visualize floor plan footprints based on three-dimensional buildings.
Good math skills to calculate square footage, ratios, and similar functions.

Job_title: Program & Data Manager - DBH Prevention & Education
Job_description:
Davis Behavioral Health (DBH) is seeking a full-time Program & Data Manager to oversee program planning, implementation, evaluation, and reporting for Prevention & Education efforts in Davis County. The ideal candidate possesses excellent communication skills, is meticulous, creative, and is a strong team player.

Essential Functions

The essential functions assigned to the Program & Data Manager include, but are not limited to the following:

Gather, track, evaluate, and report on Prevention & Education efforts on the program, coalition, and county levels.
Create visual materials such as print and digital marketing, reporting charts, and infographics to market programs and highlight effectiveness.
Write and report on grants to support the Prevention & Education efforts in Davis County
Work with the Prevention Coordinator to illustrate the significance of prevention to key stakeholders, and strategize how to continue to grow support, funding, and community reach.
Oversee and manage all aspects of scheduling, set up, facilitation, and follow-up for DBH sponsored Prevention & Education programs, as well as community events, on occasion.
Supervise program instructors and childcare staff, and provide them support, training, and professional development.
Coordinate with the Prevention Team regarding Prevention & Education programming needs across the county, as well as in individual schools and coalition areas.
Work with Diversity Coordinator regarding potential program barriers and solutions for diverse populations within Davis County

Preference may be given for candidates who use his/her own recovery experience and training to assist consumers.

Schedule

This position works in an office setting 40 hours per week. May be required to work occasional evening hours and weekends, as needed. Limited remote work may be allowed. There will be periodic travel required.

The successful candidate will primarily work a Monday through Friday day schedule but will be required to be flexible to attend required meetings, trainings, and other events associated with the role of Program and Data Manager as well as to oversee and supervise the prevention and education efforts, which mostly take place in the evening hours.

Compensation

The starting annual wage for the successful candidates is outlined below:

$55,000.00 per annum for candidates with a Master's degree (exempt FLSA status)
$21.00 per hour for candidates with a Bachelor's degree (non-exempt FLSA status)
Spanish-language incentive stipend (paid bi-weekly) available. Must pass a verbal Spanish-language proficiency assessment to qualify.

Davis Behavioral Health, Inc.

Davis Behavioral Health's mission is to provide access to quality behavioral healthcare by:

Adhering to principles of choice, safety, transparency, and collaboration with our clients, staff, and partners;
Utilizing evidence-informed practices to best serve our clients; and
Being fiscally wise and responsible.

Davis Behavioral Health understands that excellent clinicians are vital to meeting the standards established by its mission and vision statements.

It is highly preferred that individuals who are interested in obtaining employment at DBH, their spouse, or one of their dependents not be actively receiving services at DBH except for medication management services to eliminate/avoid possible conflicts or uncomfortable boundaries.

DBH understands that excellent employees are vital to meeting the standards established by its mission and vision statements. DBH is committed to excellence in community-based behavioral health treatment, progressive, vital and continually responsive to the needs of the community, and advocates for the behavioral health needs of our clients.

Davis Behavioral Health is an equal opportunity employer.

Required Experience

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Public Health, Social Work, Communication, Business, or other related fields, required. Master’s Degree preferred.
Experience with program development and implementation.
Ability to collaborate well with people of all ages and backgrounds.
Must be willing to complete a criminal background check and pre-employment drug screen.
Valid Utah Driver’s License in good standing.
Must have own transportation.

Required Skills and Abilities

Strong, effective, clear, and concise communication skills, both oral and written
Organized and meticulous.
Dependable, with proven ability to work independently and follow-through with responsibilities.
Able to take initiative and solve problems effectively.
Gather, track, evaluate, and report program data.
Analyze and synthesize data into written and visual formats.
Computer skills, including familiarity with the Microsoft Office products, design software such as the Adobe Suite, and ability to learn new systems.
Perform effectively in stressful situations.

Preferred Skills and Abilities:

Knowledge of Prevention & Education programming and framework
Grant writing and management
Create physical and digital marketing materials.
Supervisory experience
Bilingual English/Spanish
Public speaking skills

The selected candidate must successfully pass a pre-employment criminal background check and drug screening. Data Center Customer Operations Technician

Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company, operating 245+ data centers across the globe and providing interconnections to all the key clouds and networks. Businesses need one place to simplify and bring together fragmented, complex infrastructure that spans private and public cloud environments. Our global platform allows customers to place infrastructure wherever they need it and connect it to everything they need to succeed.

We are a fast-growing global company with 80 quarters of growth. Through our innovative portfolio of high-performance products and services, we have created the largest, most active global ecosystem of 10,000+ companies, including 2,000+ networks and 3,000 cloud and IT service providers in 32 countries spanning six continents.

Joining our operations team means that you will be at the forefront of all we do, maintaining critical facilities infrastructure as part of a close-knit team delivering best-in-class service to our data center customers. We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment. that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success.

Job Summary

Data Centers are considered Critical Facilities. This means that we support hospitals, laboratories, public safety centers. Simply put - We cannot go dark. In this crucial role, you will be responsible for fixing and installing sophisticated circuits and performing custom installations.

Responsibilities

Racks and stacks customer equipment

Reads installation plans (Visio Drawings / Spreadsheets) and implements installation accordingly

Installs circuits requiring sophisticated fiber terminations

Resolves work priorities from a ticketing queue and ensures consistency to all contribute times

Troubleshoots switched / multiplexed / media converted circuits; escalates to, and works with networking group, as needed

Works with customers to troubleshoot issues

Installs/tests/modifies cross connects per SOPs and ensures accurate cable management of coax, fiber, twisted pair copper, and intra-building cross connects

Installs and tests sophisticated cross connects circuits (switched, multiplexed, etc.)

Maintains detailed written records of all work activity

Designs and leads cage / infrastructure modification projects

Finishes the assigned training in a timely manner

Supports customer happiness through timely and detailed order execution

Qualifications

3+ years experience

High School Diploma

BERT and SONET test equipment

Able to perform all essential job functions, including walking, standing, bending, stooping, climbing, lifting and manual dexterity, with or without reasonable accommodation

Able to lift heavy equipment/items up to 50 pounds

Able to work days/nights/weekends/holidays, if needed and/or required

Job_description:
Adjunct Instructor for Data Science Courses

Supervisor: Dean and/or Chair

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Develops and teaches Computer Science courses in Data Science, Machine Learning, and AI at graduate level. Desirable candidates should have experience in teaching courses related to these areas.
Teaches students effectively and maintains office hours for student consultation in accordance with procedures outlined by SFBU.
Provides students with a written course syllabus that are in compliance with SFBU requirements.
Participates in program-level learning assessment. Participation includes helping articulate learning outcomes, choosing/administering measures, evaluating student performance, and suggesting changes to improve student learning.
Maintains accurate and complete course records to meet required accreditation standards.
Performs professional activities and assumes professional responsibilities as agreed upon with the school dean and works with colleagues to achieve shared goals and visions.
Uses knowledge of diverse communities and learning styles and can incorporate a diversity of delivery of such learning styles in instruction.
Utilizes technology to facilitate learning and access data, maintain records, generate reports, and communicate with others.
Meets teaching assignments in accordance with the System’s calendar and contractual obligations.
Complies with SFBU board policy, state and federal policy, and the faculty code of conduct as appropriate.
Serves on and attends university committees as assigned.
Attends and participates in the Faculty Assembly meetings. Contributes to the initiatives led by the Faculty Assembly or the Academics Administrative Team.
Attends departmental, divisional, and college-wide meetings where appropriate or as required by supervisor.
Participates in his/her own professional development plan. Plans must be created by the third week of the first semester taught in a calendar year. Progress must be supplied prior to the end of each semester taught
Remains current in academic or program discipline, including maintaining licensure, certification, or continuing education requirements where appropriate.
Receives training or stay current in technological or pedagogical advances that promote student learning.
Promotes the college in the community by participating in a variety of marketing activities.
Be available to students via email, phone, or personal (or virtual) conferences. The method of contact and hours of availability should be clearly communicated to supervisors and to students through the course syllabus each trimester.
Assign grades and maintain course/student records in accordance with SFBU policies and submit grades and records by the established deadlines.

Job Requirements and Qualifications:

· Prepare the course syllabus and teach the assigned course(s), usually 3 hours per week.

· Expertise in subjects related to Data Science, Machine Learning, and Artificial Intelligence. Work experience in these areas is required.

Have a good understanding of best practices and pedagogy for leading in-person, online, and hybrid course environments.
Demonstrate ability to promote academic integrity.
Position requires excellent communication, presentation, and teaching skills.
Must possess the ability to follow university, federal, and state policies and regulations.
Must possess the ability to, and genuine interest in helping the students, and sensitivity to, and understanding of, the diverse academic, socioeconomic, and cultural/ethnic backgrounds of the students.

Education and Experience:

Master’s degree in a field related to Data Science, Machine Learning, and AI.
Experience in teaching relevant Computer Science subjects at the graduate level preferably using Python programming language.
Three years of professional experience using skills related to these subjects
Experience in teaching courses, conducting professional training, or lecturing/presenting to groups of people

Preferred

Doctoral degree in a field related to Data Science, Machine Learning, and AI
Able to commute to SFBU campus (Fremont, CA) to deliver lectures in person (typically, one day each week for 3 hours per course).
At least five years of professional experience and two (or more) years of experience in teaching Computer Science courses at the graduate/advanced level
Knowledgeable in setting up and utilizing the Canvas LMS (learning management system) in teaching courses

Physical Characteristics:

Must be able to lift and carry up to 20 lbs.
The employee is required to crouch, walk, reach, grasp, carry, and push.
The employee is occasionally required to sit or stand for long periods.

MKD Electric is seeking an Data Center Electrician with data center experience. As part of this role the successful candidate will be responsible for inspecting, repairing, installing, modifying, and maintaining electrical systems, circuits and equipment in data centers and other mission critical facilities.


What you will do…


Install, maintain, and repair electrical equipment such as transformers, switchboards, controllers, circuit breakers, motors, conduit systems, power and control circuits and other transmission equipment
Use and interpret blueprints, drawings, schematics, or other specifications to plan work and / or troubleshoot electrical systems and components
Measure, cut, bend, and install conduit/wire
Assist with mentoring junior (apprentice) electricians
Requisition material, tools and equipment and maintain inventory
Troubleshoot issues and make recommendations to resolve the situation
Respond to emergency power and back-up systems failures
Effectively communicate status of, issues, recommendations, etc. to management
Provide timely and completed documentation of work performed
Must be willing and able to work overtime, be on site at odd hours and participate in an on-call rotation.

What you will need to succeed…


High School Diploma or GED
Virginia Journeyman Electrician license
4+ years of experience working within the data center industry
Valid driver’s license in good standing
Problem solving skills
Excellent communication and time management skills
Ability to multi-task
Knowledge of national electric code
Knowledge of OSHA safety guidelines and practices
Ability to understand and follow MOP & SOW’s
OSHA 30 Certified
Able to understand and read electrical blueprints, schematics and one-line diagrams
LOTO experience working with highly redundant and complicated electrical distribution systems
Ability to perform duties in a professional manner and appearance.
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks, changing priorities as necessary
Ability to work under time pressure and adapt to changing requirements with a positive attitude
Effective oral and written communication skills as required for the position
Ability to be self-motivated, proactive and an effective team player
Ability to interact effectively and professionally with all levels of employees, both management and staff alike, vendors, clients, and others
Strong written and verbal communication skills with excellent presentation skills
Working knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Word, and Outlook applications
Possess strong organizational and time management skills

Physical demands…
The Physical demands described within are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.


Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Must be able to lift to 60 pounds independently; lifting from knee to shoulder heights; other lifting required from various levels.
Must be able to carry and transport up to 60 pounds up to 20 feet.
Must be able to remain stationary position for extended periods of time, prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer
Requires standing for extended period with frequent stretching, reaching, walking, and stooping, pushing and/or pulling in an environment that may be cold, hot, noisy, and wet and may have fumes or odors.

What you’ll love about us…
MKD employees are the company’s greatest assets. The Data and Operations Analyst broadly supports the prioritized research and analytic initiatives of the Institute of Food Technologists, whose mission is to advance the science of food and its application across the global food system. The Data and Operations Analyst is responsible for the collection, analysis and application of quantitative analysis of primary data on behalf of IFT and its business processes, strategic initiatives and research initiatives related to the academic and industrial food science. He/she is responsible for the compilation, analysis, and integration of secondary data into process, product and strategic decision making to meet the organization's strategic plan objectives and goals. The Data and Operations Analyst works across the organization as a partner to product and business process teams to assist with a myriad of projects including membership strategy, marketing initiatives, audience acquisition and member retention. The Data and Operations Analyst will work closely with their supervisor to support the organization's short and long-term goals as well as strategic prioritization. Additionally, a core component of this role will be to oversee the accuracy of our data that is reported internally to stakeholders coming out of both analysis and from our systems like HubSpot for marketing, HubSpot CRM, our sales workbooks, and Personify for member management.

Essential Responsibilities

Data Collection and List Building

Collaborate with departments to provide analytic support to a wide range of initiatives covering food science to coordinate and create uniformity and efficiency in data collection programs related to membership and annual event attendance, utilizing best practices, conforming to privacy policies and laws and ensuring the best possible data integrity.
Work with teams to help identify gaps in data. Use currently available tools to fortify lists for the purposes of audience and membership acquisition.

Data Analysis

Uphold and disseminate information on organization-wide best practices for planning, monitoring and requirements collection and analysis, including tools and training for staff and leadership.
Partner with product teams for new product development support related to business analysis and requirements development leading to business case support.
Collaborate closely with sales, marketing, communications, publications and membership teams to enhance communications and marketing to members with increased attention to clearly communicated data, and year-over-year data trends, in support of IFT member initiatives.
In collaboration with IT staff, create and modify dashboards, reports, queries and data exports as required. Establish regular, automated reporting systems when possible.
In collaboration with IT staff, be a provider of responsive, accurate ad-hoc reporting service to IFT staff.
Work with IT and Membership staff to establish, maintain, and communicate standards for data access and reporting.
Receive, assign priorities, track, and respond to analysis requests from IFT departments while developing self-service analysis skills within the departments.

Business Intelligence

Working with cross-functional teams and the volunteers from academic and industrial science of food community, be the lead data & research analytics professional to prioritize and plan primary and secondary research data requirements.
Ability to implement new data analysis methodologies, monitor trends and key performance metrics
Develop processes and procedures for the collection, analysis, and reporting of data
To build, test, and maintain predictive models that will help guide decision making for the business.
Skill requirements include thorough knowledge in but not limited to –
Data mining algorithms
Tableau, Alteryx and other data visualization programs
Beginner level experience in R, Python, SQL
Database management and reporting
Regression Analysis (linear and multiple)
Excel, Origin, SPSS, Minitab or equivalent
Advanced GA Certification

Data Integrity & Literacy

Work with cross-functional teams to ensure the accuracy of the data received, reported on, and analyzed.
A core component of this role will be to oversee reporting coming out of the operations team and to double check that it is accurate and delivered on time.
Provide on-going staff trainings to build data literacy and comfort with basic data analysis throughout the organization. Eg: How to trainings on building pivot tables, de-duping records, advanced excel skills, cross tabbing data sets, etc.

This is not meant to be a complete or comprehensive list as responsibilities may change; other duties, responsibilities and activities may be assigned at any time.

Experience Requirements

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Statistics, Business Analytics or related area required
Master's degree in Business Analytics or Statistics or preferred area.
Certified Business Analyst Professional certification (CBAP) preferred but not required
Minimum three years' professional experience
Success in synthesizing multiple data sets to develop action plan and priorities
Proven successes in managing a variety of assignments simultaneously while maintaining close attention to detail
Proven experience in anticipating the needs of managers and working to innovate processes and procedures to create efficiencies
Demonstrated advanced proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite of products
Past use of tools like ZoomInfo, Hoovers, or other contact repository systems
Experience working in a diverse, international environment with key clients/customers/partners from a variety of countries and cultural backgrounds with sensitivity and awareness

Competency Requirements

High degree of rapid responsiveness and customer-centric attitude Flexible: dealing effectively with change and acclimating (adjusting) to a dynamic environment
Effective Communication: Conveying and receiving information and ideas efficiently and effectively through a variety of organizational mediums and modifying communications for multiple audiences
Initiative: Seeks new/additional responsibilities, projects, tasks; Acts independently in new/routine situations
Celebrate One Another: Creating and maintaining an environment that enables participants of all diverse demographics to contribute to their full potential in pursuit of organizational objectives
Building Collaborative Relationships: Able to develop, maintain, and strengthen partnerships with others inside or outside of the organization who can provide information, assistance and support

Skill Requirements

Help facilitate initiatives to improve customer experience & enhance engagement; take ownership of customer issues and follow problems through to resolution
Manage projects, processes, and/or people to accomplish individual, departmental, project, and organizational goals; when supervising, provide effective feedback and help develop direct reports
Recognize and address issues that are outside a single perspective/role; promote creative, novel thinking and apply it to existing and emerging situations
Pivot when change occurs or priorities shift; be an enthusiastic supporter of new processes or initiatives; continuously offer suggestions for improvement
Maintain fiscal accountability while ensuring appropriate use of resources; may oversee budgets and contracts
Successful collaborator; foster effective working relationships with colleagues, especially those on teams, projects, and within the reporting relationship
Ability to present complex data systems to audiences in a readily consumable way.
To work across teams to recommend actionable strategies drawn from insights using complex data models that will clarify information and help department heads make data informed decisions.

Work Conditions

Travel 5%, domestically, including the ability to occasionally attend evening, weekend and overnight meetings
Must be present and working for the entire IFT annual meeting each July.
Physical demands
Sitting for extended periods of time and may involve walking or standing for brief periods of time.
