The educational entry requirements are listed below. Equivalent experience (year for year) may substitute for required education.

Bachelor's Degree

in mathematics, engineering, business, information technology, management information systems, or related field required

Data Analyst II, III & Senior: Post Secondary Education

The educational entry requirements are listed below. Equivalent experience (year for year) may substitute for required education.

Bachelor's Degree

in mathematics, engineering, business, information technology, management information systems, or related field required

Master's Degree Preferred

Minimum Experience

Minimum experience requirements are listed below. Experience requirements are additive to education requirements. Additional education may not substitute for experience.

Data Analyst I

This is the entry-level role in data analytics and business intelligence. College graduates with demonstrated skills in designing, developing, and implementing technology solutions to support user needs, data analytics, corporate performance reporting, and dashboards

Data Analyst II

3+ years progressively responsible experience in a data analytics or business intelligence role with demonstrated examples of designing, developing and implementing technology solutions to support user needs, complex data analytics, corporate performance reporting, and dashboards is required

Experience related to the area of the organization this role will support, such as asset management or hydro operations desired

Data Analyst III

5+ years progressively responsible experience in a data analytics or business intelligence role with demonstrated examples of designing, developing and implementing technology solutions to support user needs, complex data analytics, corporate performance reporting, and dashboards is required.

- Experience related to the area of the organization this role will support, such as asset management or hydro operations is desired.

Data Analyst Senior

7+ years progressively responsible experience in a data analytics or business intelligence role with demonstrated in-depth experience designing, developing and implementing technology solutions to support user needs, including complex data analytics in a variety of subjects, corporate performance reporting, and development of dashboards required

Experience related to the area of the organization this role will support, such as asset management or hydro operations preferred

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

•

Working knowledge of data analytics around large production data and operational datasets using a variety of techniques using mathematics and statistics.

•

Working knowledge of quantitative analysis and programming techniques.

•

Working knowledge of analytics, data mining, and data cleansing.

•

Knowledge of data warehousing/business intelligence best practices, methodologies, standards, and data architectures.

•

Knowledge of operating systems, relational database design, logical data modeling, data warehousing, and relational database management systems.

•

Familiarity with management decision making subjects and concepts, such as finance and accounting.

•

Familiarity with process improvement techniques such as six sigma or similar.

•

Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills to solve problems creatively.

•

Good communication skills that can effectively communicate complex subjects to a variety of audiences.

•

Strong customer service skills and orientation.

•

Detail oriented with a high level of intellectual curiosity.

•

Strong logic and reasoning skills.

•

Strong critical thinking skills.

•

Able to analyze data and issues in a disciplined, structured and analytical manner, and leverage various tools and techniques such as mathematics, statistics and data science to create solutions.

•

Able to formulate a solution to a business problem, translate it into requirements or quantitative terms using analytical tools, analyze the results, iteratively refine the solution and effectively communicate results.

•

Ability to translate user requests into functional and technical requirements and effectively communicate with both the end user and technical team.

•

Ability to utilize information in both quantitative and qualitative form to inform development of actions.

•

Able to identify and weigh strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions.

•

Ability to work constructively and maintain a positive outlook when facing tight deadlines.

•

Ability to plan, organize and prioritize work in order to optimize progress on multiple assignments and successfully meet deadlines.

•

Ability to work collaboratively on a team.

•

Ability and desire to solve problems and develop solutions.

•

Ability to accept constructive feedback.

•

Must enjoy the challenge and nuances of applying technology solutions to complex and often imperfect datasets.

•

Must be proficient in reading, writing and speaking English.

Position Details:

Summary of Duties:

This position is responsible for the development, implementation and management of systems used to collect research data for the Paul G. Allen School for Global Health (SGH) at Washington State University. This position interacts with a broad range of researchers to gather requirements for data collection and storage, and then designs, implements, and maintains these systems. Working as an intermediary between the School for Global Health and the College of Veterinary Medicine's Veterinary Information Systems unit, this position will also assist in the preparation of data sets for analysis and will act as the primary support contact for a REDCap instance supporting both domestic and international research programs, as well as other data collection systems. Infrequent international travel to assist international research programs may be necessary in this position.

To support WSU's ability to attract talent in a competitive job market, this recruitment has been approved for a hiring incentive/moving allowance payment of up to one month's salary.


Depending on your level of experience, you may begin as a IT Data Management-Entry or a IT Data Management- Journey.

Position requires a Bachelor's degree in a related technology field. Any combination of relevant education and experience may be substituted for the educational requirement on a year-for-year basis.

ETL processing design, planning, testing, and production implementations.

Data warehousing experience.

Millennium Print Group "MPG", a subsidiary of The Pokémon Company International, is in The Research Triangle Park area of North Carolina.

Since its inception in 2014 under the current executive team, the Millennium Print Group has assembled a dedicated and highly talented staff of print professionals and has built a world-class organization that is customer focused, market-competitive, and quality driven.

Our unique ability offers a variety of services specializing in trading specialties and collectible cards. Since 2019, MPG has nearly tripled in size.

Currently, MPG is seeking to hire an experienced Variable Data Programmer for our location at 9301 Globe Center Dr, Morrisville, NC 27560. If you possess the required skills and experience as outlined below, please submit your resume for consideration.


RESPONSIBILITIES

Receive information from customers and create excel files for variable data to feed into variable data software.
Oversee, evaluate, and calibrate equipment, systems, and procedures used in the development and production of products.
Collaborate with other departments for change management, for developing regulatory documentation, and for cleaning validation activities monitoring.
Develop manufacturing processes to ensure proper scale up and design verification/validation.
Ensure that process improvements are evaluated and implemented through the change control management process.
Develop and maintain databases for tracking test results, validation activities, and/or validated systems.
Lead multiple projects with minimal oversight.
Take responsibility for all aspects of data management to include tracking and validating data.
Ensure accuracy and quality of data.
Complete other assigned projects and tasks.

Knowledge of various variable data software (XMPie, HP SmartStream)
Advanced Microsoft Excel Skills
Intermediate math skills
Experience in variable data programming
Exceptional attention to detail
Ability to work independently and with multiple teams
Experience in print industry is preferred.


COMPENSATION & BENEFITS

MPG offers a leading-edge compensation package which includes the following:

A highly competitive compensation "above the industry" commensurate with experience which includes an annual incentive bonus plan
100% Employer-paid medical, dental base plan, vision, life/AD&D, and short-term and long-term disability, while subsidizing premiums for medical, dental, and vision for employee dependents
401(k) Plan with up to a 4% (dollar for dollar) Employer match
Health Savings/Flexible Spending Account options
Paid time off, including 9 company-paid holidays
Employee Assistance Program
And, much more!


For more information, please visit our Company Website at https://mprintgroup.isolvedhire.com/jobs/

Job Summary
The Datacenter Automation Systems (DAS) team is committed to the successful implementation of autonomous and semi-autonomous vehicles throughout multiple datacenters. CBRE is seeking a full-time, permanent, CAD Operator with experience in MEP design, manufacturing or data center robotics-centric automation solutions. The DAS CAD Operator will report to the Client-approved location:
Moncks Corner, SC - full time / on site
The DAS CAD Operator requirements may vary according to Client-determined assignments, but most content relates to creating detailed designs for industrial automation equipment and systems in the DAS robotics portfolio at the Client's data centers. This position is part of a multi-disciplinary team creating engineering documentation and design drawing packages. The individual will collaborate with project engineers, technical writers, project managers, and other CAD/BIM Operators. Ideal candidates would be familiar with establishing and managing a design environment. Ideal candidates must be comfortable communicating regularly via video conference, email and internal ticketing systems.

Job Duties:
Acquire clear understanding of product requirements by reviewing, understanding, interpreting and revising technical specifications, blueprints and engineering illustrations, mockups, and prototypes.
Ability to read and interpret design standards and specifications, blueprints, drawings, redlines, etc
Coordinate the CAD design for Navigation Tape and GeoMarker installation package
Installation Drawings
Navigation DesignLayout
GeoMarker datum development
Material Takeoff
Working understanding of construction design package development for field installation.
Ability to translate existing field conditions from documentation and redlines to revise/edit design drawing packages.
Ability to learn software such as Lucidchart to generate shape files for navigation translated from design drawings. .
Capable of managing shifting design production to coordinate with field installation schedules.
Coordinate file management with 3rd party teams for document file transfer.
Maintain audits of latest design revisions against floor plan modifications.
Ability to perform repetitive field measurement tasks for long durations such as bending, kneeling, squatting ,walking, climbing stairs, etc.
Must have excellent organizational skills
Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing

Other duties as assigned.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position.

QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE

Bachelor's degree in Architecture, Engineering, Construction Management, or related field. Minimum two or more years' construction administration, architecture, engineering or similar experience.

Preferred experience with some data center infrastructure projects. Experience in mission critical data centers is a strong plus. Preferred experience with robotic process automation.

CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES

Working towards or eligible for licensure as either a Professional Engineer or Registered Architect is desired.

COMMUNICATION SKILLS

Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information.

FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE

Requires knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and/or commissions. Conducts basic financial analysis.

REASONING ABILITY

Ability to understand and carry out general instructions in standard situations. Ability to solve problems in standard situations. Requires intermediate analytical and quantitative skills.

OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES

Intermediate skills with Microsoft Office Suite. Ability to read and understand architectural drawings. Working knowledge in MS Project is helpful. Knowledge of leases, contracts, and construction practices preferred. 3+ years of minimum proficiency in the use of AutoCAD and Revit. Knowledge of Best Management Practices CAD/BIM environment. Autodesk Software - CAD BIM Solidworks BIM360 etc.

Basic knowledge of the entitlement/permitting process and construction delivery methods and agreements. Some familiarity with construction best practices, general building codes, and various building types and systems. Passion for being detail oriented and highly organized.

SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY

Decisions made with general understanding of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to co-workers and supervisor.

Catalent is a global, high-growth, public company, and a leading partner for the pharmaceutical industry in the development and manufacturing of new treatments for patients worldwide. Your talents, ideas, and passion are essential to our mission: to help people live better, healthier lives. Catalent is committed to a Patient First culture through excellence in quality and compliance, and to the safety of every patient, consumer and Catalent employee.

The ERP Data Conversion Analyst will support the global ERP business team strategy to implement and maintain ERP systems for all Global manufacturing sites of Catalent. The ERP Data Conversion Analyst will drive ERP operational excellence through continuous improvement initiatives.

Schedule: Monday – Friday

Remote - Must be within 50 miles of a Catalent site

The Role:

Supporting the ERP data conversion and deployment strategy by collaborating with IT and business team members to define site conversion approaches, requirements definition, gap assessment, and development, validation, and reconciliation of data

Coordinating and supervising of onshore/offshore data conversion resources

Monitoring performance and on-time completion of activities for file preparation and execution of loads

Ensuring completeness and compliance of all data conversion documentation

Providing technical and process support for ERP deployments and continuous improvement enhancements including some project management of timelines and status updates to leadership

Logging and communicating data conversion deliverables and risks to project team

Lead meetings, document minutes, and monitor action items

Other duties as assigned

JD Edwards database experience required

Advanced knowledge of Excel

Strong analytical capabilities preparing, analyzing, and presenting complex data to business and operations

Experience preparing data source files for conversion

Advanced Excel formula capabilities to consolidate, manipulate and transform data

Understanding of validation and change control documentation requirements

Experience executing validation and change control documentation

Ability to identify deviations and analyze root causes

Travel up to 10%

Why you should join Catalent:

Competitive medical benefits and 401K

19 days of PTO + 8 Paid Holidays

Dynamic, fast-paced work environment

Catalent offers rewarding opportunities to further your career! Join the global drug development and delivery leader and help us bring over 7,000 life-saving and life-enhancing products to patients around the world. Catalent is an exciting and growing international company where employees work directly with pharma, biopharma and consumer health companies of all sizes to advance new medicines from early development to clinical trials and to the market. Catalent produces more than 70 billion doses per year, and each one will be used by someone who is counting on us. Join us in making a difference.

The Data & Reporting Manager will facilitate data generation and reports, will implement protocols and processes to extract data efficiently and correctly, and support relevant team members. Job Description:

We are looking for a detail-oriented Data Entry Specialist to join our Venue Research team in Henderson, Nevada.

Who We Are

In 2007, two pretty sharp brothers decided to bootstrap a new business venture using their poker winnings to fund it. A week before inception, one brother got a fox red Labrador retriever puppy and named him Red. He quickly became the center of their universe and the name Red Dog Media was officially born.

Today, Red Dog Media focuses on internet marketing; specifically performance marketing, search engine marketing, landing page optimization, and conversion rate optimization. What started with four employees has grown to over 40 people over the past 15 years.

Culture + Core Values

Our core values are woven throughout our entire interview process in order to gauge whether a candidate is a good cultural fit. There are several initiatives that keep the core values at the forefront of our culture. A few examples are: being discussed in 6 month reviews; our employee appreciation program; and being an integrated part of our company’s operating system.

Our Core Values:

Be Curious - Having a high level of engagement; Digging into problems; Not being satisfied with good enough; Being open to new ideas; Not being a know-it-all.

Be a Problem Solver - This is what separates the doers from the dreamers. It’s about executing and getting the important stuff done. A problem solver prioritizes, organizes, and simplifies. They are detail-oriented to make sure it's done right.

Be a Championship Teammate - While a "team player" is collegial, a champion teammate is much more. They have the drive to succeed, work hard, come prepared, hold themselves accountable to high standards, elevate those around them, and are coachable.

Be Better Than Yesterday - Do you bring more skills to the table today than a year ago? How do you plan to be better a year from now? We work in a fast-paced competitive industry. If we stagnate, we’ll get left behind. This applies at the company and personal level. Growth and improvement need not be only in technical skill sets; personal growth can be even more valuable. We embrace positive change and stretch ourselves to grow both personally and professionally.

As part of the Market Data Services group, this individual will be responsible for the validation of information from third party sources and internal Putnam sources. The information will be specific to both fixed income and equity data required to support portfolio management, trading, research, client reporting and the portfolio construction process.



The data analyst will be required to work in Putnam’s Boston office and will have daily interaction with the aforementioned teams. The data analyst will be focused on security reference and analytical data for the universe of fixed income and equity securities held by Putnam and our respective benchmarks.



The data analyst will interface with external and internal data providers and will also have extensive contact with the investment teams in determining and resolving data requirements. The data analyst will also work closely with the systems groups in identifying and resolving issues. The data analyst will update and maintain data in various databases used by the investment teams and will coordinate resolutions of any problems in a timely manner.



This individual will be responsible for knowing what data the vendors provide as well as understanding how the data is used at Putnam. This individual is also responsible for doing analysis and testing when reviewing enhancements that may change any methodology or structures within our systems.

Strong orientation to and knowledge of investment management information needs
Strong attention to detail

Aptitude for data mining technologies
Excel, Access, SQL, ODBC

JOB SUMMARY

This role utilizes diverse skills to perform preventative maintenance and corrective repairs in a 24/7 Data Center operation working a 12-hr. shift schedule. The role also includes inspection of electrical and mechanical systems, including but not limited to: Uninterruptable Power Supply (UPS) systems, generators, chillers, Electrical Distribution, HVAC systems, and Building Management Systems (BMS) systems.

This position sits onsite in Papillion, NE.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Perform daily site inspections of all Mechanical & Engineering (M&E) systems and technical equipment, including servicing and maintenance.

Under general supervision, complete assigned work according to established processes and procedures in accordance with CBRE's Environment, Health and Safety Policy - ensuring all safety processes and PPE requirements are followed. Also, ensure all regulatory requirements and quality standards are met.

Oversee third-party vendors, ensuring compliance with CBRE's developed processes, procedures, and all applicable laws/regulations. Accompany vendors on site visits on an as needed basis and ensure site standards are met.

Help create and develop work processes, Job Hazard Analysis reports, and SOPs for critical work with risk assessment.

Complete all required training to ensure successful completion of all job-related responsibilities.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

No formal supervisory responsibilities are required in this position. Other tasks may require informal assistance such as providing technical guidance and/or training to coworkers. Additional coordination of work and assigning tasks may also be required, as needed.

CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES
None
COMMUNICATION SKILLS
Ability to comprehend and interpret instructions, short correspondence, memos and ask clarifying questions to ensure understanding. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to respond to common inquiries or complaints from clients, co-workers, and/or supervisor. Ability to effectively present information to an internal department and/or large groups of employees.
FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE
Ability to perform basic math skills is essential. Basic knowledge of financial terms and principles is helpful.
REASONING ABILITY
Ability to understand and carry out general instructions and to perform problem solving in workplace situations. Basic analytical skills are essential.
OTHER SKILLS and/or ABILITIES
Ability to work in a 24/7 12-hr shift schedule environment. Shift schedules are generally consistent but are subject to change based on business need and continuity of operations.
Basic knowledge/skills in the use of personal computer and smartphone.
General knowledge/ability using Microsoft Products (Word, Excel, etc.).

Beam Suntory is Crafting the Spirits that Stir the World. Rooted in two centuries of family heritage, Beam Suntory has evolved into the world's third largest leading premium spirits company ... where each employee is treated like family and trusted with legacy. With our greatest assets - our premium spirits and our people - we're driving growth through impactful marketing, innovation and an entrepreneurial spirit. Beam Suntory is a place where you can come Unleash your Spirit by making an impact each and every day.




The following position is open in Chicago, IL., - Data Scientist - Supply Planning




What makes this a great opportunity?




As a world leader in premium spirits, Beam Suntory inspires human connections. Consumers from all corners of the globe call for the company's brands, including the iconic Jim Beam and Maker's Mark Bourbon brands, Suntory Whisky Kakubin and Courvoisier Cognac, as well as world renowned premium brands including Knob Creek, Basil Hayden's and Legent Bourbon; Yamazaki, Hakushu, Hibiki and Toki Japanese Whisky; Teacher's, Laphroaig and Bowmore Scotch Whisky; Canadian Club Whisky; Hornitos and Sauza Tequila; EFFEN, Haku and Pinnacle Vodka; and Sipsmith and Roku Gin.




Beam Suntory was created in 2014 by combining the world leader in bourbon and the pioneer in Japanese whisky to form a new company with a deep heritage, passion for quality, innovative spirit and vision of Growing for Good. Headquartered in Chicago, Illinois, Beam Suntory is a subsidiary of Suntory Holdings Limited of Japan. Our culture is anchored deeply in a set of core values, including our East-Meets-West Culture, Yatte Minahare spirit, Giving Back to Society, Delighting Consumers, responsibly and Embracing Diversity & Inclusion.




Role Responsibilities




The Data Scientist – Supply Planning role combines a background in Sales & Operations Planning (Integrated Business Planning - IBP) with a deep understanding of data science. The Data Scientist will be self-motivated and exhibit excellent critical thinking skills, the ability to synthesize complex problems and create solutions. The ideal candidate will have more than just knowledge or skill set, as they also have a “can do" and “we over me” mindset to find solutions. This position will collaborate with the Supply Planning Analytics, S&OP CoE and Leadership, Regional S&OP teams, IT, and Commercial in the BUs across all three global regions to support the data and analytics needs for the implementation of the business transformation program.




CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

Partner with Global S&OP functional areas (Supply Planning, Commercial, and Fulfillment) to optimize our processes as part of the Global Supply Planning team.
Implement process improvement initiatives that drive improvements to the metrics and streamline the Supply Chain
Utilize a diverse array of technologies and tools as needed, to deliver insights, optimize processes, and develop automation
Manage the analytics platform, build capabilities, support global user adoption of analytics and process adherence, develop and maintain technical documentation; work closely with IT for Data Engineering
Work closely with the technical community to drive an SAP IBP team of business users globally, allowing for internal problem-solving capabilities, a high degree of end-user acceptance
Partner with the business to understand the market segmentation strategies and develop visualization, models using machine learning (e.g. classification, clustering, regression) incorporating ABC-XYZ segmentation, and statistical analysis methods such as time-series analysis, statistical inference
Desgin and integrate a global Inventory Management to provide end-to end Supply Chain visibility to Deep dive large into demand/supply planning and supply chain data to explain change, develop insights, and provide business recommendations to improve attainment, adherence, inventory management , and other key metrics.
Perform exploratory data analyses, generate and test working hypotheses, prepare and analyze historical data, and identify patterns
Lead and mentor a team of data scientists, and analysts
Process structured, unstructured and semi-structured data and apply data cleaning



Qualifications & Experience

Advanced Degree or equivalent experience in Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Statistics, Applied Mathematics
3-5+ years of experience with at least 2+ years in experience in a supply chain discipline with demonstrated End to End understanding of Supply Chain interdependencies for a CPG or Spirits company.
Excellent problem solving, analytical, written and verbal communication skills across many levels of the organization.
communications and presenting to senior leadership.
Experience with S&OP Planning tools like SAP IBP, SAP APO (DP and SNP) highly preferred
Experience with Google Cloud Platform, SAP HANA strongly preferred
Strong experience with Python/R, SQL, Power BI, Tableau
Experience with operations research, statistics, linear programming, constraint programming. 3+ years of hands-on experience in developing and deploying optimization, predictive and prescriptive, machine learning models
Ability to use collaborative programming tools like Git
Ability to manage multiple projects and prioritize competing requirements




At Beam Suntory, people are our number one priority, and we believe our people grow together in diverse and inclusive environments where their unique insights, experiences and backgrounds are valued and respected. All recruitment and hiring decisions are based on an applicant’s skills and experience.

Candidates must be local to New Albany/Columbus, OH area for consideration, and must possess the following skills:

Basic Qualifications:
Education: Bachelor degree in mathematics, operations research, applied statistics, economics, data science or a related quantitative discipline.

Experience: 3 years experience applying quantitative, business analytics, and computational skills.

Additional Requirements:
1) Competence with analytic software packages such as SAS, R, SPSS
2) Knowledge of database concepts and practices
3) Ability to work in a collaborative, team oriented environment
4) Ability to apply strong analytical and complex problem solving and critical thinking skills
5) Excellent oral and written communication skills.
6) Willingness for occasional travel

Preferred Qualifications
1) Master's degree in mathematics, operations research, applied statistics, data mining, data science or a related quantitative discipline
2) Experience with large data environments, such as Hadoop Experience with reporting tools such as Cognos or Tableau.

Description:

Job Summary: This position is responsible for working on data analysis projects that gather and integrate large volumes of data, performs analysis, interprets results, and develops actionable insights and recommendations for use across the company. This includes data mining, data auditing, aggregation, validation, reconciliation, and visualization.

Project 1
Assist with data cleaning and mapping substation assets (T-Lines, Battery, CB’s, UG Cables) into AHC Monitoring Software to improve the overall number of assets being scored, working our way to 100% of assets being scored inside the software. Create and implement an classification based algorithm that will help identify assets that can be mapped into APM software using their SN and manufacturing specs to increase the speed at which assets and their inputs are being brought into the software

Creation of new predictive analytics dashboard to be leveraged by planning and renewal teams for Condition Based Maintenance activities.

FOW AHC and Station PI mapping to IPS project
Design and lead the concept of AHC / Station PI points to be mapped to IPS in order to help the FOW team get the data need for Condition Based Inspection activities

This position must have a working knowledge of analytics and statistical software such as Power BI, SQL, R, Python, Excel, Hadoop, Tableau, SAS, SPSS, and others to perform analysis and interpret data.

Tasks: Utilize inquiry skills to obtain a clear understanding of business processes and needs. Work with stakeholders to determine value that additional information derived from proper analyses could provide Collaborate with Information Technology partners to develop data acquisition and data management practices.

Essential function: Provide meaningful, concise reporting of analytic results.

This process supports our marketing team and drives the majority of our company’s revenue.

Your day-to-day duties will range from diving in and processing actual prospect records before they are loaded to setting strategic goals for your team to ensure our prospect database continues to grow.

OTHER SKILLS and/or ABILITIES

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Job_description:
Don't want to sit at a desk all day? Want to serve your community? Like managing your own time?

Join our team! No Experience required, paid training provided!

About Vision Government Solutions

Vision Government Solutions is a leading high-tech firm providing cutting-edge software and services to the public sector. Our organization is at an incredible inflection point and we are looking for people to join our data collection team.

Why This Opportunity is Different

This is an incredible opportunity to grow and develop a career as many of our senior leadership team members started at Vision as data collectors. Learn the appraisal business from the ground-up with the largest firm in Pennsylvania.

Job Description

Immediately hiring Data Collectors in Clarion County with reliable transportation who are dependable, customer-service oriented and enjoy working outdoors. In this role, you would be responsible for inspecting, verifying and recording details of commercial and residential properties required for property valuation.

If you are looking for an opportunity to advance your career - Vision Government Solutions is the place for you. Our team takes pride in their work and many successful candidates have enjoyed long-term career growth with our company. NO EXPERIENCE NECESSARY - just dependability and a willingness to learn.

Job Responsibilities

Accurately record all required data on the collection form that will be pertinent to the valuation of the property.
Interact effectively and professionally with taxpayers to neutralize any misgivings on their part regarding the inspection process.
Anticipate unusual situations and make quick and responsible decisions.
Submit on a timely basis, accurate production and corresponding reports, such as timesheets, expense reports and other prescribed company documents.
Adhere to dress code.
Willing to travel to within Clarion County, PA.

Who We Are Looking For

The right person will have demonstrated the following skills and traits whether in their past or in the interview process:

Desire to learn and grow in the real estate appraisal field.
Incredible attention to detail to ensure only the most accurate data for later statistical analysis.
Strong communication skills with the ability to adapt to different stakeholders to ensure positive taxpayer experiences.
Exhibit the flexibility necessary to multi-task and perform contracted services in multiple communities as needed.
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to anticipate unusual situations and make quick and responsible decisions.
Spatial ability to read maps and locate a physical location on a map.
Ability to visualize floor plan footprints based on three-dimensional buildings.
Good math skills to calculate square footage, ratios, and similar functions.

Physical Requirements:

Ability to stand and walk for long periods of time (8-hour workday). Bending, stretching, and kneeling are part of the daily routine.
Climbing stairs and the ability to carry 5-10 lbs. of equipment throughout the workday is required.
Ability to work outdoors for long periods of time.
Must have a valid driver’s license and reliable transportation.
Must be able to pass background/MVR check.

Training Opportunity

All necessary mass appraisal training will be provided to the right candidate. We are willing to train motivated, hardworking individuals. Most importantly, you should enjoy working outdoors, and demonstrate qualities of reliability, accuracy, and consistency.

Relevant Experience

High School Degree (Required)

Pay starting at $17.00/hr.
Mileage reimbursement at $0.57 per mile
Flexible schedules
Benefits such as Medical, Dental, Vision and 401(k) with company match
Vacation, sick, and holiday pay

Premier Southwest Regional Engineering Services Company Seeks

DATA CENTER Building Engineer (Day Shift)

Looking to join a fast-growing team. Excellent benefits, great opportunities for advancement in a dynamic environment

Description

Paragon Services Engineering is looking for one highly motivated and experienced Engineer for a Mission Critical Data Center. This position requires an individual who is self-starter, team player, and have excellent people skills. This positions is expected to effectively operate and maintain the day to day engineering requirements of a Mission Critical Data Center to ensure zero downtime; while performing engineering, electrical, HVAC, and plumbing, repairs, and maintenance duties in support of the facility under the direction of the Chief Engineer and the Facility Manager.

We are committed to providing our customers with an exemplary service to operate and maintain their properties in a Class “A” condition. The Engineer position was established to provide these services at complex properties that require full time multiple engineering staff.

To accomplish this mission, the Engineer’s duties are to operate, monitor, and maintain the design criteria of the buildings operating systems and grounds. The Engineer shall report to the Chief Engineer and the Facility Manager, and they shall provide the following for their assigned projects:

Principal Job Duties:

Strong technical expertise and mechanical/electrical system knowledge is required for this position along with superior administrative, supervisory, and communication skills. Minimum 5+ years’ experience with Data Center Central Plant Operation, HVAC, Chillers, Towers, Boilers, CMMS, BMS/EMS, Switchgear, Generators, Static UPS, Switchgear, Battery Maintenance, Pre-action and Fire Suppression Systems, Chillers, CRAC & CRAH Units, Towers, Boilers, BMS/EMS, Lighting, General Maintenance, Controls, and Vendor Management. Knowledge of ADA, and OSHA is a requisite. Candidates must be fully competent with Microsoft Office Suite. Knowledge of National and Local Codes is required.

· Prepare, maintain and regularly review logs for repair, service, operation and complaints related to the equipment.

· Provide building owner with copies of engineering daily logs and periodic management reports.

· Supply building owner with recommendations for improvements and increased efficiency in the operation of the equipment.

· The overall safe operation and maintenance of all mechanical, electrical, plumbing and life safety equipment.

· Oversight of any other company personnel and vendors working at the building.

THIS POSITION REQUIRES WASHINGTON STATE RESIDENCY

Summary / Objective:

This position provides senior level development and support for Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) processes and utilities, including testing, implementing and maintaining EDI transactions. The Senior EDI Technical Analyst will leverage industry best practices, evaluate current state, and recommend, develop, implement and support new EDI vision and supporting processes. The position plays a key role in PSW’s strategy and will lead efforts in modernizing and rebuilding the EDI environment to support substantial growth. This position is expected to proactively identify opportunities to utilize technology to solve technical and business problems.

The Senior EDI Technical Analyst will analyze, evaluate and collaborate in the redesign of business, IT or operational processes and leads communications with trading partners for EDI transaction set-up and ongoing maintenance and support. The position monitors, resolve / troubleshoot and oversees scheduling of daily batch production jobs including job scheduling as required, maintaining accurate records of all production processing, problem resolution/escalation, and daily request processing. This position will conduct secure transfer of information to and from outside vendors.

Essential Functions:

· Replace manual and legacy procedures with industry best practices to support automation at scale and PSW’s long term strategy.

· Collaborates with others to understand current processes and create new processes and procedures.

Serves as primary resource of knowledge and experience as a technical contact for internal and external stakeholders on any EDI-related issue.
Monitors, audits and maintains interfaces between business systems to include interface between internal and external partners with key focus on Electronic Data Interface (EDI) processes.
Diagnoses EDI process problems of a complex nature, coordinating with other technical and/or business resources as necessary for assistance.
Leads company’s effort to define requirements for EDI applications.
Designs, develops, tests, and implements new software applications and EDI programs, maps, and processes through entire life cycle.
Independently participates in requirements documentation, business systems configuration and defining/execution of acceptance criteria. Document issues and participate in their resolution.
Oversees EDI & batch processes day-to-day to identify and address problems as they arise and to track levels of activity, compiling and tracking metrics for senior management.
Designs, configures, installs and maintains solutions for the administration of production system batch processes, including setup, configuration, installation and scheduling.
Responsible for creating best practices for related systems with supporting documentation and standard operating procedures.
Work closely with other teams to remediate all EDI issues, i.e. (server, network, database, etc.)
Works on prioritized incidents, enhancements, projects, code deployments, application upgrades, and performance testing support.
Participates in the IT Change Management process to lead, schedule and support EDI related changes.

Competencies:

Solid understanding of the EDI needs and processes of both small and large organizations with the ability to implement best-of-breed, enterprise-class solutions to support rapid growth.
Ability to document standard operating procedures and best practice to support environment of continuous improvement.
Working knowledge of EDI Formats: ANSI X12 (834, 837P/I, 835, 270/271, 276/277, 278N/R), XML, HC7, FHIR, and proprietary formats
Meticulous attention to detail; the ability to juggle several tasks in parallel without lowering your quality bar.
Proficient in creating, developing and producing mapping documents.
Solid understanding of business requirements and ability to apply supporting solutions.
Ability to translate business needs into high-level technical specifications and design.
Working knowledge of EDI configuration/solutions evaluation/ Validation and deployment.
Working knowledge of file transfer protocols including HTTPs, FTP, SFTP.
Knowledge of state, federal and local regulations concerning use, disclosure and confidentiality of all patient records including a strong knowledge of the HIPAA Privacy and Security Act.

Required Education and/or Work Experience:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, related field, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience is required.
5+ years of experience directly related and progressively responsible experience in EDI systems, preferably in a healthcare environment.
6 + years of experience in the development and/or support of software systems are required.
3+ years related experience including developing requirements, designing and executing test cases in IT
Hands-on X12 health care insurance transaction (834, 837, 270, 271, 999 etc.) data mapping and issue resolution experience
Experience with SQL, relational databases and Microsoft development tools, such as VB, VB Script, .NET or ASP.
Experience with QA methodology and problem-solving techniques/tools.
Experience with multi-tiered client-server and web-based applications.
Experience with working with developers and internal technical teams to develop and test EDI processes.

Preferred Education and/or Work Experience:

Knowledge of Medicare and Medicaid.
Experience creating EDI processes “from the ground up” in a small to mid-sized organization.
Experience with applying Agile Methods.
Experience with healthcare claims and billing file types.
Experience with Citra EZ-CAP or similar systems.
Understanding of health industry diagnosis, procedure and revenue codes and their application.
Experience writing complex SQL scripts.
Understanding of EDI 834 enrollment transactions, including Adds, Changes, Terminations, Cancellations, and error processing.

Company Description

Bosch Charleston is a part of a global network with close to 400,000 associates who make products that are “Invented for Life.”

The Bosch Charleston plant has a long history in the Lowcountry and was established in 1974. We Drive. to provide a safe and inspiring environment for our associates. We make a difference and delight our global customers by creating state of the art products.

Over the past five years we have contributed over 1 million USD to Science, Technology, Engineering and Math (STEM) and environmental organizations in the Lowcountry through the Bosch Community Fund. Additionally, Bosch Charleston works closely with our partners to support these initiatives through volunteerism. There are many opportunities to get involved and we hope you will join us as we make a difference in the Lowcountry.

BOSCH is a proud supporter of STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics) Initiatives


FIRST Robotics (For Inspiration and Recognition of Science and Technology)


AWIM (A World In Motion)

Job Description

Product Data Management specialist to ensure implementation of engineering changes per Bosch Business Mobility (BBM) product release procedures. Identify, manage, and track project specific Change Requests (external and internal) from creation, through implementation and close. Ensure maintenance of product master data throughout the product lifecycle.

Scope & Responsibilities



Coordinate Engineering C hange M anagement (ECM) process throughout the Charleston Value Streams.
Key member of Engineering Change Management Review Team (RT), steering and consulting side by side with Engineering and Quality Leads.
Approve Engineering Change Requests (ECRs), Planning and Final Review, as plant representative.
Support Value Streams Teams with internal ECR Kick-Off Meetings while ensuring adherence to ECM guidelines.
Increase transparency of ECM by maintaining a comprehensive change overview and reporting across various levels of the organization as needed.
Define, support, and deploy ECM training across the teams as necessary.
Share best practices across products and regions, with critical eye to ensure lean and effective ECM.
Prepare and distribute monthly reports.
Ensure update of material masters, bill of materials, and other product data.

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications

Bachelor's degree required, engineering or technical discipline preferred.

Preferred Qualifications

Self-driven, high energy and proactive with strong motivational skills who can lead teams toward a common goal.

Product life cycle experience.

company: Florida Department of Financial Services - Division of Rehabilitation and Liquidation
Job_description:
About Us

The Division of Rehabilitation and Liquidation (Division) is one of 13 divisions within the Florida Department of Financial Services. It serves as the Receiver of insurance companies that are placed in receivership, primarily for purposes of rehabilitation or liquidation. Under an order of rehabilitation, the Receiver seeks to remedy the problems that resulted in the company being placed into rehabilitation. In liquidation, the Receiver collects all assets of the company and ultimately distributes the available assets to claimants under a statutory prioritization. In both instances, the Receiver is responsible for conducting business on behalf of the company that has been placed in receivership. This process entails providing an array of services which include Accounting, Asset Recovery, Claims, Legal, Information Technology, Administrative Services and Estate Management functions.

Position Summary:

The Division is seeking a Senior Database Analyst. This position is responsible for performing complex analysis of database systems including planning, design, maintenance, and development. The duties and responsibilities of this position include the following:

Performs company data analysis and conversion into Division’s systems. Coordinates with receivership company IT staff to obtain necessary data.
Coordinates data transmissions from Division’s systems to external entities (e.g. Guaranty Associations).
Identifies data sources, constructs data decomposition diagrams, provides data flow diagrams and documents the process.
Develops reusable code and procedures to streamline data conversion and insure data quality.
Develops integration between internal business applications at the database level.
Evaluates user's request for new data elements and systems against the existing shared data environment.
Coordinates use of the organization's data to ensure data integrity and control redundancy.
Establishes database design techniques using data modeling and prototyping software.
Analyzes and proposes changes to database structures.
Develops and maintains data dictionary ensuring uniformity of definitions and standards for use of data dictionary.
Works with infrastructure team to determine necessary database security.
Travels as required.
Support disaster recovery efforts.
Performs other related duties as required.

Salary Range:

The hiring salary range for this position is$70,000.00 – $80,000.00 per year.

Minimum Qualifications:

A bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in computer science, computer engineering, management information systems, information systems, engineering, or mathematics and three years of experience in database design and development, computer software development, management information systems, web design, information systems; or
Professional experience as described may substitute on a year-for-year basis for the required education.

Preferences:

Preference may be given to applicants with experience in one or more of the following areas:

Microsoft SQL Server and SQL scripting
Relational database design and development
Data analysis and conversion techniques
Extensive knowledge of data integration and processing including extraction, transformation and loading.
Data Quality system/software from Informatica or similar Data Quality tool
Microsoft Visual Studio programming

Employment Requirements:

In compliance with federal law, individuals selected for hire will be required to confirm their identity and eligibility to work in the United States.
In accordance with Florida Statutes 110.1128, the Division must verify male applicants have registered with the Selective Service System or have proof of registration exemption to be eligible for employment or promotion with the Division. If registration or exemption cannot be verified, male applicants are not eligible for hire. If currently employed by the Division, this law prohibits the promotion of such person. This requirement also applies to any male who has legally or illegally entered the United States. To check the status of your registration, obtain proof of exemption, review requirements for transgender people, or for general information about the Selective Service System, please visit www.sss.gov.

Why Join Our Team?

The vision of the Receiver is to be a recognized and respected leader in the efficient administration of insurance receiverships. To accomplish this goal, the Receiver is comprised of a talented workforce that is dedicated to providing quality service that maximizes value for the public. Joining our team will provide the opportunity to experience the following benefits:

A welcoming and open environment that fosters a sense of belonging, purpose and innovation.
Meaningful and challenging work that improves the quality of life for the citizens of Florida.
Shared values of service, teamwork, excellence, accountability, diversity, innovation and integrity.
A comprehensive benefit package that includes medical, dental, vision, life and other supplemental insurances, retirement and flexible spending accounts, front-loaded paid time off, and more.
A culture that supports flexible work schedules, community service and the recognition of employee contributions.
A commitment to training and development through continuous education and collaboration.

For more information, please visit our website at http://www.myfloridacfo.com/division/receiver/.

How to Apply:

Resumes can be submitted through one of the below methods. The information must be received by the position’s closing date and time.

Mail or Hand Delivery: 325 John Knox Road, Atrium Building Suite 101, Tallahassee, Florida 32303.
If you require an accommodation to participate in the application process due to a disability, please call (850) 413-4546 for assistance.

Equal Opportunity Employer

Pay: $70,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year

Dental insurance
Employee assistance program
Flexible spending account
Health insurance
Life insurance
Paid time off

Monday to Friday

Business Analyst

Department: Application Support

Location: 302 Main Street Catskill, NY 12414

Reports to: VP, Application Support Officer

Supervises: None

Grade:

FLSA: Exempt

Position Purpose

The Business Analyst is responsible for the review, analyze, and evaluate processes, systems, and user needs for planned projects based on the business plan. The Business Analyst is involved in the development of business cases, facilitation of analysis workshops, the selection of the most effective solution and the definition and management of User Acceptance Testing (UAT) to ensure operational and IT deliverables meet the requirements of the Bank.

The Business Analyst assists the IT staff in understanding the Bank’s operational needs for both automated and manual solutions to business systems and procedures. The analyst is involved in planning, organizing, and conducting detailed management analytical studies to define problems, identify deficiencies and improve solutions which impact the Bank’s effectiveness and provide the basis for management decision.

Problems and Challenges

The relationship between the Bank, its internal functions, and relationships with its customers and suppliers is within the scope of this position. A working knowledge of the computer hardware and operating system software, which is the center of the Bank’s information technology and business services activities, must be understood by the business analyst. It is extremely important to the Bank that the business services systems offer the highest reliability and performance possible. The business analyst is challenged to assist the Bank in maintaining, upgrading, and troubleshooting the business services solutions that are or could be implemented.

Essential Position Functions

Principal Accountabilities

Performs requirements gathering and analysis to include: analytical techniques, interview techniques, data gathering techniques, current system documentation, business modeling methods, business process, rules and logic, data gathering to solve complex issues, development of implementation plans, development of requirements, JAD sessions and key analytical troubleshooting.
Partners with users to gather all requirements to formulate business specifications and translating those into business functionality.
Work with users to create solutions that support Key Performance Indicators (KPI) within the using organization.
Documenting workflows and results of business analysis and obtaining sign-off from users on specifications.
Assists the technical team in translating application functionality into application architecture and the production of a business functionality requirements statement.
Communicates the business directives, goals, and needs to the technical team and serving as a business interface from the Bank’s operational management team managing expectations and defining business satisfaction metrics.
Designs and executes test plans to ensure that business requirements and functional specifications are implemented properly and meet ROI objectives.
Understands the long-term business objectives and suggesting strategies to meet those objectives; introducing innovation to business processes through technology if appropriate.
Assists the staff in developing content or other materials; recommending enhancements and identifying new business requirements
Applies knowledge of system capacity to determine the feasibility of projects.
Maintains current knowledge of new hardware and software and recommends upgrading to maintain efficient operation.
Works with IT team and programmers, as necessary.
Performs analysis of department production and redesigns workflow if appropriate.
Develops, edits, and maintains operating procedures and standards manuals.
Serves as a business analyst in work measurement, system studies or cost/effectiveness analysis.
Directs the activities of the Forms/Graphic Designer and departmental secretarial support in maintaining an effective user-support relationship.
Aids as required to organizations outside of the Bank to improve internal procedures that may be advantageous to the Bank.
Conducts training sessions to implement new or improved systems and procedures.
Conducts meetings at all management levels for presentations, reviews, approvals of recommendations, etc.
Performs at or above performance standard and specifically for procedures development and analysis.
Assumes additional responsibilities as assigned.
Recognizes and identifies potential areas where existing Bank services policies and procedures require change, or where new ones need to be developed, and make recommendations in these areas.
Fulfills departmental requirements in providing work coverage and administrative notification during periods of personal illness, vacation, or education.

Authority

Structure priorities of function to be completed.
Initiate policies and procedures.
Monitor and analyze business services system performance.
Develop and maintain business services system problem analysis and resolution techniques.
Analyze and resolve problems quickly and efficiently as they relate to Bank services.
Support applications and operations with business management relating to the business services area.
Evaluate the hardware and software vendor and third-party hardware and software and report significant findings regarding business services applications to the Information Technology Team.
Evaluate cloud computing providers and solutions.

Contacts

This position requires contact with business and IT support personnel within the Bank. Within the bank, contacts will be made with application and operations staff, and occasionally with Bank personnel outside of IT for troubleshooting and the development of specifications relating to business services software.

Position Requirements

Personal qualities: resourcefulness, responsibility, tenacity, independence, energy, and self-confidence, strong analytical skills, solid business judgment, creativity, and the ability to communicate effectively with executive management
Strongly prefer a BS or BA level degree in computer science, business administration, operations engineering, or related field
5 years of supervisory, administrative or systems procedures analysis experience, three in the business services area is required as well
Experience in areas of Banking operations (i.e. work simplification, work measurement techniques/skills)
Ability to express complex technical concepts effectively, both verbally and in writing
Analytical and organizational skills
Ability to work independently with limited supervision
Knowledge of office automation, Information Technology techniques, and practices, forms, and records management
Ability to work well with people from different disciplines with varying degrees of technical experience.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $60,000.00 per year

401(k)
401(k) matching
Dental insurance
Flexible schedule
Health insurance
Health savings account
Life insurance
Paid time off

Full-time

JOB SUMMARY
This role oversees the operations and development of a team of Critical Environment engineers onsite, ensuring they provide both Preventative Maintenance (PM) and Repair Services to the Client & their customers onsite (within agreed Service Level Agreement). Also, assists the client's Data Center Manager, providing support for Data Center operations. Provide on-site support for the provision and maintenance of Critical Environment services.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Manage unforeseen circumstances that occur and provide relevant feedback to Client / CBRE management where necessary.

Mentor & motivate the Critical Environment team, providing them with regular feedback to ensure they continually improve. Identify areas for training where necessary.

Overall responsibility for Configuration Management (CM)MS Work Orders, Preventative Maintenance (PM), Configuration Management (CM), or Repairs within the agreed SLA timeframe, or escalate if issues cannot be resolved promptly.

Overall responsibility to ensure the completion of:
Facility infrastructure equipment installations within the agreed SLA timeframe and to applicable internal, manufacture and industry standards.
Information Technology equipment power installations, relocation and decommission requests within the agreed SLA timeframes and to applicable internal, manufacture and industry standards.
Daily routine checks and cleanup of the data halls and record their findings.
Mechanical and Electrical troubleshooting support (chiller, Computer Room Air Conditioning (CRAC), Computer Room Air Handler (CRAH), Uninterruptible Power Supply (UPS), Power Distribution Unit (PDU), Static Transfer Switches (STS), etc.)

Ensure all deployments are installed to applicable internal, manufacture and industry standards.

Ensure that all records are updated following any changes made and that documentation is also kept up to date for all applicable processes.

Ensure that Method Statements and Risk Assessments are prepared and used for all tasks, providing safe working practices at all times.

Overall responsibility to manage relationship with Client, working with other CBRE stakeholders to ensure all MSA requirements are met.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES
Provides formal supervision to individual employees within single functional or operational area. Recommends staff recruitment, selection, promotion, advancement, corrective action and termination. Plans and monitors appropriate staffing levels and utilization of labor, including overtime. Prepares and delivers performance appraisal for staff. Mentors and coaches team members to further develop competencies. Leads by example and models behaviors that are consistent with the company's values.

#INDSJ
QUALIFICATIONS
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE
High School Diploma/GED required; Bachelor's Degree preferred. 6-8 years of experience in mechanical or electrical engineering, preferred.

Experience of leading and motivating a Critical Environment Team. Accredited training in the installation of DC Facilities Infrastructure and Building Management System (BMS), preferred.

Experience of leading and motivating a Critical Environment Team. A proven knowledge of Critical Facility or DC equipment and their components including UPS, PDU, STS, EG, CRAC, CRAH , etc.

A strong understanding of the Data Center environment, and the working restrictions applicable to such environments.

CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES
None

COMMUNICATION SKILLS
Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information.
Ability to respond effectively to sensitive issues.

FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE
Requires advanced knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and commissions. Conducts advanced financial analysis.

REASONING ABILITY
Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret complex documents. Ability to solve problems involving several options in situations. Requires advanced analytical and quantitative skills.

OTHER SKILLS and/or ABILITIES
Experience in a financial setting working with billing and payables; prior experience using a
financial system; and, the ability to use Microsoft Excel.
Ability to comprehend and interpret instructions, short correspondence, and memos and ask clarifying questions to ensure understanding.
Ability to write routine reports and correspondence.
Ability to respond to common inquiries or complaints from clients, co-workers, and/or supervisor.
Ability to effectively present information to an internal department and/or large groups of employees.

SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY
Decisions made with thorough understanding of procedures, company policies, and business practices to achieve general results and deadlines. Responsible for setting work unit and/or project deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to department.

#INDSJ

We have a long-standing commitment to providing equal employment opportunity to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, veteran status, political belief, or any other basis protected by applicable law. We also provide reasonable accommodations, as needed, throughout the job application process. CBRE GWS
CBRE Global Workplace Solutions (GWS) works with clients to make real estate a meaningful contributor to organizational productivity and performance. Our account management model is at the heart of our client-centric approach to delivering integrated real estate solutions. Each client is entrusted with a dedicated leader and is supported by regional and global resources, leveraging the industry's most robust platform. CBRE GWS delivers consistent, measurably superior outcomes for our clients at every stage of the lifecycle, and across industries and geographies.

Part-Time Data Entry Analyst - Solvas Financial Technology

Work you'll do
This is a part-time syndicated loan data entry analyst opportunity supporting the Solvas|Digitize Managed service. Job duties include:

Review syndicated loan notices for manual extraction and data input
Review automated data extraction results
Speed and accuracy when reviewing and/or inputting data
Ability to work independently and without direct supervision while adhering to strict deadlines
Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment
Strong communication skills (both verbal and through email communication)
Excellent analytical skills, attention to detail, and strong organizational skills
This is temporary, hourly position with core hours between 4:00 a.m. and 7:00 p.m. (EST), although other hours may be required based on business need.
Shifts are scheduled in minimum of 4 hour increments and a minimum of 8 hours is expected during peak days (typically 2 - 3 days per month)
The days worked per month are typically 3 to 10 days only. (This is not a regular part-time position and there are regular hours .) Working days are based exclusively on business needs and are expected to be variable.

The Team

Our Financial Technology practice develops and licenses a growing family of proprietary software products and service solutions (see www.deloitte.com/ft ) to assist financial institutions with a number of complex topics such as accounting for credit deteriorated assets and the administration of investments in leveraged loans.

We are looking to add professionals to support our Solvas|Digitize™ solution team ( www.solvasdigitize.com ). Solvas|Digitize is an intelligent automation solution and managed service that is experiencing rapid growth and expansion across various industries and applications.

Proficiency with all current technology and Microsoft Office 365 programs, including, but not limited to:
Laptop functionality
Video conferencing software (i.e. Zoom, Microsoft Teams, and Skype)

Microsoft Teams
Online software programs for data entry
Flexibility in terms of work hours and workdays is required
Ability to find specific data points based on guidance/logical reasoning
Syndicated loan experience is preferred, but is not required
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future

For individuals assigned and/or hired to work in Washington State, Deloitte is required by law to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. At Deloitte, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. Part-time, hourly basis with core hours between 4:00 a.m. and 7:00 p.m. Eastern Standard Time on specific days of each month based on business need. Occasional weekend and holiday coverage will be required.

Location

Action oriented and seizes opportunities

POSITION DESCRIPTION

Government Grant Data Analyst/Database Administrator, works under the general supervision of the Director of Grants. This role is responsible for creation of reports, dashboards, and other visualizations on data associated with grant awards and projects and business processes to provide insights in support of decision-making efforts. The Grant Data Analyst works as a liaison with departments and Elected Officials to coordinate data capture of all direct and subrecipient data and required reporting. The Analyst also coordinates the capture, transfer, sharing, integration and implementation of data systems, add-ons, plug-ins and bridges. This role is responsible for coordination of database and repository centralizing all federal awards.

ROLES AND RESPONSIBLITIES

Analyzing data using statistical techniques and providing reports. Developing and implementing databases and data collection systems. Acquiring data from primary and secondary sources and maintain data systems Identifying, analyzing, and interpreting trends or patterns in complex data sets Filtering and cleaning data Maintain record of all grant operating department business processes and controls Suggest and implement approved tracking mechanisms to assist in convergence of data from current spreadsheets to database and upcoming ERP system. Locating and defining new process improvement opportunities Evaluates financial reports and performance reports makes escalate concerns to management regarding trends and potential negative impacts. Assist in the evaluation of the effectiveness of grants, compliance with federal regulations, federal agencies, and specific grant contract provisions. Monitors funded projects to prevent over-expenditure of funds; audit disallowance and ensure awards are fully expended. Evaluates grant expenditure agreements to differentiate between sub-recipients or contractors. Analyzes internal and external financial reports, including single audits. Assist in the set-up of electronic database and repository. Maintains electronic database and repository for efficient data collection and report production. Monitors and report the spending of awards, budget adjustments, contract amendments, grant match and cost allocation plans. Assists in the reduction and elimination of findings and questions regarding costs. Performs special project analysis as requested. Reconciles reported revenues and expenditures to the general ledger for grant and prepares the necessary journal entries for correction and posting. Communicates reminders to departments receiving monies of report submission deadlines and when the grant period will expire and/or when an extension maybe needed. Coordinate with external auditors for financial or audit support requests. Other duties as assigned by the Division Director of Grants and Contracts.

JOB SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS

Economics and Accounting Knowledge of economic and governmental accounting principles and practices, the financial markets, banking and the analysis and reporting of financial data.
Administration and Management Knowledge of business and management principles involved in strategic planning, resource allocation, human resources modeling, leadership technique, production methods, and coordination of people and resources.
Mathematics Knowledge of arithmetic and their applications. Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst, Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques, Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks), Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc), Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy, Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
Customer and Personal Service Knowledge of principles and processes for providing customer and personal services. This includes customer needs assessment, meeting quality standards for services, and evaluation of customer satisfaction.
English Language Knowledge of the structure and content of the English language including the meaning and spelling of words, rules of composition, and grammar. Law and Government Knowledge of laws, legal codes, court procedures, precedents, government regulations, executive orders, agency rules, and the democratic political process.
Grant Lifecycle Knowledge of the linear lifecycle that includes discovering, creating and programing the funding opportunity, applying, making award decisions, and successfully implementing the award.

Education

Bachelor’s degree in Information Management, Statistics, Business, Accounting, Computer Science, or related field and/or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
(5-6) years of professional accounting experience, governmental preferred, with a minimum of (4) years of grant administration, data analytics and auditing of state funded grant programs, within a governmental entity.
SQL Microsoft Suite including SQL Server and BI, Python, SAS, Oracle

Under guidance from the Director of Information Technology, the Business Analyst II position has primary responsibility for the operation, troubleshooting, and maintenance of the College’s Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system and its integrations with external systems to support the College’s business processes. This position is primarily distinguished from the Business Analyst I position in that it has primarily responsibility in many areas and requires a higher degree of technical expertise.

Key Duties & Responsibilities

Participate in the regular operation of the ERP system by:
Creating and maintaining the Production Calendar
Executing tasks assigned to IT in the Production Calendar
Chairing the ERP Steering Committee
Performing advanced user account management, including creating new roles and modifying permissions for existing roles
Creating and modifying complex reports
Creating and maintaining documentation of existing business processes and technical workflows
Assist with first-level support for business process and technical workflow issues within the ERP system and, when necessary, escalating business process issues to vendor support or consultants and technical workflow issues to the Systems Programmer Analyst
Participate in initiatives and projects to improve, upgrade, and create new functionality within the ERP system by:
Analyzing existing business processes to identify opportunities for automation or otherwise improving efficiency
Developing Functional Requirements for business processes and Technical Requirements for technical workflow
Serving on ERP-related project teams throughout the project lifecycle:
Initiation
Planning
Executing (in both test and production environments)
Monitoring and Controlling (largely through User Acceptance Testing)
Closing
Training users on the implementation of new or improved processes within the ERP system
Keeping abreast of vendor roadmaps, emerging technologies, and changes in requirements within the California Community College system
As needed, assist or backup the Systems Analyst Programmer

Bachelor’s Degree OR Associate’s Degree and a minimum of two year’s equivalent experience in business analysis
Knowledge of and experience with:
Business processes associated with Accounting, Admissions and Records, Financial Aid, Human Resources, and\or Student Services
Microsoft Office applications, particularly Word and Excel
Business analysis tools and techniques such as Business Process Modeling (BPM) and SWOT
Database Management Systems such as Oracle or Microsoft SQL Server
Enterprise reporting and scheduling tools

Work independently after receiving direction
